author: {'steamid': '76561198072269691', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 275, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1711787546}
review:
打折买的key, 不推荐, 原因如下:
- 没继续更新
- 卡池非常的少, 构筑流派有些困难, 导致乐趣速减

如果你考虑要玩的话:
- 注意查卡自己有什么牌的组牌界面那里, 英雄的详情上面有个银色的圆币图标, 点开可以看到这个英雄的任务, 任意关卡完成任务可以解锁新卡, 这个新卡不在平时查看的牌册里. 
这些个任务可能就是这个游戏后面游玩的乐趣点了, 比如讨论版大家在分析如何让阿拉贡一回合动8次....

综上我的个人评价是不推荐. 除非你是重度卡牌迷, 能忍受这种卡池特别小的情况下去组牌.
我曾有过基础版魔戒lcg, 虽说这个规则有简化...个人还是推荐找朋友去桌游模拟器玩吧, pve卡牌里值得关注的一款游戏.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018797887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1645573859}
review:
This is one of those caveat reviews. If you kinda enjoy digital card games, or if you heavily enjoy Lord of the Rings, this might be for you. If fall into the second category mostly, so this is, in fact, for me. But, there's a large audience out there that, even if enjoying either of the given subjects, might not be into this game.
The thematic is really cool, and there's a decent amount of proper, good voice acting done in the game. The rules of the game are rather intriguing too. There's multiple factions (i.e. card sets) to pick from, which can be combined - the game allows for 3 hero cards for each deck, each hero having their own faction/colour, dictating what cards can be used. There's persistent effects on board that can be individually dealt with, providing for a large array of encounters and "boss" battles. Each unit has two types of attack, either of which can be interacted with and provides multiple ways of dealing with said encounters.
And the card amount is decent too, all of which are related to LotR in some way, as one would expect. I definitely enjoyed that.
The story isn't even half bad, though I wouldn't presume anyone to play the game for the story, if the base gameplay doesn't seem interesting.
All that said, I finished the base campaigns and felt like I got enough. I didn't much care for challenges or the such as further content.

For some, this might not be a big enough game, or it might be too much of a nice. If you do enjoy out-of-the-box game design ideas, especially in the digital card game genre, or even if you care for interactive, game-ified stories, give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198995387103', 'num_games_owned': 6510, 'num_reviews': 3379, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1704867241}
review:
76入库，对不起，差评。
7.6入库，谢谢你，好评。

[h3]战斗中角色对话没有字幕和翻译，术语翻译不统一，描述不准确，请校对。we need Tra best.[/h3]


翻译尚可（后来发现还是不行，影响体验，改差评了），卡牌构建，指环王粉7.6内推荐入库。特色是事件进度机制（人物攻击分攻击点和进度攻击点，进度攻击点攻击事件可加快事件进度，而非看回合数来计算事件进度）；回合计算方式不同；看商店页面有合作共斗，这点在卡牌类游戏里是少有的，这点好评。看到因为回合数计算方式不同差评的，觉得没必要，毕竟要创新和不同嘛。联机看上去是只有类似局域网的联机，不是像炉石样的联机；商店页面显示要额外账号才能游玩，实际不用，这点也好评；商店页面显示有dlc，但是没有看到购买选项，不知是不是免费合并到本体了；商店页面显示无云存档，实际有，好评。

cpu烧了，规则好繁琐，上手门槛有点高；再加上翻译问题，术语不统一，描述不准确，看的晕，搁置了。

特有规则或键位备忘：回合分休整回合（休整回合至少回三费，至少抽一张牌，有些技能可在此时使用），普通回合（轮次）；普通回合内分若干小回合，多数动作都费一个小回合。加护技能是嘲讽近战单位，并全反伤，触发后消失；角色有该技能时登场自动使用，到休整回合自动恢复；若手动使用的消耗一回合中的一小回合。远程技能无视加护，可对空（即对飞行，飞行可对飞行，近战不能对空）。... ...规则繁琐，估计这里写不下。

202401，steam，steam掉卡抵扣，daily indie game，indie gala，fanatical，hxxxx，t a o宝，支付宝红包，杉果，它处自定义包入的本体约6元。爱人如己，目前就这，看以后追评。有中文的游戏请耐心自研体验乐趣，攻略指南尽量不用。不建议使用外挂，插件，作弊之类的，游戏都要这样搞，那现实里那更是如此了。兄弟萌，强烈建议不要第三方平台的小店买y u额，通过饰品等挂steam市场转的，高概率red信乃至封号，且行且珍惜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198114221912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1616619250}
review:
Alright, listen up, folks. Let me break it down for you – this game, I stumbled upon it expecting an authentic LOTR LCG experience, but boy, was I in for a surprise. Forget about the faithful port – it's more like a distant cousin.

But hold on, it's not all doom and gloom. The game has its merits. The visuals, voiceovers, illustrations – they've poured love into it. However, don't mistake it for a replica; treat it as its own beast.

Now, here's where it gets interesting. Difficulty and duration – I took on the Shire Pack, crafted my own deck, no special packs, no valor cards. It took me a good 2 hours to conquer the first quest at normal difficulty. 

Now, the price model – it had its hiccups, but it's almost entirely free now. Earn valor by slaying quests, spend it on cards. Simple. No need to sell your soul.

Let's talk narrative – the icing on the Middle Earth cake. Large illustrations, voiced narrators, Gollum chattering away – it's movie-quality stuff. And the writing? Top-notch. Card illustrations are a treat, but the templates – a bit much.

Mechanics, my friend – the heart of the matter. Heroes generating threat, fate coming into play – it's a dance. It's not as simple as "put all your powerful heroes in and forget about threat." There's depth here, especially on challenge difficulty.

Now, let's not ignore the elephant in the room – the card collection. Not enough cards, and deck building feels like a kiddie pool instead of the deep end. They better fix that.

In a nutshell – give it a go, it's free. But don't get your wallet involved. It's a flirtation with Middle Earth, not a long-term relationship. They tried to cash in on the name but fell short. Stick to the original, my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075419215', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1704552224}

author: {'steamid': '76561198131579329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1701920669}
review: Game was bought by a second studio (Antihero Studios) after the first (Asmodee Digital) decided to sell it. However, after getting a road map and more Antihero inexplicably dropped off and abandoned it. The game was left in an incomplete state and is more the ruins of something that could have been great than any actual product. As someone who has the physical edition and played it religiously I'm sad that Antihero just left us like this. It's an incredible game but I would NOT recommend buying it in this state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080371220', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 3536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3509, 'last_played': 1705614541}
review:
This is one of my favourite games of all time.
It fits so perfectly well into the Lord of the Rings universe because due to the greatly executed storytelling it feels more like an interactive novel then "just" a card game.

The soundtrack is world class as well.

Easy recommendation, but be warned: You can not get all achievements and the game sadly got abandoned eventhough more content was promised!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091314506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1699380648}
review:
Я не играл в настолку, но мне очень нравятся компьютерные адаптации настольных игр, поэтому "отчего бы и не попробовать?" - решил я. Почитал отзывы, негативные моменты меня не отпугнули и вот он момент - нырнуть в мир эпичного фэнтези. Но это я запустил другую игру. А что в итоге с Властелином колец? Ну начать стоит с того, что эти истории (я  говорю о трех основных кампаниях) определенно имело смысл называть скорее "Хоббит. Приключенческая игра". Несмотря на любимых многими героев, мы не затрагиваем напрямую события "Властелина колец", масштаб совершенно не тот. Это не эпическое фэнтези, а походы партии 3-5 уровней в днд. Опять-таки, я бы с удовольствием поиграл в это, если бы не каноничные герои. Представьте себе Элронда, занимающегося расследованием краж в хоббитском городенке (я не шучу). Начало кампейна выглядело неплохо - спасение Бильбо от пауков выглядело как неплохая завязка. Завязка.... завязка... Мы весь первый кампейн спасаем Бильбо от пауков? Конечно, не весь. Пауки, оказывается, похищают путников для орков (что?). И вот мы узнали, что есть орочий лидер, который набирает рабов для некроманта. Ок, шатко-валко сюжет начинает двигаться. Дальше начинаются чистые мультики - побеждаем главаря орков, он убегает. Подобная ситуация повторяется раза три. Во втором кампейне мы снова его встречаем и, так как это очень-супер-мега-важно, убиваем его. Но, как оказалось, он опять притворился и убежал. Ладно, как у молодого ГМа все здесь шито белыми нитками, все-таки сюжет кое-как продолжает развиваться. И вот мы уже встречаем Радагаста и вместе с ним пытаемся противостоять некроманту. Сразу готовьтесь, что не все герои созданы для всех кампейнов. Например, в финальном бою бить некроманта в лицо нельзя, вся партия дружно делает Радагасту массаж и мотивирует его все-таки выиграть в бою, поэтому, например, суровый боевой отряд просто огребет. Ладно, со всеми расшарками это кое-как тянет на историю. Тучи сгущаются, наверное, я так, чисто предположу, стоит связаться с кем-то из разбирающихся в том, что происходит... А, нет, нужно ехать в Бри, искать, расческу, которую украли у одного из местных хоббитов, а потом расследовать убийство. Серьезно? Даже при том, что история снова начинает закручиваться, это одна из самых нелепых склеек, которые мне встречались в произведениях. 

Что касается игротехнических моментов - во многих комментариях их описали достаточно верно. Это не суперуспех, но и не  провал - игра довольно середнечковая. Но с наценкой за громкое название.  Не рекомендую ее покупать без скидок, есть масса более интересных по исполнению и более живых игр. 

Из хороших моментов (хоть и спорных) хочу отметить чтецов. Литературные вставки между событиями озвучены, прочитаны весьма неплохо. Как будто прикасаешься к книге. Правда, не Толкиеновской, но тем не менее. 

В целом, на фоне последних опробованных игр, эта скорее не понравилась. Вы можете найти много более качественного контента на просторах стима.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978869541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1693329253}
review: Petit jeu de carte sympathique et complet à l'heure actuelle. Le design des cartes rappelle hearthstone.  Pour l'expérience solo, le jeu offreune pléthore de cartes, puis 3 campagnes de 5 chapitres. Auquel s'ajoute un mode bataille aléatoire pour tester ses decks, un mode "aventure" avec le rohan que je n'ai pas encore essayé, et 3 "rencontres" qui sont des quêtes à la difficulté particulièrement elevée. En somme il y a de quoi faire ! Comptez déjà 15 h pour finir les campagnes qui sont retorts (j'ai échoué plusieurs fois dans les dernières quêtes, même en jouant à la difficulté la plus simple !). Je n'ai pas testé le multi. Je recommande aux amoureux de Tolkien et autres deck builder. Petite précision, des anciennes critiques parlaient d'un jeu avec des micro transactions ect. Sachez que ce n'est plus le cas, vous avez accès à tout en achetant le jeu. Il faudra juste y jouer pour gagner de la monnaie in game (gratuite) et débloquer les cartes.

review:
优点：
任务开始前的人物配音和插图很好地还原了指环王/霍比特人的场景，粉丝觉得很贴心
界面和卡牌设计的美术风格很统一，精致

缺点：
节奏非常有问题 —— 游戏的设计是每次一方做出一个行动就会立即轮换给另一方做出对应反制，来回切换完全没有连续出牌打出combo配合的畅快感。作为一个卡牌游戏这种设计太破坏节奏。已经习惯了 杀戮尖塔 的模式实在无法再适应这种割裂的机制。

author: {'steamid': '76561198066818720', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1652894436}
review:
The Lord of the Rings: Adventure Card Game - Definitive Edition to strategiczna gra karciana osadzona w fascynującym świecie powieści J.R.R. Tolkiena. Wydana przez studio Fantasy Flight Interactive, gra oferuje niezwykle wciągające i satysfakcjonujące doświadczenie dla fanów sagi Władcy Pierścieni i miłośników gier karcianych.

Jednym z najbardziej wyróżniających się elementów w The Lord of the Rings: Adventure Card Game jest głębia strategiczna, jaką oferuje. Gracze mają możliwość budowania talii kart, które reprezentują różne postacie, przedmioty i zdolności z fantastycznego świata Tolkiena. W trakcie rozgrywki muszą podejmować mądre decyzje taktyczne, aby pokonać niebezpieczeństwa i wyzwania, z którymi spotykają się ich bohaterowie.

Narracja i atmosfera gry są niezwykle mocne, wiernie oddając ducha powieści Tolkiena. Scenariusze i misje, które gracz może przejść, przekazują wspaniałą opowieść, która wciąga i angażuje gracza. Urok epickiej sagi jest obecny w każdym aspekcie gry, a grafika i dźwięki doskonale oddają niesamowite miejsca i postacie z książek.

The Lord of the Rings: Adventure Card Game - Definitive Edition oferuje również tryb wieloosobowy, gdzie gracze mogą współpracować ze sobą, aby stawić czoła jeszcze większym wyzwaniom. Możliwość wspólnego tworzenia talii i planowania strategii z innymi graczami dodaje element społeczny i zapewnia długotrwałą zabawę.

Jedynym mankamentem gry jest, że nauka zasad może być nieco skomplikowana dla nowych graczy. Gra wymaga pewnego czasu i wysiłku, aby oswoić się z mechanikami i zrozumieć strategie, ale po przekroczeniu tej krzywej uczenia się, staje się niezwykle satysfakcjonującym doświadczeniem.

Podsumowując, The Lord of the Rings: Adventure Card Game - Definitive Edition jest grą, która dostarcza zarówno fanom Władcy Pierścieni, jak i miłośnikom gier karcianych, głębokie i emocjonujące doświadczenie. Nasycona wspaniałą narracją i odwzorowaniem świata Tolkiena, gra zapewnia wiele godzin zabawy. Pomimo lekkiej skomplikowania zasad dla nowych graczy, jest to tytuł, który z pewnością zachwyci fanów sagi.

Ocena: 8/10

review:
Well done PC version of the table game of the same name. Difficult but in coop with someone very good to play. There are several campaigns and additional missions that can be done in many ways. The best options for expert are blue decks, dwarves and healing. Don't play the game without it. Sauron is overpowered on some maps you have to think carefully about your moves. 
One minus is that the campaigns end quickly and at the end you can only repeat them. 9/10

review: Works great on the steam deck. I love LoTR and Magic the Gathering so I thought this would be perfect. The back stories and tutorial are great. But then it goes wrong. The deck building is clunky and chore-some. The first main campaign just isn’t fun to play. The endless hordes of cards. The ticking clock of doom and the cheap trick to take away two of you 3 main characters just as you’ve run out of cards. Is not challenging. It’s not fun. It’s just cheap. I try to play through this. But I couldn’t. Unfortunately it’s not deleted from my SteamDeck.

review:
废墟考古。
这片废墟规划里是一座复杂的LCG卡牌冒险RPG，因为玩法设计的战略性错误和非功能需求打磨过差而轰然倒塌。
设计师忘了谁才会第一时间前来探访。
错误仍然在继续。
站在塔楼之上，已经望不到CGE和dire wolf的背影了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198088583780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1700438529}
review: Bom pó compra

author: {'steamid': '76561198263382732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1688818362}
review: WOW! Another great opportunity at a franchise winner that fell short of victory. It has everything. graphics, story, sound effects, and the super ability to over complicate. If a game has more than one tutorial it becomes an instruction manual. Games are supposed to be about fun, to help take the stress out of life. NOT TO ADD STRESS TO IT. Sadly the developers forgot that. When reviews start bragging that they never had so much fun losing then you should stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969307920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1674722444}
review:
[h1] Gamification ruins what could have been a wonderful card drafting game.[/h1] 
The core mechanics are fun, the art is beautiful, the narration, music and writing do a wonderful job of immersing you into the lore of middle earth. [b]Sadly[/b] the grind required to unlock cards is perplexing. It feels like the developers were expecting players to put hundreds of hours into a game that has 10~15 hours of content. I think this becomes most obvious when you look at some of the games achievements.

"In to the West" for example, requires you to complete 5000 quests. Considering there are only 3 campaigns with 5 quests each, were the developers expecting players to replay each campaign over 300 times? 

While I enjoyed the 3 campaigns that are available, I feel like I never really got to draft any interesting decks as half the cards were still locked away behind mysterious unlock conditions or a very poorly thought out in game currency system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054842591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2198, 'last_played': 1674161148}
review: I'm shocked by how much I ended up enjoying this game. Started it in an effort to clear my backlog and ended up spending almost 40 hours. The game is a solo (or co-op) deck building puzzle game in a LOTR setting and there is a LOT of content if you enjoy LOTR / puzzles / card games. I was pleasantly surprised to see that all the quest introductions were fully voice acted as well. Hope to see more adventures / scenarios / campaigns being available in a later date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012784015', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1673204333}
review:
99% of the card games sux, this one sux 3 times more,

author: {'steamid': '76561198073959856', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1675026343}
review: If you are a fan of anything about the Middle Earth, you'll have a lot of fun. The standard difficulty provides a casual gameplay. Lore is good, seeing all the familiar faces. The quests and events add fun to the game. I've only played the solo game and it is really enjoyable so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129985478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2534, 'last_played': 1682800359}
review:
Le jeu offre de nombreuses possibilités de jouer (solo, multijoueur, escarmouches). Il y a pas mal de contenu, scénarios, cartes, campagnes. Le point fort du jeu selon moi est le mode narratif, les campagnes, qui accompagnent les affrontements. Bien sûr, une fois le duel lancé il faut opter pour les meilleures options fonction des cartes en main. Je prends pour ma part plaisir à jouer les campagnes qui chacune propose des mécanismes un peu différents sur les défis à résoudre. Il faut souvent faire des choix entre combattre, frapper tôt et vite OU absorber du dégât et faire grimper la jauge de volonté qui propose des bonus intéressants OU ne faire qu'avancer sur les défis et absorber bcp de dégâts. Bien, un bon jeu selon moi où on retrouve les aventures dans le monde de tolkien avec les héros qui nous sont chers. Je prends plaisir à jouer occasionnellement.

Si je devais donner deux mises en garde :
1. la différence entre standard et difficile est assez franche. J'ai apprécié de rejouer en mode difficile certaines campagnes mais çà relève du défis. Peut-être ne fais pas progresser assez mes decks (peu de patience pour ma part de ce côté-là)
2. Pour un joueur qui a du temps et qui va s'investir pendant plusieurs heures immédiatement après l'acquisition, il pourrait avoir le sentiment d'épuiser le jeu rapidement.

Alexandre 45 ans

author: {'steamid': '76561198065262545', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1672500344}
review: Just more card game bullshit. Why is it that in every single card game, there's always a point where the player can barely play a card or two but the enemy ends up being able to attack, use buffs on all their creatures, do extra bullshit damage to your creatures and accumulate tons of ressources in a single roung? What the heck is wrong with trading card games?? This one is just like Magic, elder Scrolls Legends and all that crap. The opponent always seems to find some ridiculous way to overwhelm you thanks to some broken rules or something. If you like this kind of dumbass shit, then this is for you. If I had a physical deck of cards from this game, I'd shred it, throw it in the toilet and take the smelliest, nastiest dump my stomach can muster.

review: Another deck builder that plays a little different from other deck builders I've played.  Unfortunately, I was more frustrated by the UI than anything else about the game. author: {'steamid': '76561199240279304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1673319405}
review:
Un buen juego de cartas con mecánicas originales y un nivél muy alto (el "experto" es muy difícil) Su mayor atractivo será para los tolkiendili.
Sus ilustraciones originales no copian demasiado a las películas y la mayoría son estéticamente buenas.
Las voces de los prólogos y epílogos son casi una dramatización y los subtítulos están cuidados.

review: Just because I like this doesn't mean you should buy it. UI interface options aren't that great, certain combinations of heroes just don't work, and the game got discontinued in cardboard so they're never making any more content for this. There are better options out there. But if you still want to dig in the card play is deliberate, deckbuilding is fun, decisions are meaty, and artwork is great.

review: Broken.   Card effects don't trigger.  Events simply do not occur and you lose.  Shame cause the presentation is decent.  I am a massive player of the RL LCG and this is just arghhh ( flops to the floor in a defeated heap whilst an Uruk defiles my rusty bullet hole).

author: {'steamid': '76561197972940535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1668237192}
review:
It's quite a fun little deck-builder, and I thoroughly enjoy the Rohan Campaign.

BUT.

The game is unfinished; there's missing content galore - I found myself shaking my head when I came across the Mithril Shirt mentioning it could only be used by Frodo and Bilbo...

... aaaaaaaand Bilbo's not available in the game.

So, until the very unlikely event where some other enterprising company snaps this up and completes it - I can't recommend to others.

Quite a shame, really.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045195963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 4467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1703183633}
review:
A great digital version of the original card game, but there are a few issues you should be aware of:
1. Many achievements require a ridiculous amount of grinding to achieve. Some achievements are unachievable, because...
2. There's no continuing support for the game, which means no DLC expanding the range of options we have. This is an issue when you're trying to complete 100 quests with a Gondor-only deck.

The game is still well worth playing, just be aware that, if you're a completionist, this one will frustrate you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974701245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3430, 'last_played': 1701470643}
review:
Ein extrem gut gemachtes Card-Game welches die Lore von Herr der Ringe gut aufnimmt.
Ich hoffe ja, dass es nochmal weitere DLC oder Fortsetzungen gibt, um weitere Abenteuer zu spielen.

DAS WICHTIGSTE ZUERSt:
CO-OP !!!! Und der ist auch noch richtig gut implementiert  *love it*
Wo gibt es das heutzutage noch? Danke dafür !

PRO
- viele Sinnvolle Karten + Heldenkarten mit vielen Kombinationsmöglichkeiten und Synergien (gerade im CO-OP)
- schöne Illustrationen
- Kampagne im Co-Op spielbar, so dass man seine Decks mit einem Freund abstimmen kann, Synergien bilden kann etc. (einer baut Macht-Punkte auf und Heilt eher, der andere baut sich eher ein Dmg+Block-Deck .... z.B.)
- Kampagne bringt sehr viele Map-spezifische Bedingungen, die jede Runde abwechslungsreich machen
- Balancing ist in meinen Augen sehr gut gelungen, einige Synergien sind stärker als andere aber das bringt ja auch Spaß, diese herauszufinden (Block+Abschirmen kombos z.b.)
--> ich habe mir mindestens 6 verschiedene Decks gebaut mit verschiedenen Helden-Kombinationen, um auf bestimmte Kampagnen-Stellen zu reagieren und zusätzliche Belohnungen zu ergattern 
- kurze Ladezeiten
- Einfach gehaltenes Menü, übersichtlich und aufs wesentliche begrenzt

CONTRA
- wüsste gerade nichts ...

review:
I don't understand the hate. I got it for cheap and having a blast.
Illustrations, narration and music are superb.
Probablly is different from LCG game but after you get the mechanics is extremely fun (and challenging)
I agree that you need a lot of farming and some stuff are not very clear (You cannot check how many treasons Sauron has, different to understand the powers on units and so on).
It's a bit bad but overall a great game. 

9.5/10 or LOTR lovers.
7.5 for card ans single players lovers.
7 for other gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973581446', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 1154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1658773399}
review:
En tant que jeu de société, le jeu est assez sympa. Là où je ne veux pas donner une évaluation positive c'est à cause de l'interface utilisateur:
- quand les objectifs de mission changent, la progression de l'objectif en cours est réinitialisée. C'est jamais vraiment expliqué, et donc facile à oublier.
- de trop nombreux effets sont cachés, mal expliqués, peu clairs...

Mais même en tant que jeu de société, je le trouve faible :
- il y a beaucoup (trop) d'aléatoire
- les decks sont peu diversifiés et il faut (beaucoup) trop payer en points acquis en jouant (pas de problème à ce niveau-là) pour avoir enfin quelques cartes "différentes"

Et enfin, seul, le jeu n'est pas vraiment amusant. Logique pour un jeu de société, mais vu que le jeu le permet...

author: {'steamid': '76561197964735295', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1654959246}
review: It's just OK...not great - just OK. Seems like I have to play through a lot of staged adventures to unlock more cards and get to some real choices. Each scenario feels like an intro scenario - none of them too hard - and your tactical options seem limited. Voice acting is a bit overdone; these folks clearly want to get some Tolkien on their resume. I'm just not sold on this enough to sell other people on it; not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996768709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1656543845}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089529614', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1662425234}
review:
Жалкие людишки не могли добавить Русскую локализацию, что-бы им Око Саурона спать не давало. Дизлайк только поэтому, в остальном все хорошо.

Побывать в Средиземе я всегда "За", а тем более когда так передан дух ВК.
Найдись тот добрый человечище, найдись братва, что переведет текст этой игры. Благодарю заранее!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042494319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1653405991}
review:
I love Lord of the Rings, and strategy games of all kinds, but didn't enjoy this game very much.

There are some creative/unique elements compared to other card games especially with the campaign, but not sure it added more excitement as it did more frustration. I don't have a problem with a mechanic that encourages us to win in as few as turns as possible, but something about they way they did it here didn't sit right with me.
Beyond the mechanics of the game there were some bugs like tooltips not working consistently that added to the frustration as new player, and overall I found I was more frustrated than having a good time.

A shame. LOTR is ripe for excellent games and yet we continually get sub-par.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027842955', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1652579682}
review:
If you've bumped into this review while browsing the store page, we both know what has brought you here - the ancient, pestering itch for a decent card game to play solo. This one escaped my gaze for the longest time, and it's a loving gaze! I adore cards since Mario's Game Gallery and playing Fool with my friends in the icy stairwells of panel houses while our parents drank their lives away at home. Back then, playing cards was an island of calm, and this is what I've been expecting from them ever since.

[h3]Asmodee[/h3]
Did Asmodee deliver the goods? Most of the publisher's games have dubious ratings, creating an impression that their products are undercooked. I saw them as apathetic mobile market grinders previously, but check this out - LotR used to be your typical free-to-play live service crap with atrocious microtransactions! Evidently, it was remastered after the initial backlash. Fixing stuff post-launch doesn't beat it being good from the get-go but is commendable still. On the store page, you can see years-old reviews from before the fact, but don't be confused by the weird claims that refer to an almost completely different game.

[h3]Audiovisual[/h3]
The game isn't based on the movie license, yet doesn't miss it by much at heart. The card art is splendid and most of it migrated from the board game, which has high-quality fantasy imagery that would immediately seem familiar to any fan of the setting, recreating the cosiness and the pathos of the original epics. The mobile stink from the menus with buttons covering up half of the screen is bizarre and can be a deal-breaker to some. On the other hand, the menu art is pretty and you can still get where you want in a few seconds. The combat UI is decent and, overall, the game looks good in static as well as in motion, having your actions conveyed through special effects with punchy animations. Withal, the OST slapped me with how surprisingly elaborate it is. Be that heroic marches or the wailing in the cold crypt, the majestic HoMM vibes emanated by the music finalise the homely atmosphere of the game.

[h3]Story[/h3]
The stories to play through happen in the period between The Hobbit and LotR, but don't get your hopes up since they're but zany fanfic gobbledygook. Bilbo, Gloin, Aragorn, and Faramir wander through Mirkwood when, suddenly, spiders attack and kidnap Bilbo... but then, it turns out the orcs are behind the scheme! Sophisticated, eh. The solid voice acting could probably carry the narratives anyway, but I'd lost any interest in reading or listening to this nonsense after a couple of missions.

[h3]Deck Building[/h3]
Traditionally, I've spent at least a third of my playtime building decks. First figuring out what I want, then honing my precious. As a foundation, you can have up to 3 heroes in a deck, each with a different impactful ability, and their colours, or Spheres, determine what cards you can add. Having heroes of all 3 Spheres would untie your hands in terms of weaker goods, but having 2-3 heroes of the same sphere allows adding more powerful cards that demand just that. Yet again, a better interface could go a long way. Things barely fit, you have to flip through a lot of pages. So, this isn't the most comfortable tool, but all the filters at your disposal make it manageable. You can sort cards by keywords and races, it isn't a problem to find something if you know what to look for.

To know is one thing, but to afford new cards you'll need Fellowship Points, a currency with which to unlock new goods like your equip, units, spells, or heroes, and also all sorts of useless cosmetics. Said points are gained for completing quests, beating optional challenges, and act as local meta-progression, gradually expanding your options as you go. Don't fret, the reward system is generous enough, so you'll probably have everything you want after reaching the midpoint or earlier if you main 1 or 2 decks. As mentioned, some of the rewards are cosmetic, and why would I care for any of it in my singleplayer card game? This lousy loot couldn't motivate me to replay the campaigns two additional times. At least every first reward for beating a quest is a card, so I didn't have to grind.

[h3]Questing & Fighting[/h3]
Despite serious diversions from the original board game, most of the core distinguishing mechanics that set it apart from its peers seem to have been carried over faithfully. There're 3-4 locations/encounters per quest, 5 quests per campaign, and 3 campaigns overall. Your hand, characters, their equipment, buffs, and health persist between encounters. The continuity is a clever feature that makes you think ahead, raising the stakes and tension closer to the finale. There's a variety of challenges to overcome, and not only monsters. Each location has an Objective or a set of them, which sometimes change within one encounter. Objectives are entities that advance missions when resolved by attacking them with units who have Willpower, which is one of the core stats along with health and normal attack values. Sauron likes to spam his own perilous version of them, Hazards, so having some Willpower on your units is important.

The battles present you with a plethora of choices every turn. It's an involved system with its own tangs. Unlike in most card games, a round consists of exchanging blows with Sauron until you're both out of moves. This feels like real-time in comparison to the usual deal, creating a different kind of pacing that I haven't encountered in a card game prior to this one. More commonly, the unspent Resources are stored between rounds, adding another layer of forward-thinking. The rounds themselves are divided into several phases. For example, the first one is called Upkeep, cards with that keyword perform their abilities during the phase if the conditions are met. Dammit, it will take me 4 reviews to describe how every intricacy works! But there's no need. The game is easy to learn and has a comprehensive tutorial as well as your usual QoL like the glossary and tooltips.

Nevertheless, let's have a look at one of the biggest distinctive features that plays an important role - the Threat Meter. It didn't seem that huge initially, but neglecting it has led to the majority of my deaths in the late game. Sauron fills the Threat Meter in a myriad of ways and his threat events that trigger at certain thresholds can hinder your party big time. What's worse is that if the Meter's fills during a mission - you lose. Another way to lose is to get all of your heroes killed, but it happened to me maybe once? That threat level was the real run-killer. Somewhat mitigating the issue, the Fellowship has an answer in the form of the Fate Meter. Any character with Willpower can choose to add their value to it at the expense of getting exhausted. Rarely a game-changer, but it helps to have all kinds of buffs, summons, and location-specific events in store. No, it doesn't make Sauron lose the game when you max it and usually runs out of juice fast.

[h3]Difficulty[/h3]
First and foremost, this gem is a compelling puzzle to solve. In the spirit of the books, every time I thought I was ready for everything, a new quest threw some preposterous curveball my way. Embarking on a new adventure, I was always expecting jeopardy previously unseen - the local Sauron is a master of devious tactics. And I had no one else to blame for my failures! There isn't much RNG aside from very few selected cards, the draw, and not knowing what Sauron would do next. His AI is surprisingly crafty and, supported by a good encounter design, makes LotR an apt solo challenge in a genre that often neglects singleplayer. Fuelled by a powerful catalyst in the form of a fantasy epic of such magnitude and combined with old reliable card traditions, this quirky game offers a soothing adventure made with care.

My curator [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35305390-Big-Bad-Mutuh/?appid=262060]Big Bad Mutuh[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197999653160', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1648842346}
review:
This is like a more complicated HearthStone.

The game feels... cheap and ugly. The mechanics are... more interesting? But also sort of clunky. My understanding is that the mechanics of this digital version are also SIMPLIFIED from the real game... which means the real game is clunkier than MTG? Who is playing this in real life and doesn't hate themselves?

However, at least there is a "rich" singleplayer experience! Which is more than you can ever say for Hearthstone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075509746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3883, 'last_played': 1616203526}
review:
I brought this game when it was released. It was free back then but I payed to have more advantadges. And oh boy I regret doing so. It's one of the few games that I have on my library that if I could go back in time and prevent myself from purchasing it, I would gladly do so.
I brought it because I own the physical card game irl. So I thought it would be a lot of fun to play this online. Well just imagine my frustation. First of all, it took AGES for the original devs to get past the early acess state. Took a lot of time for it to be even Co-Op. But things were progressing. 
What many do not know is that on the original card game, you collect sauron cards and actually one player must play as Sauron against the others. So, I still remember that I joined the twitch stream that original devs were doing and asked when such feature would be avaliable. To my surprise, they answered players won't play as Sauron. Well, why the game had a sauron deck or even showed Sauron cards to collect in the first place? That was a HUGE let down to me and since then I completely stopped playing this. I returned when a new team was announced. Tried this game again... and nothing changed. The current state is that it's pretty much dead, abandoned. So, yeah, can't recommend!

Good points:
+ Sounds nice. Music and sound effects are well done.
+ Looks nice too. The graphics are good. Nothing spectacular but works. A lot of card games, even famous ones, never had such a pleasant look such as this one.
+ Plays nice too. During early times it had a lot of bugs but there was some effort to fix then.
+ A fair system of getting cards without having to pay for them. Wasn't  a pay to win during early times. I can't state this after the new dev team arrived though.

Bad points: 
 - The HUGEST let down: Players can't play as Sauron or use the Sauron deck. Can't even collect Sauron cards. Not at ALL how the original card game works.
- Game was simply abandoned. 
- Not free anymore.
- Since day ONE, the addition of new content was extremely slow. Always gave the impression the deves were not very interested on the project.


Score: 0/10 Worth Buying: No. Despite the game current state of being abandoned, which by itself is enough reason from staying away from it , the fact that players can't play or even collect Sauron cards takes away almost all the fun this game had to offer. That would be the real gem that would make  it different from the others cards games. It's ashame , a waste really because nowadays the gaming industry simply doesn't have good cards games. This great co-op game was even capable of atracting people that are not into LOTR lore,  like me. It had an amazing potential but everything was thrown away due to lack of vision from the devs, especially the original team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005684878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1646257901}
review:
I will start by saying I have never played the physical card game. However, I have played numerous CCGs in physical form and look at the classic Magic: The Gathering (1997 MicroProse) as the best.

I have a few issues with the UI but they work. I recommend this game fully. The mechanics are balanced with different difficulties throughout the game.  There are different game modes with nuanced differences.  What it lacks though is depth.  Think of it as wider than it is deep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025667046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 24633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18716, 'last_played': 1679784635}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114632624', 'num_games_owned': 1541, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1645336059}
review:
Fairly competent card game, but I just don't feel that excitement of drawing a great card or making a good decision.
Might have to do with playing the campaign, which just shuffles you from location to location, where events are triggered regardless of what you are doing. Making everything done rather meaningless.

Probably will have better luck just playing it as a single player. Anyway. Still worth checking out.

6/10. Add +2 if you are a LOTR fan. Definitely will give you a dose of nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136976843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1643002609}
review: Really bad. You can tell this was a half-assed attempt everywhere you look. Poor graphics, poor gameplay, and *extremely* corner and needless dialogue between heroes on miissions. The story element doesn't even need to be there, but they half-assed it and put something there anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985723282', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 4117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1680388551}
review:
Great game but abandoned. (You can still play it solo or co-op with friend and enjoy it)

It's made like typical online card games in which u get points after playing etc, to unlock more cards and even avatars, emote packs etc. But it's pure co-op and because it's abandoned you can either play with friend or enjoy it solo in which both options it's kinda sad that getting cards is kinda hard, some cards require hours of grind. Don't worry, to make some good decks you don't need to spend much hours. On start you can use like 50-60% of all cards i think.

It's made based on original TCG Lord Of The Rings with big changes. First of all it's way easier than physical game and if you buy one you have all dlcs and even random enounters which all are quite fun.

Whole game was dubbed so all voice lines in campaign are read by professional actors. It's really well done.

Overall it's a great game worth a price. It only lacks some quality of life improvements in making decks, but you can get used to it after a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217773051', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1643708095}
review:
Credo che sia il peggior gioco di carte mai sviluppato, un'occasione sprecata vista l'importanza del francise dietro le opere di Tolkien...un vero peccato.
Dopo dieci ore abbondanti di gameplay tra single player e multiplayer mi sono reso conto di aver buttato momenti della mia esistenza biologica che avrei potuto spendere diversamente, tipo scopando o cercando una cura contro il tumore alla prostata.
Gli asset sono sbilanciati, i bot della cpu hanno carte di gran lunga superiori al giocatore e non vi è modo per ottenere altre carte se non pagando...da giocatore di Heartstone so bene che le microtransazioni fanno funzionare i giochi in F2P quindi non dovrei lamentarmi per il pay to win, peccato che questo gioco costi 20 euro!!!
Paghi soldi sudati andando a lavorare nelle miniere di sale, nelle maquile illegali in periferia cucendo magliette, raccogliendo pomodori, vendendo sostanze illecite, prostituendo se stessi e la propria famiglia...per comprare un manufatto videoludico ispirato al mondo di LOTR...e vieni aggredito dalle microtransazioni!!!

Voto: 4/10 Sono stato generoso perché almeno le musiche sono gradevoli e gli Artwork ispirati, peccato che manchi TUTTO IL RESTO

author: {'steamid': '76561197997011685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1590333602}

author: {'steamid': '76561198104074926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4782, 'last_played': 1687487082}
review: The theme is obviously appealing and the mechanics are based on the board game version. There is a good variety of cards and the heroes are well-represented. I had my share of fun, even though it is a limited PVE game. Great for LOTR fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995185379', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1642891338}
review: This game feels completely unfinished. It also suffers from the age ole "We as developers do not understand strategy so lets make up for it with difficulty". Ugh, So little strategy, just a bunch of forces fighting each other and increasing difficulty comes just a crap ton more forces and giving the enemy more points than you. The stories are not that interesting and listening to the characters ramble on is annoying. This game feels rushed and I am very disappointed this came from Asmodee. You are better than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103814388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1642737169}
review:
I'm going to preface my review by saying that this game is fantastic if you're looking for Lord of the Rings lore. The visuals and voice narration are great.

But the mechanics of the game came up short for me.

For starters, the main menu system for everything is clearly designed for mobile and unnecessarily difficult to navigate as a result. In addition to scrolling being a pain on desktop, it takes 4 or 5 layers of drilling down to actually start a battle. The emphasis on gorgeous artwork gets in the way of function and it's a shame.

Deck building is slightly tedious, but nothing out of the ordinary for deck builders. What bugged me most is that so many cards are locked behind the need to grind. Completing the main quest line *might* provide enough credits to unlock another hero, but I'll never know because I was focused on unlocking half of the basic cards. Unlocks should serve as motivation to try new strategies and experiment, but instead I found myself replaying battles or quests repeatedly. It killed the fun for me.

The actual gameplay is pretty decent. The resource system for playing cards is well-balanced and actions feel meaningful. The toughest thing for me, as someone who plays a lot of deck builders, is the lack of consistency that comes from being limited to 2 copies of a card in the deck. But starting with three heroes and limiting decks to 30 cards does solve a lot of that. Plus, the persistence of characters between sections of quests means that you ostensibly only need to setup once for four battles.

In short: lore is great and gameplay fun for a bit, but deck building comes at the cost of not-so-fun grinding.

review: Got this one as a gift. I also have the physical boardgame. They are not at all the same game. I prefer the physical version over the digital, although I'm not a big fan of the physical game either. The LOTR setting is something you can do SO much with, but this game has so little. I never feel the adventure when playing. It's actually quite boring and a bit confusing. Nope, can't recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311669620', 'num_games_owned': 1421, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1642339068}
review:
[h1][i] "You look terrible." [/i] - Legolas[/h1]

Let me start by saying that I'm a HUGE fan of LOTR in all types of media but I'm not a fan of this game. First the cosmetics (frames,avatars,cardbacks) are all locked and each of them  costs  1k of in-game currency to unlock. Then a lot of cards are  locked behind that 1k wall as well. Why?! What is the point?!  They can just keep releasing new DLC's or hero packs  with new cards and get rid of that nonsensical grind. It's not like this is akin to Hearthstone,MTG or any other card game that is updated VERY frequently so I really don't see a point there. Not to mention that Campaign  and Encounter mode is ALWAYS the same and repetitive. Meaning same encounters in the same way with same dialogue over and over and over  again and for each completion you get 1k of In-game currency so enjoy grinding your soul out. The only mode where you get random  deck and encounters is the new one called Mirror of Galadriel. So replayability is dead. Multipalyer is also dead. I can't think of any good reason to recommend this to any LOTR fan sadly. I got it on a huge discount for a few € and I still feel bad for spending money on it.


[b]Pros: [/b]
✅ LOTR themed CCG
✅ Graphically okay-ish
✅ Quite a few modes, sadly only one isn't repetitive
✅ Lots of customization options

[b]Cons: [/b]
❌ Grind fest
❌ Multiplayer is dead☠️ 


[b]Personal score:  [/b]★☆☆☆☆

[b]🤖Final words:  [/b] This could be so much more. The effort is there, rules are well thought out, UI is a bit meh but overall  this isn't worth the discounted price let alone a full one. Now excuse me as I'll Rowl over and die. J.K.  Kudos if you got the puns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007390177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1640131418}
review:
- It's a confusingly inferior adaptation of the actual card game. I struggle to see the necessity of outright changing all the cards, removing combos, etc for the sake of this game. The obvious market for this game are fans of the LCG, so why change it at all? And the changes they do make are pretty awful. And even given that they appeared to be trying to rip off Hearthstone's general look, it's a worse version of that game.

- Really needed more development time. The slow rollout of cards, even after all this time (more than 2 years) makes it thin and unfun. The UI could use a little work too.

- Changing the mechanics of the game, really makes it feel unbalanced at times, with "Sauron" doing way more ridiculous things than happens in the LCG.

- At the end of the day, it's not even that terribly fun compared to other games in related genres. I play the LCG twice a month with some friends and it just doesn't compare. In terms of card gards, there's plenty of better ones out there. In terms of Hearthstone-y games, there are way better ones out there. Don't waste your money, just go play any of those again instead. Or go play the LCG one, you'll end up spending more money, but you actually get something for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042344548', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1639060490}
review:
Breve recensione di un prodotto che ho provato soltanto come PVE, quindi senza buttarmi nel PVP.

PRO:
- Ambientazione, qui direi che non c'è niente da eccepire.
- Meccaniche: tante idee originali e interessanti, avendo giocato a moltissimi TCG e CCG ho apprezzato molto il fatto che si siano impegnati a rendere unico il gioco.

CONTRO:
- Board-aspetto grafico, come altri giochi della Asmodee trasposti in digitale l'aspetto grafico e l'interfaccia non sono particolarmente accattivanti o curate.
- Difficoltà: in alcuni momenti la difficoltà diventa artificialmente impossibile per esigenze "narrative", non amo questo espediente, avrei preferito una sfida reale e ben costruita, piuttosto che una artificiale che poi richiede di essere compensata con interventi che vanificano l'abilità del giocatore.

Nel complesso mi sono divertito, il gioco mi ha intrattenuto molto e penso prima o poi proverò anche a cercare game online o a giocarlo in PVP con altri amici.

Voto finale: 7.5/10

review:
Super cooles Game, vorallem zu zweit!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076099664', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 363, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1637639692}
review:
Tengo 2 razones importante por lo que compre este juego, la más importante jugar cooperativo online un juego de cartas, nunca he jugado un juego de cartas cooperativo y con la temática del Señor de los anillos ohhhh buena temática, dije vamos a probarlo primero me hice con el tutorial para comprender la temática,  con los tutoriales comprenderás mejor el juego, ya luego es ser un estratega con el amigo que te acompañe, el cooperativo online es de 2 jugadores una campaña de 3 capítulos y cada uno de ellas tiene 5 episodios. Me ha gustado tanto el juego que me gustaría que existiese mas juegos con este modo de juego cooperativo de cartas, lo recomiendo mucho vale la pena la versión definitiva. La pasaras genial con tu amigo. 

(POR FAVOR CREADORES tomen en cuenta esto)
1-	Agregar una tienda donde se compre más cartas esto ara que el juego sea más amplio. 
2-	Agregar más contenido, más cartas.
3-	Agregar el Idioma Español en voz sería maravilloso para disfrutar mejor la historia. 
4-	Esperare la Secuela o porque no otra temática de película e implementarla en un juego de cartas cooperativo como hicieron aquí. 

Voces: ingles
Texto: español

****Análisis*****
*Jugabilidad: Muy Bueno
*Cooperativo Online: Excelente
*Campaña Horas: Muy Bueno
*Cartas: Excelente
*Graficas: Muy Bueno

Calificación: 8.4

Nota Definición: 10=Obra Maestra, 9=Excelente,8=Muy Bueno, 7=Bueno, 6=Medio Bueno, 5=Mejorable, 4= Mediocre, 3=Malo, 2=Muy Malo, 1=Inservible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050144725', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1633802766}
review:
How is it that a game made in 2019 for one of the biggest IPs in the world could make so many basic design mistakes? Hearthstone, which this game clearly takes a lot of inspiration from in UI design, showed how to do it in 2014. This game has none of the charm, smoothness or satisfying tactile feel that made the latter's design so successful. I almost don't want to take about gameplay because the UI is already a dealbreaker for me (and that's coming from someone who's played MTGO) but it's also pretty bad. Go play HS/Eternal/MTGA instead.

Bad game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035303725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1636157011}
review:
The game bugged out in the second quest and wouldn't let me and my co-op partner continue despite having obviously completed the objective. Could have continued the level to infinity and beyond without Sauron ever getting a hit in. I don't understand how the developers can have 2 years to patch this game and then serve me this crap. 

Don't spend your money on this if you want to play co-op when there are so many games out there that actually work. I don't know if it's any better or more bug-free in single player though btw.

review: I do not think people give this game enough credit. I really enjoy this spin on the card game, because it really is a spin off of the physical edition. A lot of people who love the physical game cannot get past that fact, but I really enjoy playing this edition online with my friend. The game is in general a lot simpler than in physical edition, but is still challenging and enjoyable with a lot of variety. I only wish more people liked the game so that the designers could make more content for the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041501948', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1622608332}
review:
For the most part, this is a great game, and I'm hard press to give it a thumbs down. My one big complaint is that I found far too many times when I could not get any further in the game because the challenge was too much for me to beat. Others might be able to figure those challenges out, but they simply became too frustrating to continue playing.
If you like a good, hard challenge, then you might enjoy this more than I did. Eventually, I'll probably reinstall it and try again. it was worth the money to buy, but I just tired of banging my head on a wall far too often.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976581647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1635154650}
review:
This is a fun game with well thought out rules, a well told story and nice graphics.

What really lets it down are the constant game breaking bugs.

Whether it is quests not progressing properly and getting stuck on missions, to quests saving your progress right before you might die and having to start the whole thing from the beginning, or just plain crashing - I've only played this game twice and had to restart or just stopped because of all these annoying issues.

Would definitely recommend this to Hearthstone fans that love LoTR. Will change my review to recommend if the bugs are ever fixed

author: {'steamid': '76561198400105549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2253, 'last_played': 1670536810}
review:
I was pleasantly surprised with how well this deck builder works. Solid game play, a good variety of cards with which to build your decks (including plenty of unlockables), and strong challenges that show that there are not really  "one size fits all" decks. 

For those who are hunting achievements, this game will take a LONG time to hit 100% (or as close as possible, since as of writing, 1-2 achievements appear to be unachievable). I'm expecting it'll take a couple hundred hours, between unlocking the best cards to make the strongest decks, and the sheer number of times you have to play quests.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041496964', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1696272209}
review:
I really like the game, I want to recommend it but not having the cards unlocked from the start is a dealbreaker for me.
I'm not willing to grind to get them all.
There's already a grind mechanic to unlock alternative art on the cards, that's fine, but not on the cards needed to play the game!

Otherwise the game is fun and has nice theme, lore and immersion!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970281251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1634597941}
review:
I tried really hard to like this, but:

1. Not enough cards to start, and cards unlock too slow.  This means deckbuilding is lame; you're not picking between cards you want, you're picking the obviously great cards and then the "least bad" of the cards you don't want.
2. Difficulty feels random, and relies heavily on "anti-fun" mechanics.  Lots of the game/campaign is easy - but the harder missions/encounters rely heavily on random, miserable hosers for the difficulty (discard all your events!  all wounded allies die!  your key card got countered!).  Sometimes these do nothing, and sometimes they're back-breaking, and you have little room to mitigate them (they might be a treachery, an event, a shadow thing, an enemy, who knows).  Because of how the game snowballs, a single one of these often decides the game.  Who likes this "gotcha" style gameplay in a PvE game?  
3. The "surprise events" feel arbitrary/frustrating.  Haha, the boss has an 8th form.  Haha, the hero you just paid a bunch of resources for decides to leave now.  Good job game.  You got me.  Guess I get to start again with a different deck that's ready for the stupid twist.  None of this is fun, none if it adds to the game - just makes the game feel arbitrary and that your choices don't matter.
3. Lots of modes that take a very random game and just pile on more randomness/incomprehensibility.  The "Adventure" mode was just an endless string of nonsense.  Now your party splits, now this hero disappears, now you're on a blimp, now you're all skeletons.  It didn't feel narrative or interesting, it just made strategy feel irrelevant and the result feel random.

Game technically works, and you could build something fun with these pieces.  But the designers instead chose to build something that's aggressively miserable to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299029163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1634288549}
review:
目前通過教程與戰役第一章：
※優點：
。關卡間有全配音的劇情敘事，中文也非機翻，寫手和配音員水準都不錯，入關前更有帶入感外純聽旁白講故事也是享受。
。相較於電影三部曲，遊戲更加還原托佬筆下的黑暗生物如何活動，各方勢力的關係，讓沒看小說的讀者能更了解中土世界。
。補足了很多電影省略的角色，讓玩家可以自由搭配遠征隊英雄，彌補了小說或電影的遺珠之憾。
※缺點：
。部分名詞的中翻並非老玩家熟悉的用詞，嘗試英語發音才理解是在說誰。而且中文字形在部分遊戲準備頁面忽大忽小，幸好關卡內故事並未受影響。
。卡面人物繪圖不知道是不是跟數個已經完成作品的畫師買版權的，畫風迥異，越冷門的角色越無法跟主角團形成統一的風格，推測這個遊戲沒有特地請畫師為所有角色完成一組完備的基本牌面。
。不玩卡牌的我都能在2小時破戰役一，裡面全部的關卡加總應該也不會太多，還有要求重複刷關拿獎勵的元素，豐富度待檢驗。
。『商店簡介的圖片裡戰役是沿著地圖推進，實際下載卻是最原始的分頁點擊選關，氣氛完全沒了甚至有些草率，真的是大扣分，一度想因為不實廣告給差評。』(個人覺得魔戒這種情懷遊戲那張地圖很重要，購買前三思！！)。
※結論：大概推薦
。現在的青少年幾乎都沒有看過魔戒了，前陣子重映卡疫情電影院更是完全沒人，這幾年深感魔戒迷的新血越來越少，雖然Amazon貌似要拍第二紀元的影集，但個人並不樂觀能圈多少粉。魔戒的世界觀是奇幻文學的先驅，但要吸引青少年恐怕已是力有未逮了，一如看金庸武俠的國中生越來越少，一代經典們紛紛走向衰落。老粉們看到一款以魔戒為題材的遊戲能不掏錢包支持嗎？別要背棄了你們對維拉神的信仰！！不要走上努曼諾爾的後塵！！

author: {'steamid': '76561197993862905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1634222919}
review:
I'm sure this is a lovely adaptation (with the exception of the voice acting), but the game its adapting just doesn't seem very good.

Standard difficulty is incredibly easy, and the game never really gives any decision making that seems like it matters. The best thing to do is always plainly obvious to the point the game felt like it was playing itself. It is very Hearthstone inspired, and the aesthetic they chose for the adaptation only makes it even more obvious.

If the Lord of the Rings theme and story is what you want, you are probably in the right place, but if you wanted in depth deck building and strategic game play, maybe look somewhere else. There are much better card games both in paper, and on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030864700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1635184625}
review:
Content: Limited, allows to build few decks with a little bit of wiggly room. I have finished 1 campaign of 5 scenarios and 1 standalone scenario within 10h and there is few more to do, which is why I would put 
[b]4/5 stars[/b]

Mechanics: Simple, yet offering some tactical fun. It is not some top end tactical masterpieces, but game does its work well for a relaxed card game.
[b]4/5 stars[/b]

UI: Poorly designed, while critical information is available, the one required for clarity is not easily accessible and feels a bit broken in places. For a game build heavily around UI systems this is not good. 
[b]3/5 stars[/b]

Visuals: Good. Presented well by store images
[b]4/5 stars[/b]

Multiplayer: Rare coop format including one available in the campaign! This feature alone makes this game worth recommended, and it does not feel like it was plastered on top.
[b]5/5 stars[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198442686569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1634102591}
review:
Un juego de cartas que de principio enamora pero, conforme conoces sus mecánicas un tanto más a fondo, se vuelve absurdamente injusto (por decirlo de forma elegante). 

Quisiera aclarar que soy un jugador random, con experiencia en juegos de cartas (desde Yugioh hasta Gwent) y conocimiento de LOTR (no soy un experto, mas, tampoco un casual). Por lo anterior, este análisis no está hecho para mega fanáticos que conocen el juego real o, para expertos en juegos de cartas que buscan desafíos, sino para personas que gustan de este mundo creado por Tolkien y, piensan que un juego de cartas sería lo mejor. 

Como siempre, la nota u conclusiones se encuentran al final.

POSITIVO 
->Detalle e historia: El juego se nota está muy bien hecho, inspirado en los detalles de los libros y, mostrando aspectos que demuestran no se trata de un juego de cartas casual para contar una historia por encima.
->Mecánicas: Aunque hay bastante de negativo, he de admitir que la mecánica es buena (desconozco si es así en el original). No es muy complicada, pero, tampoco es tan sencilla, debiendo mezclar de diversas formas algunas unidades y habilidades para salir librado (a veces por los pelos) de muchas situaciones. 
->Campañas y misiones: Hay una buena variedad de campañas y misiones para jugar en solitario, mismas que cuentan parte de la historia, lo que sin duda se agradece mucho. 
->Mazos: La capacidad de crear tus mazos de forma personalizada es algo vital en todo juego de cartas, por tanto, se agradece mucho que nos den esta opción y, así nos permitan adaptar un estilo de juego personal. 
->Compra de cartas: No sé si esto era así en un principio, pero ahora, por completar campañas o misiones se nos otorgan puntos, mismos que podemos usar para comprar cartas que nos interesen y, añadirlas a nuestro mazo. Esto me parece adecuado, puesto que te da un aliciente para probar campañas y, a la vez, obtienes mejoras para ir personalizando más tu forma de juego. 

NEGATIVO 
->Necesidad previa de conocer LOTR: Considero que un punto negativo no tan visible es la misma historia. Salvo que seas un medianamente entendido de este mundo, no te vas a enterar de un carajo (dado que los personajes se te presentan de golpe, igual que las situaciones). Entiendo que este juego está totalmente enfocado a la comunidad de LOTR, pero, se hubiese agradecido mucho que se hiciera un esfuerzo por incluir a todos los interesados no tan versados en estos libros/películas. 
->Cartas muy costosas: Hay unas cuantas cartas (que parecen ser las mejores, obvio) que cuestan una locura enfermiza de puntos, debiendo (a simples cálculos según las recompensas) hacer una docena de veces cada misión para tener la oportunidad de adquirirlas. Esto me parece totalmente absurdo, considerando que parte del chiste es personalizar tus mazos y, sentir que eres capaz de obtener recompensas por pasar campañas. 
->Injusticia total: El punto más negativo y, el que me hace no recomendar este juego es una sensación de injusticia total, plena, descarada y, hasta cínica. Nunca en mi vida me he encontrado con un nivel de injusticia tan grande como en este juego (sí, injusticia, no desafío, no dificultad, no simple azar). 
En LOTR existen un par de mecánicas que se le debieron ocurrir a un tipo que no tenía la más mínima idea de lo que implica el desafío (real, no artificial). Aunque podría abordar muchos aspectos, con un par es más que suficiente y, trataré de no extenderme en ello. 
Como en todo juego de cartas, tendremos la posibilidad de convocar (colocar) cartas que, dependiendo de su fortaleza, nos costarán más o menos puntos (en este juego, son una especie de puntos en esferas. Por cada ronda se nos otorgan 3 puntos -hablo de la dificultad estándar- de modo que, podemos gastarlos en usar cartas -de efecto, de tropas o de potenciación- o, guardarlos hasta la siguiente ronda). Hasta aquí, todo correcto, sin embargo, uno pensaría (porque es la lógica de cualquier ser racional que conozca este tipo de juegos) que dichos puntos son iguales para ambos bandos (el enemigo y tú) pero, ¿sabes qué? No es así chico…sin ahondar demasiado, es tan fácil como entender que sin importar lo que hagas, el enemigo siempre tendrá el doble o hasta el triple de puntos que tú para usar y, colocar carta tras carta tras carta en un festival de enemigos a lo bestia. 
¿Qué el enemigo se queda sin cartas? Estás mal de la cabeza, el enemigo por ronda podrá robar 5 cartas (y nunca se le acaban). Oye, pero, entonces nosotros también robamos 5 cartas, ¿verdad? Craso error amigo mío, tú solo robas 2 cartas (¡y eso que no estamos en la dificultad alta!) por turno. Así, haciendo una matemática de kínder, si el enemigo gana (mágicamente) muchos más puntos por ronda que tú para invocar cartas y, encima, roba 5 por turno, la situación ya va jodida, mas, seguro que eso es todo, ¿no? Se viene lo mejor camarada. 
Por tus héroes (que puedes llevar 3 y si mueren todos pierdes) se rellenará una barra de “amenaza” que va del 0 al 50, si llega al 50, pierdes en automático. Por llevar 3 héroes es normal que este valor ronde los 30 puntos (hablo con mazos iniciales) de entrada y sin vaselina. Eso debería ser todo, mientras no suba a 50 todo ok, ¿no? ¡Pues no! Resulta que por ronda ese valor aumenta (¡a veces hasta 5 puntos por efectos de cartas enemigas!) y, si estás en una campaña, eta se divide en 3 a 5 escenarios (mismos donde esta barra de amenaza nunca disminuye). 

Y podría seguir con una lista de enormes injusticias, desde que a veces debes proteger a un personaje (pues si muere pierdes) hasta que a veces al entrar en otro escenario te saltan 6 monstruos poderosos (sin que el enemigo gaste 1 solo punto) listos para hacerte papilla. 

NOTA Y CONCLUSIÓN: 1 / 10 
Este es el peor juego (con mucha diferencia) de cartas que he tenido la desgracia de tocar. Sí, de inicio un par de horas (tutorial y alguna campaña inicial) parece llevadero, incluso algo bueno pensando “Hey, es muy injusto, pero quizás así puedo sentirme como los héroes del libro luchando contra lo imposible” pero, tras horas y escenarios estúpidos donde sin importar lo que hagas a veces dependes más de la “bondad” del sistema para no machacarte a efectos mortales de cartas (o lluvia de monstruos)…pues, te das cuenta de la basura que esto resulta. 

Mejor compra otros juegos de cartas, cualquiera es mejor que esto.

review: A solid adaptation of the Living Card Game from Fantasy Flight Games. It has been polished and features a good level of difficulty and plenty of quality of life bonuses. I like the narration and I think they've done a good job with the art - which comes from various sources. It is just a shame that it is very "mobile" in its design and layout on PC. Additionally, it seems to have come to the end of its life and won't be getting more updates. A real shame.

review:
The UI takes a little getting used to, and isnt very intuitive to navigate, and had some scaling issues on my wide screen monitor. However the gameplay interface is great, better then Octn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065200815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 34660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31176, 'last_played': 1689981597}
review: I like the adherence to Tolkien, who is a far greater genius than any of us players, and the creaters are honoring him in all their hard ongoing work. The art is also a draw for me, particularly that of Magali Villaneuve (excuse any misspelling please!), and the fact that the creators don't rely on any one or three artists, even when they are the best! For my play style, and apologies to the master players, I'm inextricably partial to Arwen. Go Green/Blue!

author: {'steamid': '76561198110568949', 'num_games_owned': 1016, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1631117144}
review:
Un jeu de carte pve dans l'univers de Tolkien ? Je signe !

Hélas, le jeu est complètement raté. Alors certes l'idée de départ me plait tellement que j'ai malgré tout passé quelques heures agréables, mais ça reste un échec difficile à conseiller.
Déjà, la DA n'est pas franchement réussie, mais passons, ce n'est pas un point important dans ce type de jeu et difficile de se comparer à John Howe ou Alan Lee, par exemple.
Ensuite, les scénarios sont une superbe idée, mais finalement assez peu exploitée, et avec des histoires peu crédibles qui semblent difficiles à intégrer dans la chronologie des livres, avec un name dropping certes là pour assurer le fan service, mais beaucoup trop exagéré à mon goût.
Enfin, le pire : le gameplay. Mais quelle pauvreté ! Quel manque de dynamisme ! Quel manque de créativité ! Le système est pauvre, les cartes sont sans intérêt, peu nombreuses, sans possibilité ou presque de combo (le seul combo intéressant que j'ai trouvé... ne fonctionne pas, car les concepteurs n'ont pas du coder la possibilité...affligeant), elles se jouent trop rarement (raison qui m'a poussé à jouer en standard dès le départ), les possibilités sont étriquées, les coûts idiots (les équipements qui procurent un bonus permanent ne valent pas plus cher que des événements qui procurent ces mêmes bonus une seule fois...).
Bref, un échec total. A tel point que je n'ai même pas dépensé mes points pour acheter plus que les 2-3 cartes qu'il me fallait pour mon build.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040525581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1626005455}
review:
This game should have all the "cards" in place to make this an amazing experience. It has Lord of the Rings characters, monsters.

I didn't come to this game with a lot of expections but even then I was let down big time.

The 2nd quest in single player campaigns "In The City of Webs" is bugged and I got stuck in and the chapter "Too Many Options".

I just can't get past this event.

On top of unplayable campaign there's not really much in the deck building itself. Lacks tools to search with specific key phrases. In game you're not told in any way what different effects do and you're mostly left guessing.

I've played Hearthstone and I was hoping for a free to play experience single player game but this won't even deliver on the first hearthstone campaign (purchaseable with ingame currency you can grind).

I don't know how on earth this game has nearly 80% positive score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038687749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1625721160}

author: {'steamid': '76561198261229703', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1625531056}
review:
No início você vai gostar...
A imersão no mundo de LOTR é realmente boa.
As histórias, a narrativa, as artes, são boas.
Mas o jogo peca muito no quesito jogabilidade.
O jogo não possui um bom fluxo, muita das vezes não te informa os eventos que ocorrerão, o que atrapalhará toda sua estratégia.
O nível de Ameaça de Sauron tira todo o prazer  do jogo, pois você passa a jogar pensando em "tempo" e não mais em estratégia.
Infelizmente, não gostei.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994979846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1636494188}
review: This game went a long way from where it started. With the effort the new studio put into it it had became one of the best card games on the steam. The amount of content you get for the price is hard to match. Plays well, the OST is fantastic, campaigns have good story. The only gripe I have with this game is card design, the cards are overloaded with a flamboyant excessive frames, that hide the excellent art and in general is distracting and unnecessary, but that's a very minor complain. I highly recommend this game!

review: Elements of Hearthstone implemented to simplify the interface but it’s still very much its own thing. 2 player fully cooperative and a good challenge on expert mode. Deck building options pale in comparison to the physical card game however this version wins on value. To put it into perspective the physical chapter packs are around £15 each and this game is £15 for 23 chapters. Nearly 50 hours play time with plans to run through it again in the future.
