author: {'steamid': '76561198055676270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 1660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1654619910}
review: well if you played the card game you probably like it. I played card game but hard to find people to play with you this was popular when all the card games came into being from X-GEN after MAGIC the Gather which I played in college created a market for any card games now during post 2000s however Lord of rings appears to have less rules than Magic the Gather  since literally every SIX months Magic the gathering add a new system into the game.  That being said this GAME doesn't define what these systems do for example BLOCK, AMBUSH, GUARD even with tutorial it doesn't even explain these core concepts since words don't match other games like Magic the gather.  So in that regard the PC game fails IMO.  If you never played games similar to MAGIC the Gathering you have zero clue.  Now even I have and first few hrs I am still trying to figure out what BLOCK does appears to maybe cut your damage in half, threat level extra.   The ability to get cards IMO is very broken especially for a single player.  You can't easily get points and ability to get cards to progress is very difficult maybe more difficult by not knowing what terms mean.   I tried to look for a DICTIONARY built in for last few hrs but never found it until several hours into the game being inside SETTINGS for dictionary.  Yet they could literally have a HOVER on card or dictionary instead it's buried three clicks in via settings and allows no method of keeping that up or hot key. You have to close it to go back to the game then repeat again if you find another word on card what does that now mean?  But overall doesn't have much in way of cards and yet have secret ways to get cards for each hero which is annoying.   The achievements or methods of getting these should be shown in game such as use this ability 25 times then get this and have cards shown.  Yet literally you can not even see these cards until they unlock so you don't even know if worth unlocking.   Lastly the game lacking additional cards to make your deck powerful such as have different Frodos one of ordinary hero than second as elite which does something else this way Magic Kept their Color specific Plain Heros for their later years.   Of course I think lord of rings stopped after few expansions and died.  Mechanics were a bit wonky IMO with fate stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009785376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 1632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1632, 'last_played': 1624178101}
review: Build a deck of iconic heroes and challenge the forces of Sauron in this thrilling tactical card game. Travel through famous locations, complete story-driven quests and forge a new legend of Middle-earth on your own or with a friend in cooperative mode. But beware: the Eye of Sauron is searching for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055035089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 17612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10369, 'last_played': 1697203706}
review:
While not a complete copy of the LOTR Living Card Game, there are enough similarities to make this a good game. As you will see I have over 170 hours invested, so it has kept me entertained, mainly by chasing achievements and unlocks as well as the deck building and quality scenarios.

Like the LCG, the game does try its best to kill you, especially if you do not build a suitable deck to take on a challenge. Specifically the Balrog, who is nails.

The only issue I have with the game (bar the need for more DLC adventures and a fix for super wide monitors which will likely be coming) is the inability to complete some of the achievements - specifically the Gondor one as there are not enough characters available to do it. Why have it there in the base game if it is not achievable? Add it later sure, but that's just daft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093365788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9465, 'last_played': 1707628152}
review:
玩了150个小时了，非常好玩的游戏，尽管存在一些中文翻译上的瑕疵，但影响不大。游戏一直都有在更新，让我非常感动，其实我都以为没什么人玩了，要知道这游戏在国内讨论度基本为0。尤其是更新的洛汗大型战役，内容量很足的一次更新，
非常喜欢这款游戏，为此买了两份，和朋友一起玩，但大家各有各的事情，机会也不多，这游戏单人和双人真的完全不同，双人可以使用更多单人模式用起来十分困难的牌组，因为队友可以帮你弥补你卡组缺少回复或者缺少攻击力等这样那样的问题。
希望能出一个大的DLC，付费也无所谓。如果能出单人操作两幅卡组的模式就更棒了！

author: {'steamid': '76561198241822482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1619860665}
review:
和桌游版的规则有所不同，大框架相似，但大量精简、改造了具体规则，应该是为了更适应电子版的操作。
桌游版中玩家掌控节奏、敌人自动回应的解谜式体验，变成了敌我交替一次一动的对战卡牌式体验。
不过这种一次一动的新机制，倒是也带来了独特的策略感。

author: {'steamid': '76561197964370172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2369, 'last_played': 1621107203}
review: I really like this game but Asmodee Digital has awful support. I encountered a bug, and wanted to report it. There is a helpful button in the pause menu that takes you directly to the support forum where in theory you can report issues. There appears to not actually be any information there beyond a very basic FAQ, but you can still submit issues on a basic contact form. I typed out what happened, and hit "submit." It gave a little quiz to verify I'm a human. I passed, and it said "continue with your action." Nothing else happened so I hit "submit" again. It gave the verification quiz again, but this time it was shorter. Then again. Then again. Then again. Each time it got shorter until I only had to do two rounds. And then...it kept happening. I did it about 12 times just to make sure. So apparently it is impossible to report bugs, and if they're not receiving bug reports, they're probably not fixing them. Maybe there is just something strange going on with my system in particular, but if that's the case I have no way to get help, so I'm posting this here. Would gladly recommend the game if not for this ridiculousness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053429139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1618286194}
review:
This game is a mixed bag. Some aspects very good, but overall a bad game.

The art in this game is really cool. Each mission is narrated before/after and in most cases during the missions as well. There are a lot of cards to unlock and cards tend to have a different feel to them with situations where one might be better for particular missions. 

Thats about all the good things I can say about it. As for some of the bad things .... Ohhh boy.
1) The home-screen UI: Its completely horrendous, probably because it was made to accommodate people playing the game on their phones. In order to go from editing your deck to the mission screen take many many clicks. It should just have a deck editor button at the top of the screen at all times while on the home screen, but they decided to have this gigantic tiles to navigate the menu (possibly to show off some cool art I don't know). But the end result is for someone who has played a lot of deck builders is frustration.

The other issue is when you relaunch the game its difficult to navigate where you left off last in the story. It should just have a continue button, but instead you have to click through about 4 screens (more if you clicked one or two wrong which is easy to do). JUST MAKE IT SIMPLE.

Ok so a few UI snafus, I could handle this but.....

2) Gameplay: The meat and potatoes of the game. It has some pretty great mechanics: Starting with a customizing 'fellowship' of 3 characters, Defending on any unit, Powers, Exploring to get unique events, Exploring to counter the AI's cards it all feels really smooth until.... well, it basically comes down to you controlling the board then moving on to the next event, then when the new event happens you have a superior force to handle the next event and it snowballs into an easy win. The missions are broken into 3-5 different locations and once you defeat the first location you move on to another with your same units you had out before (on the rare situation you may lose or gain a unit at the next location). So the general game plan is build up an overwhelming army on the first location, then travel and smooth sailing for the rest of the mission, maybe theres more nuance in later missions, but that seems to work all the time thus far (I played on the medium difficulty 2/3, maybe on the final difficulty its extremely challenging).

The game might be ok. I love card games but this one is not that exciting for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066439950', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1618252402}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057561409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 1478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1379, 'last_played': 1693033323}
review:
Внезапно весьма достойная карточная игра, даром что по лицензии. Заточена она в основном под одиночное прохождение, где вы силами свободных народов бьетесь против сил Саурона, и никак иначе. В  этом как плюс игры (ибо однотипные «дуэльки» с закосом под «Мотыгу» лично мне давно приелись), так и минус (кампаний тут не так уж много, а проходить одни и те же сценарии, только другой колодой, ну такое себе удовольствие). В целом напоминает эдакий настольный карточный «Аркхем», только в антураже Властелина Колец и несколько попроще, даже своя шкала безысходности есть. Разве что механика ближе к обычным карточным играм, да составляющегося из карт-локаций игрового поля нет.  Да, по сравнению с настольным оригиналом игра несколько изменена и упрощена, но как по мне оно и к лучшему, например, убрать явно избыточный параметр защиты и просто увеличить героям количество здоровья, как по мне было простым и элегантным решением.
	Из достоинств игры можно отметить красивое оформление (в кой-то веке не эксплуатирующее одну кинотрилогию), в меру оригинальный игровой процесс и неплохое разнообразие карт и их эффектов. Плюс тут вообще нет так «любимого» мной доната, все, что есть в игре,  приобретается за внутриигровую валюту, причем достаточно легко (кроме разве что двух бонусных героев, на них ценники непомерные). Из недостатков -  вышеупомянутый ограниченный контент да местами хромающий на обе ноги баланс, что, впрочем, для подобных вещей, так как здесь он не так важен, как в дуэльных играх. Ну и условия «выбивания» некоторых карт тоже такое себе (те, кто придумывал испытание для какого Арагорна – извращенцы). 
	Есть режим на двух игроков, но онлайн тут нынче мертвее пустошей мордорских, так что ежели возжелаете парного прохождение, то вам для этого дела понадобиться еще и верный товарищ. 
	Любителям красивых и нестандартных карточных игр всячески советую. А уж если вы любите то самый карточный «Аркхем», но он вам приелся (или же просто надоела непомерная жадность издателя этой игры), и вы искали чего-то похожего, но никак не могли найти, то берите, не прогадаете.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120567690', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 8095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7743, 'last_played': 1617541238}
review:
Ever since the online emergence of [i]Magic: The Gathering[/i] (sadly not available on Steam anymore), many developers tried to copy the formula and release their own version of a turn-based card game either for mobile phones or PC. A flux of these came in 2015, when even major companies put heavy emphasis on releasing entries of this genre expecting huge income. Many actually became more successful than the original, mainly more and more people began playing games on their smartphones and due to the simpler rules used compared to MTG.
The physical version of [i]The Lord of the Rings: Adventure Card Game[/i] was released in 2011 and besides being set in a very popular world, it displayed a fairly complex rule system. When its digital version came out to PC in 2019, it received storyline driven campaigns (similarly to MTG). Unfortunately it has one single major flaw: the total absence of player versus player mode.

The game offers 4 different types of content: 
1. Quick Play, a randomly generated short game against various opponents;
2. Adventures, or rather 'adventure' since (at the time of this review) it contains a single one only, named 'The Fords of Isen', which despite its length is a rather underwhelming experience, where we must stop an Orcish invasion with 2 overpowered Rohirrian heroes;
3. The main strength of the game with plot (!), the Campaigns, which contains 3 scenarios with 5-5 quests. After each beaten quest, a new card can be unlocked;
4. Encounters, with 3 high difficulty adventures, of which the most enjoyable one is The King of Carrion, where we must defeat a giant wolf possessed by a demonic entity.

steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2397915525

According to the story (the Campaigns) spiders and orcs are gathering in Mirkwood, attacking human settlements. Our job is to rescue Bilbo, who they have also captured and to find out who's behind the disturbance.

steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2389590531

At the beginning of each game, first we must choose 3 heroes with a deck of 30 cards, no more, no less and with a maximum of 2 copies of the same card. Each hero has strengths which make them useful (or outright mandatory) in certain missions and almost useless in others, except for Aragorn who due to his special ability - performing an extra action - is a welcome addition to any party throughout the entire game. Amongst the faces we can find (almost) all the important characters from Middle-Earth, with different attributes. Each hero belongs to one of the 4 spheres of influence: leadership, lore, spirit, or tactics. The combination of the spheres of our 3 heroes will define which cards we are allowed to pick. Some powerful cards will require us to select 2 or even all 3 of our heroes from the same sphere, but there's also something else we must consider: their race. This is very important since there are certain powerful cards that can enhance the abilities of characters belonging to a specific race and only they will get the benefits.

steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2393709633

There are 3 card types: ally, event and attachment cards. Ally cards summon followers, who are going to fight for us. Depending on their resource (mana points, of which we receive 3 at the beginning of each turn) cost, we can summon powerful allies, like Gandalf for example (unfortunately he leaves at the end of the turn he is summoned, which we can prevent by using the Narya card).
The most common card type is the event card, where basically all cards belong to that generate a certain effect, like healing, damage dealing or readying (we can use an ally again in the same turn). The preparation cards also fall under this category and these activate only when either us or Sauron acts, resulting in various effects, like preventing damage, exhausting characters or letting us reuse another event card for example.
The 3rd group, the attachment cards contain special upgrades, weapons and armor mostly, with which we can equip our characters, thus making them more powerful in combat (obviously we should use these on our heroes and most powerful allies).

So how does a battle look like? Our enemy, Sauron plays the cards and moves our opponents. To be honest, I'm not sure if he also has 30 cards just like we do, since I've never seen the AI running out of cards, which might happen to us during several longer quests. Although he also receives 3 mana/turn, it's important to note, that Sauron's cards are more powerful than ours, meaning he can summon stronger enemies for less resources (even on normal difficulty).
The number of our total cards, our deck is shown in the lower left corner - from which we can pull 2 random cards in every turn - along with our current mana (displayed by the large blue number). The little dots next to it show our active preparations and in the bottom we can see the cards that are in our hands (which can be played). We can hold a maximum of 9, if we get one more, we also have to destroy (discard) one. Unfortunately Sauron has very powerful treachery (the dark version of preparation) cards, which can destroy everything we have in our hands.
On each card its cost is displayed in the upper left corner and below its description. If we have an ally card (or a hero), the attributes are as follows: the blue axe represents the units combat skill, the yellow square is willpower, which is required to resolve objectives or battle spiritual enemies and finally the red shield shows health.
Objectives are special obstacles which are engaged by the willpower of our characters. Sometimes these offer and alternative to combat (such as finding an escape route instead of killing everyone), but often they MUST be solved in order to attain victory.
If we performed no action in a turn we can set our characters to guard (forces an enemy to attack them + dealing damage passively) or use their special power (if they have any). We can also spend willpower to boost our fate meter to unlock fate events, single-use effects unique to each quest and location to aid us. Sauron has a fate meter as well which charges on its own and he also uses these against us. Once his meter reaches 50 - he turns his gaze upon us - our game is over.

On higher difficulty the game gets insane: enemies have more health, Sauron gets 5 mana + draws 5 cards... our only hope is that the AI makes bad decisions. If we decide to play co-op: the game also gets significantly harder, but it is more fun nevertheless.

The graphics were a pleasant surprise since most card games have simple visuals. The detailed backgrounds of various locations add rather nicely to the atmosphere. The artwork of the cards are equally great just like the pictures acting as stationary cutscenes. I especially appreciated how the game managed to stay independent from the movies in regards of displaying original and authentic portraits (and voices!) for major characters. My only criticism is that many of the mentioned artworks differ in style (they were made by many artists) thus some have rather distinctive looks .
Both the voice-overs and the background audio are also spot on.

Despite the major flaw of not having a pvp-mode in a card game (the co-op is fun, but can't replace pvp) [i]The Lord of the Rings: Adventure Card Game[/i] stands out from the crowd of its kind. The story driven campaigns are fun and the hero/sphere system along with the effects of the fate meter offer plenty of variety and more complexity than other run-of-the-mill card games. 
It really is a shame that an important feature was left out - especially since the game is fairly balanced and still receives updates from time to time - because this way, sooner or later players will turn to another card game which does offer a pvp mode.

PROS
+ plenty of variety, fairly complex rule system
+ great LotR atmosphere
+ nice artwork
+ hidden, unlockable cards

CONS
- no pvp

RATING
7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198073386967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3064, 'last_played': 1617409878}
review:
Never played this in physical format, but from other comments seems like this ported correctly. 

Deckbuilders are not my favorite mechanics (for boardgames), but it is light here, meaning you don’t have to be an expert. Some games say they have theme, this isn’t a game, it just is theme. I got this on sale for $8 I think, which was well worth the novel it is. And I mean novel as in a book, because you spend more time reading the story than actually playing. Or listening to it, and the narrators are top notch. This isn’t just a few throwaway backstory lines, it’s a story. 

The gameplay itself is clever enough with meaningful decisions and variety. I see it referred to as a puzzle where the deckbuilding helps you beat the puzzle. Not sure on that yet. I played the entire solo campaigns (3 campaigns of 5 adventures each) with the starter deck you do the tutorial with. I failed the last adventure of the last campaign and then looked up about changing your deck. Did that and won. 

I’ll probably do some of the other solo challenge stuff, but after that, not sure how much replayability there is or me. Still, it’s cool and glad I got it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998827138', 'num_games_owned': 1217, 'num_reviews': 426, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1656216287}
review:
Before reading more about this game and purchasing it, I imagined that it was a digital version of the LOTR LCG (which is a pretty good LCG, by the way).

But instead, this game is only based on the physical LCG, and is its own thing, that makes more use of the fact that it is a digital product.

It's a fun singleplayer experience with varied difficulty options, I feel like it's an easy recommendation for people that are fans of both cardgames and LOTR.

One thing I do wish is that it was a bit more boardgame-y in regards to the AI (having every card have rules on them about what their preferred target is and such), instead of trying to have a normal cardgame AI. Still, it's a minor thing and their decision is probably better for most players in the digital media at the end of the day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155846345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1620301971}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030027926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1616366013}
review:
Gameplay doesn't make sense

Ie:

-The rules don't seem to apply to certain cards but there's no description on those cards to explain why.

-Some sections have a turn limit but you're not warned before hand.

-There's nothing to note if you have or haven't completed a section of a campaign; this makes it
difficult to figure out where to start again unless your part way through a section in which case there will be a section completion percentage displayed.

All-in-all the interface is far too vague for a game that is so unforgiving for bad choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072176921', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1615607752}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005694874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2852, 'last_played': 1668903487}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007046580', 'num_games_owned': 1695, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1615240499}
review:
I never played the actual LoTR card game, so I can't speak to how accurately it was implemented. However, this is a competent deck builder/battler.

Pros: 
-Great use of Tolkien's universe. The lore is there for fans (and respectably implemented) and the art is good. 
-Single player content. Legitimate campaigns, challenges, and battles to play through.
-Decent tutorialization in the guise of a campaign
-Relatively easy to understand rules, with some strategic depth to the choices you make
-Voice acting during the story bits is decent

Cons:
-Poorly designed UI. The UI feels like it was designed with touch controls in mind. This is my biggest complaint.
-No tool tips. I should be able to hover over an effect on a card and see what it does. As it is now, it must be searched in the glossary which is slightly cumbersome to use.
-Repetitive music
-A rewards points system for (so far) cosmetic unlocks. I know there's a multiplayer component to the game, but this is still a con for me as it can easily turn into a microtransaction-y thing (i.e., pay X points for this new card).

Honestly, if you enjoy card battlers and can get past the UI awkwardness, you'll enjoy your time here. Particularly if you're a fan of the LoTR universe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172239586', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1616284995}
review:
The game is intriguing and if you are a fan of the LOTR, there is a lot to like here.

It is a fun card based game and there are plenty of nuances to keep fans of this genre happy.

I will have to admit that the game is a bit glitchy here and there, but because the developers have tweaked it so that if you lose a battle or if there is a game ending glitch, you only have to restart at the beginning of the sub-level you are in - you don't have to restart at the beginning of the quest.  So, that was helpful in many situations of unfortunate death by the enemy or by Windows.

I am 9 hours into it and I have only played the single player part and I am enjoying it.  There is lots to unlock, lots of replay value to get all of the objectives and quests.  

There are a lot of achievements and I doubt I will be playing that long to try and get them all.  At the rate I am playing, it feels like you would have to put in some serious play hours to try and achieve all of the achievements.  I will work to play through the single player quests and that is probably all I will play.

It also feels like the developers could keep on adding content to this game because some parts fell like there is room for more.  From what I read, in 2020, they did add more DLC and content, bug fixes, and such.  I don't know if they will be continuing that or not.

Overall, a fun card based game in the LOTR universe.  The voice acting they have is great.  The graphics and card mechanics are well done.  Overall, an enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006555615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 5959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4956, 'last_played': 1616884714}
review:
A very good game that works well, both as a single player experience and in coop.

When it comes to coop collectible card games this and Faeria are the only real options on the table and they are both good in their own way.

Secondary aspects:
This game offer some new stories from the LotR universe that fit nicely into lore. The cutscenes are just written text with hand drawn illustrations but the texts are ok and the voice over is significantly above average. The graphics and sounds can be seen in the videos and they do their job well. Some ideas they had about visualising quest are really neat.

Core gameplay:
The game offers quite a few cards that work well but while the range is big enough for the game to be fun (the devs proclaim 300+ cards which is probably true) the range is still not where it should be. In addition it is not the most complex game of its kind (and that keeps it from being excellent) and it suffer from mediocre scenarios (gameplay wise). It will take a while - even for more experienced players - to really understand the cards and the strengths of the "spheres" they are categorized into. This phase is great. Once you get an understand though... well... things do not change much after that. You can try a couple of decks from different "spheres" and mix those but ultimately you will min-max your way into a corner. This phase of discovery and experimentation lasts longer if you play coop, of course, because you can combine two decks. 

Conclusion:
The initial phase of discovery lasts all throughout the three main campaigns (if you change your deck and keep experimenting with "spheres"). This means it is an easy recommendation. You will probably not re-play it though, unless you want to play it in coop mode as/with a casual player or with a child who will focus on the polish and lore.

The devs changed and the new devs delivered a free content drop that offered a SIGNIFICANTLY better/interesting/varied/dynamic experience than the three original campaigns. While the original campaigns were servicable and "good enough" (in particular in coop mode where those things tend to matter less) the new mini-campaign is excellent. Hopefully the devs will keep on supporting the game and offer some (paid) DLC on the same level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156942300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1613810414}
review:
Fun card game for those who don't want to think too much about competitive deck building. This game gives me the challenge and freedom to create my own decks and play them agains various quests. I prefer solo play and building decks to beat the specific quests and challenges. 

Playing on the standard difficulty has not been to challenging for me, but I do feel that I am required to make good decisions and take time to think about what I need to do. In other words you can't simply just breeze through the scenarios which is a good level of difficulty and keeps things fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198416301991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1668218126}
review: As a fan of the LotR LCG this is the PERFECT scratch to that itch. It's not an exact replica, but it's pretty close, and the fact you don't have to lug around cards, setup anything, etc. makes this game very playable and fun. If you like games like Hearthstone, but want more story to it, this is a great game for you to purchase. The music, voice acting, stories, and art feel VERY much like LotR and immerse players into the world. I'm impressed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080550791', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1613850538}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004439475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 4691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1643089295}
review:
Buggy and badly designed. Lost Rohan mission "hold the ford as long as possible" because I survived and enemy was never able to kill me for 30 turns straight, so it hit 50 threat and failed. It doesn't tell you that you must die to move ahead.

Original company (Fantasy Flight Interactive) was shut down, so they moved the game to a 2nd amateur studio that sucks at their job and hasn't added any real improvement in half a year.

EDIT: Also, being too incompetent to design fair and fun encounters, the enemy is literally allowed to cheat. It might look like he has a 5-hand deck, but the devs gave Sauron cheats so he has an entire 2nd hidden cheat hand containing hard-counters.

If you make a deck that has 30 events, instead of using his 5-hand deck, sauron will pull his "player discards all 10 event cards from his hand instantly" card from the hidden deck. If you have zero event cards in his deck, then he can play 5 creatures from his 5-hand deck instead of having to carry around this event-counter card. Likewise with a cheated-in permanently-discard-equipment card or cheated-in discard-allies card.

It's bad enough the company over-simplified the physical game to dumb it down, at least in the physical cardgame Sauron isn't allowed to cheat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035674245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1642822672}
review: I've been enjoying this game quite a bit. It has quickly become my most played digital board/card game on any platform. While the game itself can have a few technical slowdowns, they haven't prevented me from enjoying the game. The visual presentation is top notch and the game provides lots of interesting choices in terms of what cards to play and how to play them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983765838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1613784620}
review: I've had quite a bit of fun with this, and haven't experienced any bugs yet. I do think it is exceptionally important to note though, this IS NOT the same rule set as the physical Card Game. Not even close, it definitely is based on that and has some overlap, but it is streamlined quite a bit, and feels something in between Hearthstone and the original. As long as you're okay with that and have your expectations set to that, it's a fun diversion. It's not quite as good as the real card game, but it is certainly much easier to get to the table when you need that fix, and offers a few positives in its own right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044907383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15, 'playtime_at_review': 2042, 'last_played': 1711816070}
review:
[h1]A brilliant cooperative card game[/h1]

After finishing most of the content at least once, I felt this game deserved an objective review.

I, unfortunately, never played the physical LoTR Adventure card game, so I discovered this game with its digital version which, from what I have understood, is mostly the same in its base content but has original scenarios which change the rules or the flow.
As a Magic: The Gathering player and a Tolkien enthusiast, I was both very much interested and hesitant about this game, and only got it for a pitiful price from the Humble Bundle's [i]Asmodee Digital Tabletop 2gether bundle[/i].
And now that I have finally put my hands on it, I regret to have been so hesitant and ashamed to have bought it for so cheap.

Obviously, I was interested by this game because; Dwarfs rules, it's Middle-Earth, and a COOP strategic card game. The cooperative part being the cherry on top for me, as coop games are the most fun, entertaining and interesting for me.
And I was hesitant because; the oval design of the played cards on the board despises me (maybe am I biased because I dislike Heartstone) and the overall user interface looked not that great, which translates to me as not a good sign because from my large card games' experience it usually means a poor, not smooth game. And that it looked too simple, as I like complexe and deep strategical games.
But, of course, all of this is totally subjective to my own perception and preferences and could be very much unisgnificant for other players.

And, even though it is perfectible, the game proved me wrong on my reluctances and convinced me to get my hands on the physical game as soon as possible.


Here are my Pros and Cons;

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*]It's challenging, for players interested in higher difficulties than the default one
[*]Sauron's resources and minions adapt to cooperative games, meaning it's harder in COOP.
[*]While not complicated, it's still a card game where strategy matters, so does deck building and synergies.
[*]It is a scenarized and narrative card game, meaning you don't just mindlessly fight up Sauron's minions, but there is adventure story and campaign to follow, listen or read. Which can be skipped, of course.
[*]Interesting and well done deck building limitations, turning around three Heroes leaders that could or could not be from the same attribut.
[*]While it has some non canonical elements, it's still true to Tolkien's work, and is a pleasant addition.
[*]It has a large amount of customisation, from card's back (both player and Sauron's one), player's avatar and audible emotes, to Heroes illustration.
[*]There is many unlockable cards or cosmetics to earn by playing.
[*]Illustrations are original and well done. Some audible emotes are original, and some of them are famous catchphrases from the movies.
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*]The user interface, while not problematic, seems more oriented for mobiles and tablets since we need to click at button to scroll down -opening up menus- and click at the top arrow button to scroll back up, and drag right and left to scroll the lines. It is confusing because it's a mix of button click and screen draging. and most of those screen drag could be on the same screen.
[*]The amount of cards is not much large. It is still sufficient to create many different decks and synergies but there is not enough in my book.
[*]Amount of content is decent but not large either. Apparently more is planned as scenarized Adventures, which is pretty good, at least the only one in game, as of now, is.
[*]Unlockable cards, particularily the Heroes' rewards, while engaging and challenging in some case, can also be the overkill RNG PITA. As well as some of them being not even worth any effort. It's killing all the fun that the challenge could grant at first.
[*]No customizable game. We cannot create a game and a card deck with custom rules and penalities, it is a missed opportunity, too bad !
[*]No way to know how to obtain certain cards before you actually complete their prerequists.
[*]No PvP. It would have been interesting to have a game mode letting us play as Sauron and interfere in other players quests. And letting us build a deck with Sauron's cards, of course.
[/list]

I would suggest to the Developpers to;
[list]
[*]Add more cards and heroes. 
[*]Rework or redesign the unlockable cards to have less RNG prerequists and some of them to be better cards.
[*]Add a codex or something that list all the quests' challenges and unlockable rewards. 
[*]Remove the oval frame around the cards on the board, to make something less cluttering. Let us have full art cards on board !
[*]Implement custom deck and game rules and penalities (singleplayer and coop), it would be awesome !
[*]Any mode letting us play as Sauron, and building deck with his cards.

The UI also could benefit from a redesign but I've read it is actually the result of a redesign and let's be honest, it's not important at all as long as it works.
[/list]


In conclusion, it's a game that I very much recomend to any one interested in a LoTR card game, a cooperative card game and a not too complicated but still challenging and strategical card game.

It is a shame there is not a large player base, and this game deserves much love !

author: {'steamid': '76561198025204060', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1613351752}
review: Rien de bien extravagant, mais des mécaniques intéressantes et, surtout, un mode campagne avec des quêtes et des objectifs à atteindre lors des duels, chose qu'on ne voit à peu près jamais dans CCG. Par contre, les cartes manquent d'attrait; je ne ressent pas une excitation de jouer pour en découvrir de nouvelles et améliorer ma collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036575192', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1612979180}
review:
I picked this up as the physical card game typically tops rankings of best co-op games, and I've been looking for co-op games to play with my partner. Be forewarned: this game has no local co-op play. This makes it more or less useless for my purposes, but as I picked it up in a bundle for a modest price, I'm not too broken up about it.

It you're interested in playing solo, or playing with remote friends, this may work for you. But if you were hoping for a local co-op experience, you may just have to buy the physical game instead of this version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044621857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1612982856}
review:
Hello everyone,

I tried this game after playing the physical card game, and I am not disappointed at all. The new changes are great and it is to me a very good card game. The possibility to play in coop is much appreciated, as much as the "definitive" edition that makes you pay only for the base game. 

I see people complaining about the "cheese", but what do you expect. Just like the physical game, each scenarios has different challenges and mechanics that makes you change your deck in order to adapt and win. 

I would definitely recommend it, good job devs :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198122479266', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1614091065}
review:
I've encountered a couple bugs already by the 3rd hour in the game, but damn, this game is AMAZING! 
Although I would prefer if it were exactly as the board game version, I really like how it plays out and it is still quite true to the board game's spirit anyway.
This is one of my favourite card games ever and up there with the top big ones.
Highly recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990048483', 'num_games_owned': 763, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1613325965}
review: Not really a 1 to 1 adaptation, but a very well made experience for people who like solo or cooperative card games. The system to unlock new cards is fairly done in that no random booster opening is needed and all cards can be unlocked directly either by quests or by points earned from simply playing. It seems that most of the current map pool can be easily unlocked by simply playing along the campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035504910', 'num_games_owned': 3852, 'num_reviews': 1575, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1612460035}
review:
Polished PVE adventure card game with great graphics and mechanics. Play 4 different game modes: Quick Play, Adventures, Campaigns and Encounters. Build decks or select a premade one. Up to 3 heroes per deck. 

Another way to enjoy the LOTR epic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993464335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1705195772}
review: I was interested in trying this out after playing Arkham Horror the Card Game. They are more different than I expected, but I really enjoy both. I'm hooked, having a blast playing through the campaign.

review: Awesome strategy based card game that both respects the lore, and provides a dynamic gaming experience.

review:
A relatively simple card game, but story-rich and fun to play. Has enough card variety to play through the various missions and campaigns a few times over. And enough difficulty settings to present a challenge even for demanding players.
Note: at the standard difficulty level, the campaigns are mostly a cake-walk (which I personally consider a positive).

author: {'steamid': '76561198039222800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1612409984}
review:
Asmodee Digital and Anithero Studios combine their efforts in tackling the CCG market with this fun filled digital representation of Tolkien's classic Epic. As an admirer and player of many collective card games. The one thing I have always enjoyed was the turn based quality and execution of some of the best card games in the world. I took a very fast look at this game in action and my first impressions were quite surprising and found some things that may need to improve
What I liked:
It's Tolkien alright: The voices, the narration, the wonderful artwork, card styles and play style is all the Lord of the Rings classics. Reminded me of when I read these tales to my kids. Well done.
Aesthetics: The look and feel is middle earth as well from the magic, the guards, themes, and even the terminology is all Rings. If you love Tolkien's classic you will admire the beauty of the presentation they have done. Story, Art, Voices, Characters all there for your enjoyment.
Terminology: Once you go through the tutorial, learn the different aspects of the game and you need to pay attention. You get a clean grasp of the base concept enough to build your own decks. 
Base: Its a great start to many expansions down the line. 
Simple Card Turns: You go, he goes in one turn movements. Child's play
Animation: Nice sounds and effects to each executed card.

What I feel can improve in time:
UI: The layout threw me off a bit and I found navigating at times to be a little difficult. Though you can highlight a card. Its text should be much larger and dynamic for the eye impaired. I sometimes felt lost which could be confusing to the young.
Mechanics: It's not their base system and card flow that I have issue. I warn that future expansions with too many mechanics could unbalance things. 
Depth: It is priced well with a good amount of content for that price and it was also nice to see them not do a CCG pay to win style game. However, it leaves you wanting much more  and that is good if they add much more. Otherwise you feel a little thirsty. 

Anti Hero Studios does a wonderful job with the Lord of the Rings CCG. Great hard work in its story that sticks to the great epic novel. There is a lot to like for the 'base' template introduction. If you love Lord of the Rings, then you will enjoy the CCG and in time I am sure it will be built on with great passion and care. See the video game play before laying down the mead. A pleasant surprise and a nice start. My Grade 3.7 out of 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198140859129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 14758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2569, 'last_played': 1656057945}
review:
The game offers a lot of fun! It differs from the board game, but it is still mantains most elements and strategy. You can pick your heroes, build your deck and confront Sauron in 3 campaings and some extra misiions and challenges as well. 3 levels of difficulty (normal, advanced, nightmare)  I tried the advanced level and the game was rather challenging in most quests.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125268185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1612718228}
review: The game is made for both teenage and mature audience. It's intellectually stimulative for a single player and community friendly with cooperative mode which is cross-platform. It was developed with much care and respect to the Tolkien's work, with good story-telling, nice artwork, voice acting and so on. Game mechanic is a bit complex in the beginning, but with learning the satisfaction of playing and understanding the game only rises. Campaign, various other modes and expansions are well made. They have a very good replayability even for single players using offline mode - and I barely started the campaign with many hours still to go! Deck building is fun and interesting because of different styles of play, choosing from a great pool of cards (of at least 22 Heroes and over 200 or 300 cards). It's fun unlocking and discovering new cards, various cosmetics or Sauron's card gallery. New in-game features and content are coming in near future updates. The game is both a nice start and additional experience in exploring the Middle-earth. Hence it is a must have for fans of Tolkien as well as very much enjoyable to the lovers of card games and board games. Considering the amount of prices which are spent on free-to-play (card) games, especially mobile games, and mainly on some temporary premium season pass or bonuses or cosmetics, the current version (1.5.0 from January 2021) of the Definitive Edition for the full price which can be even found on 50% discount - is a bargain because it is an above average and complete product. The publisher and developer deserve it due to sheer amount of dedication, future updates, positive interaction and feedback from the community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077296833', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1609619785}
review:
The fact that this game has been brought back to life and active development was perhaps one of the best things in regards to world of gaming for me. 

It's a niche game but it brings a lot of interesting concepts from LOTR LCG physical edition and tweak it in a fun, voice acting and nicely paced game.

I look forward to future content, that said the game packs more than enough at the moment to keep you on those and has nice sense of progression and reward to it.

While this game carries the same title and a lot folks coming to it have expectations that this is exact replica of physical, it's simply not. It plays in a very similar way, yet different and my opinion fairs better than core edition and first few expansions of physical edition ever did (not to mention it is by far more cheaper than physical edition ever was)

It's really fun (did i say that, already?) and brings forward something the physical edition could never,  narrative. Yeah sure some of you do immerse but most people play LOTR LCG for the sake of building the most efficient decks to beat this and that campaign. 

Well guess what? You get the best of both and since the game is back in tracks and no longer on hiatus, I warmly recommend it, especially to new comers who were turned away by steep price of Physical edition and some of the clunky, confusing and infamous  mechanics. (unlike with physical - I do too much comparison, but it's necassary; you won't spend hours and hours googling and browsing forums, reading FAQs and scratching the head on whatever or not you undestood the card description (everyone who plays physical edition knows what I mean)).  

The digital edition has everything in game you require to understand and it can do a bit better job of implementing additional tool tips (instead of browsing glossary to find keywords) but in nutshell you won't be confused and wonder whatever or not you played something right, underplayed it or overplayed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993211418', 'num_games_owned': 751, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1609384872}
review:
So far, I really enjoy this game and I recommend it to every card games enthusiasts and/or Tolkien's fans. There is some awkwardness to it though, and it might not be for everybody.

The good:
++ The Tolkien's lore is really well integrated in the gameplay mechanics and in the multiple texts and story elements. It reminds me a bit more of the Hobbit (the book, not the awful movies) and less about TLOTR
++ A lot of gameplay variety. You create your own combinations of 3 heroes from a pool of 20, and build your deck of 30 cards around those heroes. Decks feel much more unique than in any card game I played previously
+ Art is good, but glitches and awkward UI will take your attention from it. Concept art in menus is better than the gameplay art.
+ Story is well narrated and the writing is not bad, but not great either in my opinion. It is the best I have seen in a card game except maybe for Gwent
+ Music is good, but repetitive after some time

The cons:
- No real choices in the campaign except for some rare options pick which does not influence anything in the long term (pick card A or card B). I would have liked to make important decisions. Go through the Moria or over the Caradhras? Save a village at the risk of losing the orcs you are pursuing? This kind of things.
- UI is awkward at best. You will see UI popping in and out of existence, I had light bugs where the goal of my quest would not display. The main menu is completely awful and should be started from scratch.
-- Tooltips are non-existent. Sometimes, you encounter keywords and have no clue about what they mean. There is a glossary in the options, but it feels like hovering a card should extend a tooltip about its effects.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961164579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1532, 'last_played': 1689379672}
review:
This is a great varied deck game based on Lord of the Rings. If you are a Lord of the Rings fan and find many of the games lacking the feel of Middle Earth or staying true to style and content of the books, I find this is the best game in some time to achieve this well. 

Firstly, when you buy the game it comes with all cards in it and all campaigns. There is no paying for extra cards using real life cash. However, you start with a base set of cards and can unlock cards by earning in game points. This works well as it gives a sense of progression in terms of your decks, and means even if you fail a campaign, you may gain enough points to improve your deck.

Pros:
 - Great variety in quests/campaigns. Its not just about combat, there is fate system and objectives in each battle. The style and method to win varies and you will find yourself tweaking your deck and play style to suit. This keeps the game fresh and interesting.
 - The decks and cards - lots of good heroes and cards to use and unlock. There are types of cards but I refer to them as their colours (red, blue, green, purple etc). Depending on which colour a hero is (you can take 3 per deck), dictates what cards you can select. If you have two of one colour in terms of hero it unlocks cards more in that colour's specialism. This leads to a lot of nice variety and options in decks
 - As mentioned before, this feels like Lord of the Rings in terms of lore and style. The stories are decent enough and interesting
 - In mission events really can add to the fun and difficulty.
 - Hard enough to be a good challenge (if you don't play on standard)
 - New owners who plan to add new content and campaigns. They already altered one aspect where if you lost one mission inside a campaign it always set you back to the very start. This was very challenging. Now you can retry a failed mission from the state you started it in. This is a better way for the game to work as, while I liked the harsh challenge from before, it did put you off playing at points.

Cons:
 - Like most deck games, there are cards and hero's which become a must have like Arwen but its not that bad and you can succeed with many different decks
 - The menu system is a bit clunky and not nice to use. Feels like it was made more for a touchscreen device. However, in game is absolutely fine so this is a very minor gripe.

Overall: This is one of my favourite buys from 2020

review:
A very well implemented digital version of the tabletop card game by FFG. It has been streamlined to fit the media better, but the core mechanics are similar enough to make it engaging and interesting to play. 
Superb card art and great voice-acting in the story parts of the campaigns.
Would totally recomend for people that enjoy playing deck builders.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312007218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3161, 'last_played': 1632111241}
review:
Comprei este jogo acreditando que era igual ao Lord of The Rings: Card Game da Fantasy Flight (edição de mesa). 
Ele é diferente, mas funciona muito bem. 
O modo cooperativo é uma ótima sacada, igualmente o jogo Sentinelas do Multiverso, é um dos poucos Card Games cooperativos existentes, e que dá para jogar online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024774390', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1616684523}
review:
Just one word.... AWESOME!!! 

1. I love the deckbuilding and progression system. It allows for hours and hours of fun.
2. I like the different modes. Quick game for 10 min (skirmish) - or a campaign - or a.... sheer fun!
3. No bugs
4. Still being actively developed
5. Great price (due to sale)

Pick it up when its on sale and just have amazing fun for loads and loads of time. You cant go wrong with this one!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979907266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1611380358}
review:
~3C's~  Couples Co-Op Conclusion:  9/10
An extremely relaxing yet fun co-op card game. We often play this in-between anticipated game releases and can pick where we left off no problem.  The only negative is that Standard Mode is too easy and Expert Mode is much harder. There needs to be a medium mode option.  Otherwise, this is incredibly fun game for a couple looking to kill time and converse in a chill environment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003834900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1606518676}
review:
I love the lore of LoTR and was hoping for a Black Friday discount, but regardless I proceeded and treated myself.

Sadly, it does not really run on macOS Big Sur (v 11.0.1) as it kept prompting me to enter my account password to enable Developer Tools for debugging. Once entered, it would freeze with spinning pinwheel. Force Quit only helped and I tried ticking the box next to it (manually add) in Sys. Pref. > Sec. & Privacy > Privacy > Dev. Tools, but would start the game into black screen and aforementioned spinning pinwheel.

Sadly, I had to request a refund and I have to give a thumb down due to technical difficulties.

review: The gameplay is not comparable to the real LCG. Everyone expecting a similar game will notice some mayor differences.  Deckbuilding is less fun and unnecessary complicated compared to other deck building games. The gameplay is entertaining for some time, but get's boring fast. The menus are a mess and only half of them is visible on a smaller laptop screen (or it's to complicated for me to find the right menu).

author: {'steamid': '76561198098234534', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1682630759}
review: Do you really think that changing the main menu flow it's a good move to improve the game? Removing the global map not just didn't help, it harmed the game story flow. The new UI makes me very uncomfortable. Please return the map back to the game, let players feel their global progress. Don't change things that work fine. Add meaningful content, add new stories and campaigns, add missing localizations. Before switching dev team I was playing this game from time to time. Now, after checking the changes I think about removing the game from my PC. That's a bad sign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005529409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 6159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6144, 'last_played': 1709324534}
review:
Decent conversion of the tabletop version of the game. It's a solid card game to co-op with a friend, but it's not something I would play on my own. It's a lot of fun with a friend however and there are quite a few fun decks you can make. The game had a long period of silence due to the previous development team being shut down, but they have been replaced by a new team who seem as motivated as ever.
It's a shame they are prioritizing single player content first, but they do aim to add more co-op content later down the road so if you are like me I would wait until whenever that is, but if you do enjoy playing adventure card games on your own then you might as well give this game a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052753213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1664220925}

review: I love this game, I was so upset when the game was benched, having heard it was picked up again and being worked on I thought I'd take a peek, and what they've done is wonderful, they've kept the spirit of the game and continue to grow the game adding new and exciting content, really this game is well worth the value and their business model just means you're going to get more and more content, if your a LOTR fan, and a card game Fan this game is perfect for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997459751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2375, 'last_played': 1649024187}
review: This game started out so good, sadly it has gone (way) downhill from there. Just another game that is soo.. broken i guess (probably not the right word here as none of the cards for their cost/ability are crazy, but the situations that you are put in and the HUGE advantage the AI starts with is just stupid). He starts with more cards in hand, 2-3x the resource to cast those cards, unit's atleast = to your starting amount, add to that the random shit that his locations do if you don't get rid of them (usually requiring wasting 2 attacks just to get rid of one) free shit that he gets it seems every other turn because you haven't beaten that episode fast enough, limitation on amount of units you can control while there is no such stipulation on his side, it all adds up to having no feeling of accomplishment when/if you beat a level, you just feel as though you were cheaper than the game. maybe some people like that feeling, i do not. Am i saying the situations can't be beat, no, what i'm saying is without the right deck and combinations of cards, it's not worth the effort to try. imagine if the books had been like, they'd all be dead b4 the end of the 1st book, oh borramir isn't in the party, well you can't win, everyone's dead. the point of card games with x# of cards is that you should be able to play how you want, with the cards that you want and have a decent chance of winning as long as your deck is sound, not auto lose because you aren't using a specific card/combination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019095872', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1604262622}
review:
I'm sorry, but this is a great game held back by poor performance. The game randomly just stops everything from progressing in the middle of your game. I have tried over 5 times now to get through the very first quest in the game but every time I've been stopped by the game glitching out. Typically you'll just sit there, unable to play cards, unable to use the cards already played, unable to interact with the game in any way other than restarting from the beginning yet again.

This is clearly a shoddy mobile game ported to PC. Buy it only on sale and only if you're willing to constantly have to restart quests thanks to the game bugging out.

review:
Come gioco di carte è piuttosto impegnativo (le regole sono semplici da acquisire anche grazie al tutorial); insomma basta avere giocato alla prima edizione di Magic The Gathering. Il gameplay è tosto e le sfide piuttosto difficili da vincere, bisogna davvero ponderare bene le proprie mosse. 
...Poi, sinceramente, quello che prende è l'ambientazione e la storia parallela a quella dello Hobbit-LOTR: ecco, questo rende il gioco un MUST HAVE per i fan. Io l'ho preso in sconto a ca 10€. Non lo valuterei più di così.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044613800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1604066126}
review:
Avant tout, je n'ai jamais joué au jeu physique et j'en ignore les règles. Je ne fais donc aucune comparaison et m'en tient au contenu de ce jeu, en tant que jeu de cartes électronique comme les autres.

Le jeu est agréable à prendre en main, grâce à un design magnifique, une bonne narration et une excellente atmosphère. Cependant, il y a de gros défauts de mécaniques de jeu et d'ergonomie.

Ergonomie.
- Très mauvaise traduction FR, avec même des portions non traduites.
- Un menu principal très pénible où il faut faire défiler les écrans pour revenir.
- Beaucoup de mot-clés de capacités n'apparaissant pas au survol de la souris. Obliger d'ouvrir le glossaire très souvent.
- Le deckbuilder ne retient pas les informations de filtrage précédentes. Il faut recliquer sur les mêmes boutons chaque fois qu'on ouvre le constructeur.

Mécaniques de jeu.
- Le jeu contraint le joueur a faire un deck de 30 cartes exactement. De façon systématique, mon deck est vide durant les deux dernières séquence d'une campagne. Soit il fallait remélanger la défause au deck entre chaque séquence, soit il fallait laisser au joueur la possibilité de faire des decks plus volumineux, en gardant la valeur de 30 cartes comme minimum.
- Quelque chose foire dans le système d'alternance des actions : une action du joueur, puis celle de l'IA. En faisant ainsi, les seules actions possibles sont toujours les mêmes, provoquer des blocages afin de protéger ses alliés plus fragiles et infliger des dégats de contre. Autrement dit, pas de choix, pas de possibilité de jouer des cartes par exemple, si ce n'est après avoir subit toutes les attaques. Seul moyen d'avoir un peu de marge : déclarer des bloqueurs avant de voyager. Toujours déclarer un ou deux bloqueurs avant la fin d'une phase. Mais cela est bancal et pas toujours possible.
- Débloquer de nouvelles cartes est si lent...
- Tout cela provoque de la frustration et de la répétitivité, plutôt que du plaisir à déployer ses tactiques, jouer des cartes ou des capacités, calculer une stratégie d'ensemble lors d'une phase. Ce que propose pourtant la plupart des autres jeux de cartes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178206698', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1603799300}

author: {'steamid': '76561198136510870', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1613476489}
review:
Before we start, a quick thing.
I did not play this game on PC first. I've spent the last few months playing it on PS4. I bought this game on PSN, on sale at the lowest price it has ever been, and was expecting a rather run of the mill Hearthstone clone that was likely abandoned.
3 months later, here I am picking up a copy on Steam so I can play Fords of Isen and give bug reports and feedback to the Devs, who are not only friendly but have given me hope for post-launch revivals as a whole. The tight knit communication that the Devs have had with their community in reviving this, the absolute transparency, [spoiler]except for the rewards of this new mode (but those are a secret for people to react to][/spoiler], all of it has given me hope for this market as a whole. That games don't have to burn out due to being Games as a Service, but they can be revamped and even bolstered by new content and bug fixing. This game has given me optimism I long since felt died out inside me.
This review says 8 hours. I didn't stop playing until I started writing up this review. I wanted to see the new content and I wanted to know my faith in this Dev was validated. It was.
8 hours on PC, And I'll one day find out how much on PS4. But it's for sure triple digits.
So yeah, get this game. Even if you don't play it now, it's evolving. You'll come back to even more content and even more QoL updates.
I've nominated this game as the 2020 Labor of Love for The Steam Awards.
UPDATE: And the Devs have been true to their word, 1.5 is on all platforms. I also found out, thanks to the PSWrap Up, that I've spent a total 500 hours on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142177154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1710072611}
review: 有新制作组接手制作更新了，这游戏适合喜欢魔戒和卡牌PVE的玩家，游戏玩法有趣、CV出色，代入感强，美中不足就是多人模式我找不到主机。

author: {'steamid': '76561198235102316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1603723728}
review: Механики настольной версии изменены как минимум на 50%. ( а они были ой как хороши, на мой взгляд). Интересно ли играть в то, что получилось в цифровой адаптации? Скорее да, чем нет.  Симпатичные арты наконец-то  не по фильму, приятная музыка, неспешное раскладывание карточек в ПВЕ и никакой гонки с другими игроками. Любите подобное- смело берите, особенно по скидке. И да, русской локализации нет на данный момент, но базовых знаний эльфийского хватает чтобы понять то, что происходит в сценариях.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128310192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1688064763}
review: I don't normally play card games, but I have fallen in love with this one. Lord of the Rings is a great magical fun world and the stories in this game immerse you right into that world. The card art work is well done and beautiful. I would recommend this game to anyone who loves the Lord of the Rings universe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048994490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1665672263}
review: A nice card based game, with  origial artworks and a few original mechanics. Especially the singlepalyer mode ist refreshing and challenging most of the time. A few more heros or normal cards could be a good addition to the game as well as a rewarding animation for unlocking cards, but as it now stands i would recommend this game without a doubt.

review: o jogo foi abandonado pela produtora e não é igual ao jogo físico...se estiver bem barato pode ate valer a pena mas nao entendi de verdade o por que de nao terem feito o jogo identico ao físico, iria ser sucesso garantido

author: {'steamid': '76561197978244027', 'num_games_owned': 982, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1603276017}
review:
No microtransactions is good, the concept is nice as it's very close to the LCG, but:
- The game is full of bugs
- The ergonomy is VERY bad
- The keywords are not explained when you look at the cards (there is a 4km length glossary instead, wtf?)
- The game is slooooow, there is no "skip animations" mode, which makes it really painful to play
- Translation is not finished, half of the content is in english when playing in french
- Balance is not great, I beat every content of the game with the 3rd deck I made (standard cards)
- When I play some modes (despite this is the definitive edition), I have an error saying "no rewards. Do you want to buy this expansion?". WTF, which expansion? And there is no link nor buttons to buy anything. It looks like a bug.
- Fellowship tokens icon is a copy paste of the Facebook icon... come on, it's really disturbing.
-Reflects on the crystal ball. Just no, that's not how light works.

I'd like to recommend it as it has nice qualities... but no.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041511337', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1705216850}

author: {'steamid': '76561198333137976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1708706205}
review:
이 게임이 가장 아쉬운 점은 원작을 제대로 반영하지 못했단 점입니다.

Fantasy Flight Games 보드게임사의  원작인 The Lord Of The Rings : Living Card Games인데

이미지와 아주 기본적인 룰만 가져왔을 뿐, 모든 것을 새로 만들었다고 해도 과언이 아닙니다.

하지만 카드게임에 있어서 가장 중요한 것은 역시 카드풀이죠. 수많은 카드를 통한 덱 빌딩과 매우  많은 퀘스트들을 깨는 반복성이 매력인데, 이 게임은 아쉽게도 컨텐츠가 매우 부족합니다. 영웅 수도 많이 부족하구요.

아마 그 문제는 리모델링에서 온다고 생각합니다. 캐릭터를 다시 창조해야 하기 때문에, 시간이 많이 들겠죠.

룰도 마찬가지입니다. 원작도 매우 어려운 룰에 속하는 편인데 여기에는 새로운 용어가 더욱 추가되어서 적응하는데 어려움을 주고 있습니다. 원작에서 Response, Will, Explore, Exhaust, Shadow, Objective같은 매력적인 요소가 빠져있고, Guard, Ranged 등의 개념도 뒤바뀌어 원작을 기대했던 팬들에게는 아쉬움을 많이 남겼습니다.

이미 돌이킬 수 없게 되었지만 이 게임이 좀 더 흥하게 되려면 영웅의 수를 매우 많이 늘려야 하고 그에 맞게 카드와 켐페인. 나아가 Nightmare도입을 현실감있게 해야 합니다. 난이도를 단순히 몹의 체력 변경으로 끝내는 것은 너무 합니다.

반지의 제왕 LCG를 사랑하는 유저로써 스팀에 이 게임이 출시된다길래 정말 많은 기대를 했었지만, 기대가 큰 만큼 아쉬움도 많아 플레이타임을 더 할 수가 없었네요.

그래도 긍정적인 요소는 있습니다. 계속적인 업데이트가 조금씩이라도 있고 영웅의 스킨변경으로 하나의 캐릭터로 여러 능력의 영웅을 사용하는 기댓값은 사라졌지만 컬렉터 요소도 있어서 긍정적인 평가를 일단 남기겠습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037218545', 'num_games_owned': 1783, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1641863799}
review:
This is the next best iteration of the treasured story, after the film trilogy - Meaning - This doesn't throw out everything that the films have done for the universe, it takes all that further, encompassing all interpretations of the famed novel into a brand new imagining!

Gorgeously painted cards, backgrounds and story elements. 

The voice overs are done excellently, and hearing the familiar lines done in a new take is refreshing.

Beautiful music.

Challenging

author: {'steamid': '76561198090124571', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1603027594}
review:
更换了开发者，antihero。新开发者带来了非常宏伟的持续更新计划，今天（20.10.16）应该会更新离线模式，对于我们tc玩家来说，无疑是非常非常利好的消息，我已经重打无数次蜘蛛了。。
一直很喜欢单人冒险卡牌，但市面上多以dbg+rogue为主，类似魔戒lcg这样的构筑式很少，对于我来说，我更喜欢自己构筑战术的感觉，而不是在随机奖励中选择套路。所以，魔戒在这一点上满足了我的需求，而且我本身也是桌游玩家，对桌游改编游戏有天生的好感。我的游戏时间并不多，每次都是因为无法连接服务器而打断了我的冒险，每次掉线后都要从一关的开始重新再来，心态十分爆炸，这次更新过后，我终于可以毫无顾虑的踏上旅途了，感谢开发者做的努力。
游戏本身的品质没得说，非常优秀，完成度很高，你可能看着像炉石，但其实完全完全不一样。自带中文，之前好像还说要中配，不过有点痴心妄想。。
有一些小建议吧，就是鼠标悬停的卡牌会直接显示卡牌详情，并且显示这张卡的关键字效果，不然我每次都要点开教程里面去找需要查询的关键字。

author: {'steamid': '76561197974431963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1602708038}
review: An excellent re-creation of the physical card game. I like how the tutorial adds game concepts in a little at a time so new players won't get overwhelmed. All in all a grand journey into the lands of Middle Earth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352097815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6047, 'last_played': 1673569723}
review: Je suis un adepte de Magic et Hearthstone. Lord of the Rings:Adventure Card Game est un jeu de stratégie dans la même veine. J'aime bien le concept de jeu collaboratif qui est unique à ce jeu. J'aime aussi les défis qu'on doit résoudre pour obtenir les récompense de héros. Ça nous force à construire des decks particuliers et j'aime bâtir des decks sur mesure. J'ai joué plusieurs heures à ce jeu et ai eu toujours du plaisir dans ces sessions de jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975567641', 'num_games_owned': 2657, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 3613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1651266867}
review:
Ich hatte nie Probleme mit der Internetverbindung zum Server und konnte immer ungestört im Multiplayer spielen. Das kommt leider mit kleineren Wartezeiten daher (wie Lags), aber ist noch ok.
Zu zweit macht das Spiel Spaß und erinnert an die nicht-digitale Vorlage.

Ich habe jetzt alle Kampagnen und Herausforderungen durchgespielt. Die Herausforderungen waren echt Spaßig. Die dritte Kampagne war unfreiwillig komisch. Die ersten drei Abenteuer wirkten wie eine schlechte Komödie und waren für mich unpassend. Das liegt zu großen Teilen an der deutschen Übersetzung, die wohl gewollt witzig daherkommen soll. "Hinz" und "Kunz" sind nur zwei der furchtbaren Namen, die für die englischen genommen wurden...

Der männliche Sprecher in der dritten Kampagne weiß deutlich besser zu gefallen als einer aus den anderen, den ich störend fand.

Die dritte Kampagne war storytechnisch (und vor allem bei der Übersetzung) besonders enttäuschend.
Spielerisch gab es doch einige Herausforderungen und Neuerungen. Aber insgesamt schienen mir die früheren Abenteuer abwechslungsreicher.

Schade.

Es bleibt aber die Hoffnung auf viele Besserungen. Ein neuer Entwickler hat übernommen und will z.B. den Online-Zwang entfernen. Dieser existiert nur, weil das Spiel als F2P-Titel geplant war.
Somit hoffe ich auf viele Verbesserungen zumindest für künftige Abenteuer.

Ferner hoffe ich auf viele weitere Erweiterungen und Stories der Vorlage, sodass die vielen nervigen Grind-Achievements alleine durch das Spielen der kommenden Inhalte sich ergeben und nicht stupide 500x das einfachste passende Abenteuer immer wieder wiederholt werden muss...

Weil das Spiel durchaus Spaß macht, besonders zu zweit mit Sprachchat (Danke Steam!), gibt es noch eine Empfehlung trotz der Mängel.

Edit: Es gibt keinen Online-Zwang mehr! Die neue Menüoberfläche ist wohl für Handys gestaltet. Ich brauche viel mehr Klicks um irgendwo hinzukommen und um wieder zurückzukommen nochmal genauso viele. Da war die Weltkarte viel praktischer, sobald man sie verstanden hatte. Das ganze wäre etwas weniger schlimm, wenn bei großen Auflösungen wenigstens mal alle Abenteuer eine Kampagne zu sehen wären...
Die Herausforderungen und Belohnungen können auch nicht mehr so komfortabel eingesehen werden.
Hat man versehentlich das falsche Abenteuer einer Kampagne ausgewählt, muss man mit der Levelauswahl nochmal von Vorne beginnen. Total umständlich.
Es gibt jetzt den Abenteuermodus, der allerdings nicht im Multiplayer zur Verfügung steht. Daher habe ich den noch nicht gespielt. Er klingt auf jeden Fall vielversprechend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001965698', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1602716840}

author: {'steamid': '76561198269484324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1638073125}
review:
作为一名桌游玩家，对魔戒LCG本来十分期待，但就这款桌游电子化而言，做得尚有瑕疵。目前非常影响体验的问题有2种：1游戏的服务器很差，进游戏经常会失败，更谈不上联机进行游戏，这是最严重和影响体验的问题 2游戏因为制作组问题未来可能不再更新，完成度不会增加，不得不说是一种遗憾。
结论是，个人并不推荐购入steam的魔戒LCG，目前而言找大佬线下开游戏的体验是更好的选择。
