author: {'steamid': '76561198000763592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1697771853}
review:
Don't write reviews very often, but I want people to know that after completing the major of the game, I can say the Definitive Edition is finally a product worth buying, especially during a sale. You're getting at least 15-30hrs of content which access to all the cards available to date, which is a great value if you get this game for less than retail. I was watching the slow spiral of development with this game and feel thankful that I waited to pull the trigger till now. I'm excited to see the new developer's roadmap and I'm confident they can turn this game around. It won't be the smash-it Hearthstone-killer that Fantasy Flight hoped it would be, but at least it will be a playable, decent game.

Below is my view on what bad happened to this game...
The history of this game should be taught in a class if you want to a perfect example of how to alienate a loyal fan-base for a board game when you try to go digital.

Mistake #1: Know your audience

When this game was first announced, I was pumped. Like man, I was a huge fan of the original LCG and LCGs in general because of the huge middle finger they give to the pay-to-win TCG industry. But that was lost in the original development of this game. Someone at Fantasy Flight must have been salivating at the idea of turning this product into a microtransaction-laden cash cow, which in turn, really doomed the game from the start. Not to say your audience is cheap (buying all the sets for the paper LCG will still cost you over $1K USD) but they demand quality and value if they're going to shell out that cash. You burned them with trying to nickle and dime for small packs or huge sums for not enough content.

Mistake #2: Not everything needs to be Steam Early Access. 

Your audience is statistically going to be older than other IPs. Statically, your audience are adults, many with job and family responsibilities and not a lot of time to waste on a half-finished product. They're not twitch stream that are going to promote your half-finished game, and have a light-hearted laugh with their fans at your bugs. Instead, these people are going to try your game once, and if they're not impressed, go spend their precious time with something else.

Mistake #3 No online and co-op from the start with little emphasis on player interaction. 

This is a game meant to be played with others. This shouldn't have been something introduced so late in development and with almost no tools for player coperation

author: {'steamid': '76561198075597985', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1618172926}
review:
Довольно интересная и трудная карточная игра. Механики описаны в других отзывах, а посему я просто хотел бы помечтать об интересных нововведениях.

1) Хотелось бы увидеть кампании за тёмную сторону со своими механиками. 
2) Режим арены. Под него бы идеально зашла неканоничная история Талиона с возможностью выбирать новые карты из пула оппонента. Например после победы забрать себе капитана врага в качестве нового героя, а вместе с ним и простых юнитов в массовку. Но тут уже были бы проблемы с авторскими правами.
3) Какой-никакой ПвП режим. Хотелось бы сражаться не только с ботом, который с самого начала партии давит тебя числом, а ещё и с простыми игроками.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034742848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1652548442}
review:
As much as I love the living card game that this is based on and The Lord of the Rings itself I can't recommend this game. There's a distinct lack of cards to play with for a card game that's been out for over a year now. Why is Gloin only available in the tutorial and not a playable hero? Where's Thalin? Why are there three leadership sphere dwarf heroes and one tactics dwarf hero? Why do reward cards for characters have spheres that don't match that hero? I saw that another company is playing on taking over now that Fantasy Flight Interactive closed, whether or not they turn this ship around remains to be seen.

After playing more there doesn't seem to be much balance in regards to some heroes. For example, Dwalin gets a plus +1 to attack and willpower as long as he remains above 6 health. This works great until the game starts you against 3 enemy characters who deal 2-3 damage and then summon another 2-3 characters. The enemy will always have 3 resources to spend each round (the player only gets 3) and at least 4 cards to choose from (the player only draws two per round) and I'm not sure if any card they play costs more than 1 resource, many seem to cost 0.

Heroes like Dain need to be re-balanced. Currently he  provides +1 attack to dwarves and only dwarves. I don't find him to be a viable option unless you're building a dwarf only deck which you should only be doing if you're going for the achievement. Dwarves on their own are pretty lackluster, limiting you to 3 leadership heroes and 1 tactics hero. Why they had an achievement built around using only dwarves is beyond me but significantly worse is the one for Silvan characters when there's only two Silvan characters to use.

I also find the number of heroes required to play certain cards of certain spheres to be ridiculous. 

The cruel torturer and the 4 locations with 4 progress he spawns during The Mirror of Galadriel are heavily unbalanced to the point where I quit to main menu when he pops up.

Achievements are extremely grindy AND bugged, the ones for playing only certain types of characters being the biggest offenders I've seen. I find these achievements in particular (Dwarves, Noldor only) to be extremely frustrating to complete given the lack of cards and the sheer amount of completions required.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076838802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2472, 'last_played': 1599524508}
review: I really like the limited deckbuilding format that doesn't give me too many options that I have terrible difficulty building my deck while enough that I find my choices meaningful. I have been having fun with the cooperative, mission-based play but wish it could support more than 2 people. I also would like a difficulty between  "Narrative", which is now too easy with our unlocked cards, and the harder difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156502175', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3426, 'last_played': 1636821141}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972593599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 10163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 236, 'playtime_at_review': 3383, 'last_played': 1711862037}
review:
Number one, I do like the Lord of the Rings books and movies, so the setting is right up my alley.  I think they have done a great job with the campaign, and it's fun to play solo or co-op with my brother strategizing over the phone during the battles.  

There are a good number of cards to choose from to build and customize your deck and also cool heroes to select.  The quality of the voice acting is top notch and when they read the campaign introduction sequences it really sets the tone for the upcoming battles.

I was happy to hear a new company picked up the rights to continue to release new content for this game and hope they can produce similar high quality story arcs.  

I definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes deck battling games and has any interest in fantasy settings.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983601366', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1680170752}
review:
The LotR: Adventure Card Game is a digital version of the equally named physical card game which has been around since 2011. In this review, I'd like to break down the core gameplay elements and mention some the main differences compared the card game which I own (at least partially because it's mostly out of print these days). 

This game is essentially a deck builder in which you construct a deck of cards consisted by allies and events which help you overcome the quests during the campaigns of the game which is set in Tolkiens famous universe. Basically, you gain ressources in order to play cards which have various values, some cards manipulate the battlefield or your heroes. Many cards have unique effects which have synergies or actions which benefit you, the same applies to your opponent. The game is actually a solo or cooperative experience which sends you on a journey against Sauron, who tries to throw everything at you to make your adventure into a nightmare. Meanwhile, you also have to manage a threatmeter which increases steadily over time and causes nasty surprises to be thrown into your way. Additionally, there are other more nuanced mechanics suchs as guarding, generating faith points to unlock special cards, questing and many other things.

So, is this game worth it and for you? I would certainly say that this is a solid card game especially if you like Tolkiens universe. The game drips with well written dialogue and a nice narration which really sets the mood, many characters and locations are very familiar to those who enjoy the Tolkien unvierse. Definitely recommended for fans of the books. Overall, it's a very atmospheric package.

The game offers a tutorial, 3 main campaigns which are consisted by 5 scenarios, then some additional challenge quests and some other modes. This sounds like a lot but actually, it's pretty limited considering that the physical card game has tons of content. This game offers a decent amount of content but it might be lacking for some. Although I'd like to state that the game can be tough and it will take some time to complete quests. Furthermore, if you like customizing your decks, this game has a neat deckbuilding mode which allows to build your deck. Some player might dislike this but it's still an integral part of the game experience.

That aside, the gameplay experience is smooth and slick, nothing really to complain on a technical level. Additionally, the game has a terrific musical score and good voice acting which enhance the game experience.

There are some major changes from the physical game, notably the following:

-The ressource system has been streamlined and does not require "sphere" ressources for individual cards, you have a pool and just require heroes of a sphere in order to play cards
-The physical game has a 7 phase turn order where the game plays against you in a predetermined way with some randomness. The digital version has an active AI player which emulates playing against an active opponent similar to other card battling games. Turns are not as predictable and the AI switches up the tactics. 
-The cards themselves are very different in their effects compared to the physical counterparts, gameplay mechanics are changed or switched up for various heroes and cards.
-Some gameplay mechanics that exist in the physical card game have been streamlined into newer mechanics which provide a smoother experience (such as treachery cards).

I admit that the digital version feels less complex in some regards but the game plays a lot faster and smoother, having an active Sauron opponent which emulates a player was a bit jarring at first mostly because it deviates a lot from the physical counter part. That said, it makes only sense and suits the game well. I came to like it in the end.

Fortunately, the developpers decided to include all the dlcs into this package which makes it already a complete experience. But it's noticeable that the devs intended to sell adventure packs in the game to expand the game. Although it appears that the devs have recently changed after the game had died down, new content and changes are on the horizon. So it might be promising to get into this game.

Compared to other card games that might exist, this one feels a bit limited in it's scope. The community does not seem that active and there has not been much content recently. But you still might get a good amount of value out of this game after completing the main quests.

Definitely recommended for LotR fans who are into deckbuilding card games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968476081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1897, 'last_played': 1604350671}
review:
It's a good game, It has the nice lore of LOTR, narrative and voice acting, deck building and combos that can be interesting, there are factors like Sauron's 'threat' and your 'fate' to take into account during a match, each of which when reaching a certain point has specific events that can help you or Sauron, this adds another layer to consider over the usual card game the cards can affect these as well.
It's also nice to see that a new developer took over the game and already published a roadmap which should fix the most common issues.
I have only found two times where the game dropped becasue of a connection issue, I really hope this will be fixed, it has been confirmed that the online requirement for the single player campaign will be removed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350126637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1843, 'last_played': 1696053897}
review:
This is an extremely fun (but challenging) game. The three quests and encounters took me about 20 hours to complete. Due to large amount of customization and incentives for different play-styles (honestly, there are so many ways you could approach the game), my initial interest lasted a total of 25 hours. At that point I moved to the medium difficulty... which was a mistake, because this game is VERY challenging. I got frustrated after losing some very close quests in the final encounter stages and left it for a few weeks. When I came back to it I made the decision to embrace the "easy" (which still can be difficult) tier of difficulty, and it has been my best decision regarding the game. As a casual gamer I find this game very easy to pick up for a 40 minute round a couple of times per week. The hero rewards (additional cards to reward a hero after accomplish certain scenarios) and the deck building features give it two major points for replayability. As a Tolkien fan, as well as a fan of the board game version, I am very satisfied with how this game plays. It has the charm of Tolkien, and it streamlines the sometimes overcomplicated aspects of the tabletop version. The closure of the studio that created this game was disheartening, but it has been recently picked up by a new studio which is very exciting. Their roadmap looks to add a lot more to this game over the next year, so I would highly recommend this game to Tolkien fans looking for an immersive challenge. Worth the money. 

Also there is no micro-transactions, and the in-game currency strikes the perfect balance between being important to deck-building, but not infuriatingly hard to get. This combination keeps me coming back to it.

review:
I bought the game when it first came out and was very excited since I love card games. I was able to get through about 5 hours of the game. I would continually get the Lost Connection message and it would exit the current adventure and I would have to restart it again. 

I quit playing it and decided to give it a try today. I was able to play it for about 10 minutes before I got the dreaded Connection Lost message again. I only play single player campaigns. I have not checked into whether or not those  campaigns can be played offline yet. If not, then I will never be playing the game again. It's too bad because the game play is actually very good, but useless if I keep losing my connection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198874577973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1594242754}
review: Amazing game if you are LOTR fan. It is based on LOTR LCG card game which unfortunately I have not played. Therefore, I can't do any comparison. This is definitely engaging game that can take hours to play. AI has three difficulties, and for me the middle one has right amount of challenges, that I don't win every single time. There are couple scenarios you can play through or single challenge quests. The game has it is own rewarding system when by completing quests and set goals, you are unlocking new cards and other perks. So, you keep playing to try to unlock everything possible. Overall, I think this game fully deserves a place in your library if you are LOTR fan, and if you like deck building games with a fantasy theme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030153750', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2185, 'last_played': 1705879333}
review:
This game is not my usual cup of tea (I generally don't go in for card games, and have never played the physical version) but it has utterly cast its spell on me.
Even without the physical game to compare it to, it's clear it could use a coat of polish. Gorgeous graphics and settings are paired with lackluster music and voice acting. I find myself constantly fighting with the UI, and while I respect not including an "undo" feature for tactical blunders in the game, watching a one hour deep session go awry because I clicked on an "x" instead of a check is truly awful. 
But aside from that, my chief complaint is just that there isn't more of it to play. The core game is delightful and engrossing, and the campaigns last just long enough to really build up a solid party without dragging on or becoming boringly overpowered. I'd love to explore more of middle earth through this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072597745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1607117868}
review: It is a great implementation of the actual LCG from Fantasy Flight. I am quite excited to see what the new update will bring.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979363599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1949, 'last_played': 1593934922}
review:
I just finished this game on the hardest difficulty, mostly out of spite. For the majority of the quests, the AI and level mechanics are unbelievably oppressive and it straight up feels like you're playing against someone who is cheating (because you are).

I'm also confused about this being a definitive edition because the game seems unfinished. There are only 3 campaigns (5 levels each) and most of the world map is unused in the select screen. Several mechanics were introduced along the way with pop-up tutorials and never showed up again.

One last big annoyance: In single-player mode there are 3 difficulties to choose from. The middle difficulty is absent from cooperative mode for some unknown reason. You can only choose from Bilbo baby mode or Sauron's ultimate ball cruncher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028488055', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 3598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1665851752}
review:
[h1]No estaba muerto, estaba de parranda[/h1]

A comienzos de año conocíamos la noticia de que Fantasy Flight Interactive echaba el cierre, por lo que [i]The Lord of the Rings: Adventure Card Game[/i] no volvería a recibir contenido ni actualizaciones de ningún tipo. Parecía que el juego estaba muerto. No obstante, Asmodee Digital hacía oficial ayer que Antihero Studios continuará con su desarrollo, lo cual es sin duda una grandísima noticia y lo que ha motivado esta reseña.

Nos encontramos por tanto ante un nuevo y esperanzador comienzo, a pesar de que los desarrolladores que se harán cargo de este título a partir de ahora son totalmente desconocidos y aparentemente no tienen ningún bagaje en la industria (yo, al menos, no he encontrado apenas información acerca de ellos en la red).

Confío, no obstante, en que vayan a incluir más contenido, empresa que no debería de ser excesivamente complicada teniendo en consideración que este juego bebe de las mecánicas del LCG publicado en formato físico, que cuenta con incontables expansiones y contenido que podría ser empleado para ampliar el disponible en esta modalidad digital. A no ser, claro, que FFG no permita publicar expansiones en la línea de su juego físico. En cualquier caso, el anuncio ha sido muy escueto y todavía es pronto para sacar conclusiones, por lo que solo podemos especular.

[h1]Pros: [/h1]
-Un juego de cartas diferente a todos los que has podido ver hasta el momento y en el que las mecánicas no están enfocadas tanto a ganar partidas, sino a completar desafíos y, en suma, a vivir aventuras.
-Estamos ante un deckbuilding que, por el momento, cuenta con un nutrido número de cartas a las que podrás ir accediendo a medida que completes desafíos y consigas monedas para desbloquearlas. Gran variedad de personajes para crear tus mazos temáticos (dúnedain, elfos, hobbits, etc.), aunque obviamente no llega al nivel del clásico SATM.
-Puede parecer que el juego, tal y como está ahora mismo, carece de contenido. Nada más lejos. Si bien solo cuenta con 3 campañas (sin contar la del tutorial), cada una de ellas tiene 5 misiones largas y perfectamente rejugables para probar nuevos mazos y estrategias. Al mismo tiempo, podemos jugar otros desafíos y partidas aleatorias, lo que nos brinda más horas de juego.
-La posibilidad de jugarlo en modo cooperativo es un puntazo. Esto seguramente eche para atrás a parte del público que no encontrará aquí un juego de cartas competitivo al estilo de [i]Magic: The Gathering[/i]. 
-Muy buena narrativa que nos hace sumergirnos de lleno en las partidas, con escenarios bien ambientados en la Tierra Media.

[h1]Contras: [/h1]
-Incluso en single player, a día de hoy sigue siendo imposible jugarlo sin conexión.

Lo cierto es que pocos ‘peros’ más le puedo encontrar al juego, que es sumamente entretenido y hará las delicias de los fans del universo creado por J. R. R. Tolkien. Lo único que espero es que a partir de ahora no nos bombardeen a DLCs que hagan que los jugadores dejen de jugarlo y den con una fórmula interesante para que los desarrolladores saquen beneficios no únicamente a costa de que quienes confiamos en el proyecto tengamos que volver a invertir demasiado. El juego tiene potencial y me encantaría que volviera a llenarse de vida.

La pregunta puñetera: ¿dejará de llamarse ‘Definitive Edition’ al recibir nuevo contenido?

author: {'steamid': '76561198026608580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1536399425}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960915010', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1593370825}
review:
This game is a huge miss for me. I love other card games so I felt like this was worth a shot even with mediocre reviews but it is not. It doesn't have the story/exploration of a game like Thronebreaker and mechanically it's not as fun as most other card games like Slay The Spire.

- Campaign involves almost no interaction, from time to time you can choose a branching path but that's it
- The card game itself is slow/tedious, 1 move per turn, not as many moves as you can fit in per turn like a Hearthstone or Spire
- Difficult with no sense of progress
- Always online, the points you rack up to "buy" new cards is tied to an online account
- There's no one to play with online

This could have been an awesome game... but there are many better examples in the genre. Steer clear

author: {'steamid': '76561199067724470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1668015308}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057230391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 4019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3214, 'last_played': 1593334703}
review:
Unfortunately, due to bugs and lack of cards -- I would not recommend this game.
Either the game is too easy or too difficult without much inbetween. 
Not enough cards from the IRL game are available to make the challenging difficulty interesting; only a few cards and color combinations are really viable in it. More so; there is not enough card variety and too many vanilla cards. Better off finding other outlets for strategy single player card games. FFG at their best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973885494', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1593088792}
review:
Non mi è piaciuto, per via delle meccaniche poco interessanti, ma soprattutto per una componente narrativa che sembra ambientata in un fantasy generico, prendendo a prestito solo nomi e luoghi della Terra di Mezzo, senza rispecchiarne le atmosfere. Mi ha annoiato parecchio pur essendo un appassionato di Tolkien da una vita (oppure anzi, probabilmente a causa di questo motivo). Il vecchio gioco della ICE MIddle Earth: The Wizards, degli anni 90' aveva molto più spessore: la dimensione del viaggio, le regioni attraversate sulla mappa, la possibilità di impersonare Istari oppure Nazgul. 

Anche le illustrazioni di questo gioco, mi sembrano più prese da un fantasy generico, senza l'epicità e la capacità di immaginare qualcosa di nuovo, presente nelle illustrazioni storiche, di Angus MacBride, John Howe, Ted Nansmith (che poi sono coloro che in seguito hanno ispirato le immagini del film). Gli illustratori, pur bravi tecnicamente hanno tendenzialmente copiato e riproposto ciò che gia esisteva. Insomma un hack & slash privo sia della dimensione del viaggio che  della narrazione evocativa, triste, caratteristica della Terra di Mezzo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987517432', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1670693793}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057481229', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1754, 'last_played': 1592646911}
review:
반지의 제왕 테마의 PvE 카드게임. 반지의 제왕의 메인 스토리라인이 아니고, 곁가지로 벌어지는 오리지널 스토리. 중간 난이도로만 해도 상당히 어려운데, 그렇다고 쉬움으로 하면 너무 쉬워서 재미없을 정도. 중간 난이도로 꾸역꾸역 클리어했는데, 그렇게 끙끙대는 경험은 재미와 짜증 사이에서 줄타기를 하는 느낌이었고, 어려운 게임을 좋아하지 않는 나에게는 유쾌하지만은 않았다.
1. 반지의 제왕 세계관을 좋아함
2. 카드게임을 좋아함
3. 도전을 좋아함
의 세가지 조건에 모두 해당되는 사람이라면 재미있을 게임.

review:
If you've ever played the tabletop version and liked it then, you will LOVE this game. 

If you like turn based card driven games such as magic the gathering, you will probably like this game very much as well. 

If you like Lord of the rings, you will probably enjoy the story quite a bit and it's fun to play through the challenges the game brings. 

Basically if you don't mind games where you have to read alot, you will really like this game.

Now i just want the Arkham Horror LCG on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147166767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1668284806}
review:
Personally, I own everything for the physical card game that this game is based off of. I would just say that this game is a pretty big flop for me and my friends who play the LCG. Trying to put that aside, I do think this game is okay in its own right. It's not definitively worse than other digital card games on the market, and I do think it offers some unique features to the genre. However, I wouldn't pay much for it if I were you. 

Recommended with caveats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053238256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1683512913}
review:
Some great mechanics, but some absolutely shatteringly bad ones too.  
The good: It's a deckbuilder with some great synergy.
The absolutely awful: You get zero rewards for failing a mission, even if you've been playing it for 45 minutes straight.  Some missions are so easy you wonder if you missed something.  Others are so ridiculously skewed against the player that it takes ridiculous luck to beat them.  
A missed opportunity to be a good game.

review:
So I actually really liked the game itself. The game play was fun, and I was looking forward to more. But that is the main problem, the game only had 3 chapters. W T F?

It has this whole experience system where you gain cards to change your decks, but I used none of it. Why? Because the game was over before I felt the need to. They want you to replay the same levels, but no thanks. 

I would have still given it a thumbs up, but then when I was playing it had some sort of DRM or system that does not let you play if you are not connected to their server. My internet was working fine as I was able to speed test and check other games, so it was a problem with their server or Steam that STOPPED ME FROM PLAYING MY GAME I PAID FOR. Sorry there should always be an offline mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099951744', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2502, 'last_played': 1605906794}
review:
首先，制作组已经解散，本游戏不可能再更新。
游戏本身的发展性是可以的，虽然是桌游版的极致简化想向炉石靠拢，但也算有自己的特色。
然而能很明显的感觉到无论是技术层面还是运营层面都有很大的问题，能感觉到制作组经验的匮乏。
缺点包括但不限于：
-没啥特色的UI
-勉强能接受的打击感
-支离破碎的剧情
-大同小异的副本打法
-满打满算一共也就20个副本，重玩性较低
-地图做的很大结果腰斩的尴尬
-收费模式的不成熟导致了解散
-中文很多部分充斥着机翻
-敷衍的刷刷刷式的成就设计
[b]-对中国玩家来说烂到极致的网络，严重影响游戏体验[/b]
总之，目前来说已经没必要购入这个烂尾的半成品了，市面上好玩的卡牌游戏数不胜数，只是可惜浪费了这么个IP而已。

author: {'steamid': '76561199042805357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1678428864}
review: You start with a decent amount of cards to build some decent decks. Each time you complete a quest you'll get coins to unlock more cards. You start with 3 heroes on the board and can play up to 7 characters on the board at a time. The quests are interesting and the voice over is good.  The base Game gives you 3-5 quest campaigns and some random quests that will change each time you enter for a different experience.  The levels of play certainly change how challenging the game is.  Most experienced deck builders will find the first level too easy but very challenging for the hardest level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024767219', 'num_games_owned': 3431, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1590895740}
review:
This game could have been good. The mechanics of the underlying game are interesting, and they could have been used to make a much more compelling product. I played through the tutorial and the first campaign, and I thought, "That was pretty fun. I could do that 10 more times." but then I noticed that there are only three campaigns. This was surprising, because one of the most notable things about playing the game is the constant achievement progress popups, so I was assuming that there was a lot of content to get through, since they have achievements for dealing thousands or damage or using abilities a ton of times, things like that.

It seems like you're expected to replay the missions over and over with different decks, and that's not a horrible idea. Some of the quests can be accomplished different ways, so you can beat them using different styles of decks. But not every quest can be beaten that way, and it's really annoying playing through a four or five battle sequence just to get to something that hard counters your deck format, and ending up getting nothing for that time spent (except for increasing those achievement counters).

But then, even when you do complete the quests, are the rewards worth it? Not really. You can unlock a card or two to use in your custom decks the first time you beat each segment of a campaign, and you also get an in-game currency that you can use to "buy" other card unlocks, but this is really one of the parts of the game they messed up the most. You have to pay to unlock pretty boring cards that you would just need to use as filler in your deck. You don't unlock any additional "heroes" (as far as I can tell) which are the biggest ways to influence how you play the game. I think they needed to handle card unlocking completely differently, and probably have more interesting cards available, once I looked at the scope of what was possible, I lost all interest in grinding it out.

There are also some weird UI quirks - some apparent soft locks or situations where it's extremely unclear what to click on to continue playing the game. I didn't have it as bad as a lot of other players, but it's definitely got some jank to it. 

If they significantly increased the amount of single-player content, changed the way that you unlock cards, and gave you more interesting cards to unlock, then it would be a hit for me, but right now, it's just not scratching that itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198861786393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1621258357}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970954214', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1590396175}
review:
Having not played the physical game, I wasn't too sure what to expect.  I picked it up as part of a bundle and wasn't going to play it until a friend suggested I give it a shot.   Suffice to say, I charged through the tutorial and the campaigns and loved it.

The game is not without it's quirks; the UI could be a little better and there's a few other minor things, but the story, narration and visuals work really well.

If you've played a deck builder before, give this a whirl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096517005', 'num_games_owned': 2461, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1539, 'last_played': 1637015058}
review:
Update:
Servers are down right now, I cannot play because of online-only singleplayer.

-------------------------

I write this review as a big Magic the Gathering games fan:
The game is buggy with unclear rules that change very often and a bad taste of lately removed microtransactions.
Pre-build packages are very bad and you cannot beat the encounters with them even on the easy difficulty.
It was quite hard for me to build a decent package at the beginning, I think only 3 heroes are actually usable.

If you are a big LotR fan, wait for 75% discount.

I've given this a thumbs up but I'm seeing a lot of replay value at all.  It really feels like a game they should have done more with.   

Happy Adventuring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329410972', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1599082598}
review:
Even in single player mode the game is always online. Connection drops during your single player campaign? Bad luck. In my case my connection didn't even actually drop. You're connected to the internet, but can't reach their servers for some reason? Bad luck, no LotR today. And what about when they retire their servers? 

Shitty practice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071820526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1589919963}

Wait until it goes on sale, not worth the full 20. Is fun in short bursts and actually pretty challenging.
Has made me pretty angry.
7.3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995366221', 'num_games_owned': 1644, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1590273323}
review: "PvE Hearthstone plus Lord of the Rings theming minus the cash shop." Decent but not great. I had some fun but could not recommend that you buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012860935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1628413618}
review: I had really high hypes for this game and it has been on my wishlist for quite a while now so I decided to get it. Boy was I disappointed! Finished the three campaigns in a few hours with a random deck I made which didn't take me more than a couple of minutes to build. I would have expected more card quantity similar to the physical copy of this game, but no. Only thing you get from completing the SHORT campaign is Fellowship points, which you use to unlock alternate art styles for cards. Severely disappointed to say the least and so glad I didn't pay for this game in full.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970525974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1590958996}
review: Its good - the card mechanics work well and the rules are easy to understand. The art is nice and I like that there are variations on some of them that can be purchased. The story is fine, nothing too groundbreaking, but designing the different strategies are where its at. I wish there were more cards. A lot of them aren't just locked behind rewards but you can't see them in the deck list at all until you do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076619657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1591455466}
review: Froze up on me twice back to back during a quest. This is especially frustrating because matches are long and part of multi-match quests. You retain your "party" and all of their previous stats as if you just started a new round. This can set you up to lose if you manage to eke out one match win, only to enter the next match in the quest with a damaged party of heroes. Maybe "Challenge" difficulty was developed with co-op players in mind? Even with the infuriating  subscribe to win philosophy of Hearthstone, this game leaves me longing for those quick matches with so much action, surprising shifts in power, and the ability to quickly identify your mistakes tweak your deck, and try again. In LOTR: ACD, failure feels less like a learning experience, and more like punishment, as you may have just wasted an hour on a quest without full recollection of when things took a turn for the worst.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017620217', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1590310435}
review: Fun solo or co-op game. Struggled with the deck building at first but worked it out in the end. Only buy if on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134219338', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1590100172}
review: Every new area has a few paragraphs of story and it is all narrated very well. As a card game it is passable but the immersion via artwork, music, story narration, sound, etc really bring make this pop as an LotR experience. The battles can get quite technical and even on "narrative" difficulty if you miss one thing or are unaware of one of several mechanics it can be quite punishing. This can lead to multiple failed attempts each taking quite a long time, so if you are prepared for a deep dive into an immersive game you'll have a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022956069', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1622988652}
review: Muy buen juego, con enorme potencial, pero la falta de continuidad (provocado por el hecho de que Asmodee cerrara la empresa) hace que sea un producto muy limitado. Podía haber llegado a ser uno de los grandes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979937002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5445, 'last_played': 1634844262}
review: I love Lord of the Rings, and being able to play a card game like this is a dream come true. It is very difficult at times, and requires thought. An amazing experience even if you dont like LOTR, but enjoy dungeon crawling in card games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115595753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 9693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6772, 'last_played': 1710120725}
review: You can see achievements and quest rewards now. So looks like its playable again. Still missing the map and a less clunky menu interface. New heroes are priced a bit high.. 50K.

author: {'steamid': '76561199038735823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1673, 'last_played': 1595878970}
review: Comes very close to the original in engaging gameplay and tough puzzles to crack. Plays smoothly and has a pretty immersive feel to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030280537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1591095693}

author: {'steamid': '76561198179604937', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1668646524}
review:
I've been enjoying the game. The progression from tutorials into the campaigns is evenly paced. I was able to pick up on what to do quite quickly from that. I love the little story that goes alongside the game. It's immerses you in the world of Middle Earth. I'm a former Hearthstone player and it reminds me a lot of those single player campaigns, BUT... with a story attached.  Personally, I haven't experienced any bugs during gameplay that other people are reporting. (Playing on Mac).

Despite the "in app purchases" tab, it doesn't actually have any that require real money. The Definitive Edition contains all of the game content. Through playing, you earn coins that you then use to unlock cards faster. Cards are also unlocked through playing the campaigns (not sure if point based, but one has unlocked after most areas). I haven't played any multiplayer games yet to know if the same happens there. 

The biggest downside to this game is that the single player aspect is online only. I got this game via a Humble bundle. Had I paid full price for it, I would have been rather annoyed by that. 

It's a good game, I would recommend it, but not at full price due to not having an offline mode for single player campaigns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076309824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1589825927}
review: This game clearly isn't receiving any more development, and one of the difficulty modes (the medium, one, unfortunately) is missing from multiplayer mode. However, there is a great variety of cards and leader (hero) cards and the difficulty does get pretty high. There's lots of replay value, even though the total amount of content isn't that great. I recommend waiting until it goes on sale and playing with a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977775722', 'num_games_owned': 1770, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1617378289}
review:
Update (October 2020): a new developer has taken over the game and looks keen to resolve the issues I found when I last played - in particular by making single-player mode fully offline!  If this works out I would probably change this to a recommendation, because the actual gameplay is very good.

Original review: Buggy, poor UI, and with a nonsensical online requirement that happily torpedoes your progress at the slightest blip in your internet connection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024391349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1251, 'last_played': 1589676635}
review: Juego de cartas que no se parece a ningún otro. Muy entretenido y con una narrativa que absorbe y te transporta a la Tierra Media, consiguiendo una inmersión en cada partida que ya quisieran muchos otros.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028275583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1592415717}
review:
Although it´s a good digital card game implementation, it´s a shame but I cannot recommend it, since the critical failures of its server have prevented me even from finishing its tutorial! It´s ridiculous!! So, logically, I cannot recommend purchase this game. Perhaps the solution would be allow to play it "offline"... I don´t know... But it´s clear that, right now, it´s impossible to enjoy this game with this connection system. Too bad.

-------------------------------------------------------------
Es una lástima pero, aunque es un buen juego de cartas, no puedo recomendar este juego, ya que los fallos críticos del servidor del mismo me han impedido incluso finalizar su tutorial. ¡Es ridículo! Así que, lógicamente, no puedo recomendar su compra. Quizás la solución sería que sus programadores permitieran jugarlo "offline". Ahora mismo es imposible poder disfrutarlo con este sistema de conexión, desde luego. Una pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009628632', 'num_games_owned': 3861, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1704320120}
review:
Avec une interface inspirée de Hearthstone mais des mécaniques de jeu très différentes, ce jeu de carte solo/coop est vraiment très sympa !
Graphismes et musiques nickel, qui mettent bien dans l'ambiance du SdA, puis un bon choix de carte et de héros pour quelques dizaines d'heures à priori (j'en suis à 7 heures et je pense en passer une trentaine ou un peu plus, mais probablement pas 400).

Le concept de base : on choisit 3 cartes de héros, qui, suivant leur "type", conditionnent les 30 cartes qu'on peut sélectionner ensuite pour réaliser notre deck. Ces cartes non héroïques peuvent contenir des créatures, de l'équipement et des évènements.

Ensuite, l'idée n'est pas de faire tomber les points de vie de l'ennemi à zéro, mais d'accomplir différents objectifs le long d'une série de quêtes organisées en campagnes. On est incité à les refaire plusieurs fois à des niveaux de difficultés supplémentaires, ou avec d'autres héros, pour débloquer une monnaie interne qui permet d'obtenir plus de cartes. Pas trop de grind relou pour ce que j'en ai vu, on gagne assez vite de quoi débloquer quelques cartes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198963220728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1589573805}
review:
Bought as part of a digital boardgame bundle, felt like a bit of a steal and saved me from buying it from the PSN store.

Would I recommend this, yes, but why?

I have 2 legacy card games by the same company (Arkham Horror & Marvel Champions) this game has a very similar feel but has a digital narrative instead, it is a computer game after all.  I like the little quirks that give theme to this game, definitely has a LoTR feel about it but it gets a little lost once the game is in full swing.

I came across a little bug where it said I didn't have a deck selected... But there was.  A quick trip to deck builder and custom deck made as a copy of the starter deck and presto I was back in the game!

Visually it's decent, gameplay is good (I've had no issues) and I'm enjoying the setting/ theme itself.

All in all a little bit of patience and low expectation gave me a decent experience so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046713642', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1629119126}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032898393', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1622955090}
review:
I own the physical copy of the LCG board game and some reviews here put me off getting this because it was not the same. But it is very very similar in many ways and the core mechanics are the same so if that's what's stopping you, don't let it. The differences, from what I can see, are welcomed and actually add to the experience that you wouldn't get in the real life game. 
To add, I normally hate unlocking cards and I normally am never a completionist, nor do I care about achievements or the like. But in the 4 hours I've played, I have simply only been tackling the final tutorial mission repeatedly with different heroes to gain bonuses to unlock cards but also to see how they play. There are no expansions as of yet, but I will be getting quite a few hours out of this given the number of heroes, sufficient quests and 3 levels of difficulty.
Maybe not quite worth fill price assuming more DLCs will (hopefully) come out, but definitely worth getting on sale if you are a fan of the physical game or games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008560676', 'num_games_owned': 2133, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1589785941}
review:
Take Hearthstone's (all too underutilized) story mode segments and combine them with the Lord of the Rings, and you would (almost) have this game.
A few key things to note:
--There are no microtransactions to be found here. This "definitive edition" of the game includes all former DLC, so while there is a sort of pseudo-currency used in the game to unlock additional cards -- earned by playing through the story and so far generous enough not to be an issue -- what you play is all there is.
--This game is always online, unfortunately. While it doesn't seem to need it for anything, that always on connectivity can slow down gameplay at times even in single-player, and may be problematic on poor connections: I've lost progress 2-3 times already due to time outs and lost connections.

Overall, this is a great package. The presentation is top notch, the gameplay is interesting while at the same time being familiar enough to be easy to get into, and the customizability of the in-game experience is on par with, if not better than, most any other TCG on Steam. Def worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961844704', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1680898175}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111145366', 'num_games_owned': 1082, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 4874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1676500782}
review:
Pour ce que j'en ai vu, le jeu est sympa, bien dans l'univers avec de multiples possibilités.
Le point faible est qu'il faut se connecter à un serveur pour jouer à la campagne solo.
Cela entraine certains problèmes de connexion lorsqu'ils sont surchargés, mais permet aussi une continuité de partie entre différentes machines y compris en cas de bug (rare).
Je vais essayer de le finir à fond, mais les 5000 campagnes me paraissent bien compliquées et demandent probablement plus de 2 ans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047096797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1617040421}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007662091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2064, 'last_played': 1604780954}
review:
This game is unexpectedly charming, and it's a shocker that its developer seems to have gone belly up! There are so few well-crafted online co-op games that are truly tactical and strategic (and not first-person shooters, etc), and this one more than scratches the itch. It's also been crafted with obvious love: beautiful artwork, a deep set of cards, continuous surprises (like the 'hero awards' for specific heroic feats), and an appropriate difficulty level. (Well, we *almost* gave up during the second campaign, but persevered! It's definitely not a walk in the park.) 

It makes me very sad that there won't be, it appears, additional campaigns. Still, if you've a friend who loves multiplayer, this game is a terrific time-sink. I'd say it took us around 18 hours to win every campaign and encounter on easiest difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163272995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1589233128}
review: Lotr evrenine adeta tepki olarak yapılmış bir oyun. İnanlımaz derecede sıradan ve sıkıcı. Ne paranızı ne de zamanınızı harcamayın bu oyun için.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048949779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1613503009}
review:
This game takes everything I love about the tabletop version - LotR content, fun mechanics, and interesting multiplayer choices - while removing everything I dislike, buying multiple expansions, set up, breakdown, and enforcing small rules that I often forget.

This is a superb product, and will provide LotR fans with hours upon hours of entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094412168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1589166328}
review:
I wanted to love this game as a huge LOTR fan. My main issue is the game is unplayable for me. Game has way too many bugs that pop up forcing you to quit. I couldn't play for 15-20 minutes without restarting it. I tried reinstalling it and still the same issues persist.

The game play when the bugs didn't affect it had me hooked and I would have played this game a lot more. Hopefully the bugs get fixed but from what I've read in other reviews the game isn't supported by the developers anymore.

Such a shame and waste with what looks like an incredibly fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198971412197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1606191537}

author: {'steamid': '76561198818562645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1699162200}
review: I very much enjoy deckbuilders and this is a really good one. The only issue here is a lack of support. I have been locked out of gameplay by the server not working. I wish they would allow for offline play. Despite the problems I still very much enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121439599', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1589147437}
review:
The other reviews saying it's buggy are right. This game is so buggy it's unplayable. What I don't understand is how it's got so many positive reviews, even ones that do mention the bugs.

It's a shame too, because this seems like it could be fun if it worked properly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008205509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1617099764}
review:
It's definitely not exactly a repilcation of the original card game. But definitely the mechanics are heavily inspired and the immersion/narrative sides is even more developed thanks to the digital possibilities. The content of the deifnitive edition is great with real difficulty. I really hope they bring additional campaign in the future :-)

Update: 2020/08/19 After a few more hours of play. I am still very satisfied. The deckbuilding part has a lot of great combinations, multiplayers is great and there is now a new studio to bring additional contents. If you like card games, if you like LOTR, and if you like Co-op, that's just a must have !

author: {'steamid': '76561198286038545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1682786567}

author: {'steamid': '76561198154141823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1603801314}
review: As a veteran of CCGs, I was pleasantly surprised by the strategic richness of this game. The strong narrative element could be off-putting to some, and while I admit I don't care that much about the story, for those who love this Tolkien universe, the narrative approach - even within the actual gameplay - could be a plus. HOWEVER, the game is extremely buggy! I got frozen in the tutorial many times, and several more times in the actual campaigns. Given the fact that you can't save in mid-quest, that's a huge negative. Overall, it's an enjoyable experience, so long as you can handle the risk and frustration of having your progress unexpectedly halted by unresolved technical issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991622462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1590148870}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026408341', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1661295882}
review:
Creo que no se ha hablado suficiente de la adaptación del juego de cartas de El Señor de los Anillos. Cierto que no es una réplica exacta del juego físico, pero no por ello es un mal juego. De hecho tiene cosas muy interesantes:

- Narrativa: El juego gira mucho entorno a la narrativa. Textos introductorios, lugares, eventos y personajes de los libros.
- Solitario: Está diseñado para disfrutarlo en solitario. También tiene cooperativo.
- Sistema de Amenaza y Destino: Se ha modificado esta mecánica respecto al juego de mesa. Pero es igual de interesante. La amenaza va creciendo y desencadena eventos negativos. El destino lo puedes ir acumulando para desencadenar eventos positivos.
- Ventajas del juego digital: Vendí mi juego físico por no tener tiempo de jugarlo.
- La versión actual es "Definitive Edition": Las expansiones del juego digital que se iban desbloqueando con puntos están incluidas al comprarlo.

Ahora mismo, como aspecto negativo sólo se me ocurre que faltaría añadir subtítulos a las voces en inglés.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002466205', 'num_games_owned': 5288, 'num_reviews': 432, 'playtime_forever': 1405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1589046545}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025583859', 'num_games_owned': 2760, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1637188136}

author: {'steamid': '76561198411209811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1589393581}
review:
This game basically stifles every effort by the player. All your cards are neutralised by Sauron pulling cards out of nowhere, your heroes get taken away from you on a whim, enemy draws a full hand every turn while you only get one new card per turn, the list goes on. Mechanics are nice, no doubt, but the game is made hard artificially and the enemy player is not bound by the same rules as you. I think the devs chose this path instead of properly balancing the cards.

Compared to this Darkest Dungeon is a fair and balanced game for the average casual player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059843728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1646322771}
review:
Updated Review:
It took many hours and numerous freeze-ups, but I finally got lucky and made it through the tutorial once w/o it bugging out. Since then, there have been no bugs and I have been able to play through the actual game itself w/o issues. If you get lucky enough to complete a run of the tutorial w/o issue, then I highly recommend this game as it is a lot of fun, especially for LOTR fans.

Original Review:
HORRIBLE. I just bought it not realizing that development is since defunct. The game keeps freezing and "hanging" in different parts of the tutorial, completing bricking it. I kept having to shut it down and restart each tutorial level from the beginning. Rewards glitched and would not show up. Due to this random timing of the bug, I ended up going over 2 hours for the refund and Steam will not refund despite the fact that the game is broken, and not being supported. This is the first negative review I have ever written, and is more in regards to Steam refusing to refund a broken game, than the developers of this game. Regardless, do NOT waste your money now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020754787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2709, 'last_played': 1677912686}
review:
ロードオブザリングの旅を追うカードゲーム。面白いです。
対戦型のカードゲームだとまず公平性を考えたデザインにしないといけないところですが、このゲームはかなりエンタメを重視しています(マルチもあるようですが)。
ステージごとにその場の状況を表現する排除可能な障害(例えば囚われた仲間を閉じ込める扉、3ラウンド後に発動するアラームなど)が置かれ、プレイヤーは次々繰り出される敵を処理しまくりながらいつどの障害を除去するかという選択、またピンチの時にタイミング任意のイベントを発動させ場をしのぐなどテンプレではない思考を要求されます。

日本語は今のところありません。
英語堪能でなければPCOT翻訳またはCapture2Textなどの自動翻訳ソフトをお薦めします。フルスクリーンだといちいちウィンドウの切り替えが必要となってしまうので、ゲーム設定でフルスクリーンのチェックを外し、Borderless Gaming(最新版ではなくver8.4)を導入して枠を消すと良いでしょう。まあステージ開始前後の文章はなかなか自動翻訳泣かせですが。

最後に序盤でのデッキにおけるお薦めの構成を。
Sam  Guard時+1Attack、敵撃破時相手の行動ポイント-1(ラウンドごと1回)
Fredegar Bolger  味方をGuard状態にする特殊能力を使える。回復が強いLore勢力
序盤はアイテムも種類が少ないので、BlockやCounter、ラウンド毎回復をSamに集中させて1ラウンド2回Guardをしてもらってしのぐデッキになります。
後で愛馬Bill the Ponyを入れられるように、ヒーロー3人目はLeadership勢力の中からの誰か、Aragornなどで良いでしょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561197986428908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1813, 'last_played': 1704407463}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994243428', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1665588505}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046035660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1587774721}
review:
Voici mon avis bien perso en tant que joueur qui n'a jamais jouer à la version papier, avec principalement comme background une expérience du genre avec Arkham Horror card game et une expérience approfondie de Magic The Gathering.

J'aime bien ce jeu et y suis revenu à maintes occasions. Toutefois, je trouve le gameplay peu dynamique du fait que je passe un certains temps à évaluer les bonnes actions à prendre. Au départ j'ai trouvé le jeu difficile, mais à force d'y jouer et de le comprendre, je trouve maintenant l'expérience plus agréable. Perso, je skip les narrations.

J'aurais donc quelques recommandations pour de nouveau joueurs.

1) Ne soyez pas timide de commencer les quêtes en mode facile (récit). Vous comprendrez pourquoi au 2e point.
2) Dans ce jeu vous jouez contre le deck de Sauron et donc la qualité de votre deck et son efficacité à gagner dépend de sa synergie et de la force des cartes qui s'y trouve. En complétant des quêtes en mode facile, vous gagnerez des points qui peuvent être utilisé pour acheter de nouvelles cartes qui augmenterons l'efficacité de votre deck. Il est donc difficile de remporter en mode médium et hard avec un deck de base. Raison pour la quelle je vous recommande de faire les quêtes en mode facile d'abord. Sinon vous trouverez que le jeu est punitif et vous apprécierez moins l'expérience.
3) Les différents scénarios encouragent différents types de stratégies. Par exemple, dans certains scénario, Sauron produira plusieurs créatures. Dans d'autres, il y aura plusieurs "épreuves" qui incite à avoir des personnages avec un chiffre jaune plus élevé. Depuis que j'ai compris que pour gagner, je dois m'adapter, l'expérience est meilleur. Je recommande donc de faire plusieurs decks avec différentes stratégies. Choisissez le deck qui semble le plus adapter à vaincre le scénario. Si vous faites comme moi dans mes 10er heures de jeu et tenter de vaincre tous les scénario avec votre seul et unique deck et bien vous aurez de la difficulté.

Le jeu est en Definitive Edition. Je ne sais pas si ça veut dire qu'il est terminé. J'espère que ce n'est pas le cas car selon moi plus que les 3 extensions actuelles devait être prévu.

Je recommande le jeu. Il faut s'attendre toutefois à une expérience plutôt nerdie comparativement à des jeux comme Magic Arena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259781414', 'num_games_owned': 2587, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1585415815}
review:
Estou fazendo o review apenas após duas horas do jogo .... algo que não gosto de fazer .... mas como vou dar dedinho pra cima acho que isso não tratá muitas iras contra a minha análise.

O fato é que o jogo parece ser exatamente o que ele promete ser ... mas não o que eu esperava que ele fosse (nesse sentido não merece que eu o "negative" mas nem me atraiu para jogar por tempo de mais.

O que eu esperava que o jogo fosse e ele não é
Um complexo cardgame no estilo Magic ou mesmo Thronebreaker

O que eu não esperava que fosse mas ele é
Um jogo no estilo "cardgame" estilo HeathStone que não é exatamente um cardgame e que segue uma historinha de linha alternativa de Senhor dos Anéis ...

não é para mim, mas talvez seja para você

author: {'steamid': '76561198046106414', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1708183351}
review: 很不错的桌游类游戏，战役和可解锁内容很多。尽管开发组已经没了，尽管已经叫终极版了，还是希望Asmodee能继续完善这个游戏，做新的扩展吧。大家坐下开开心心玩个桌游，探索剧情、解锁新卡片、尝试新战术，我觉得比功利的PVP打天梯有趣多了。出新扩展的话，一定会买的

author: {'steamid': '76561198011165179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1664127176}
review:
I really wanted to like this game, because I loved the original tabletop version.
The gameplay just felt like it was doing the bare minimum - didn't do enough to spice up the card game genre here. It had such a robust history of being a successful tabletop lcg. I think this could've been waaaaay better done. Haven't read up a ton about development, maybe there were funding/production issues?
Yeah. Disappointed.
Maybe there is scope for an overhaul?

Also, lovely voice acting, but pacing too terrible... Alas. Alack.
Still holding out for that killer LOTR card game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800087602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1666467557}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992765686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3893, 'last_played': 1623708624}
review:
I own the game + expansion and spent a huge number of hours on the card game this is based off of.

The game had a rocky start and didn't hold up well in it's initial release. However, there was a recent (free) expansion that has vastly improved the quality of the game. It's been highly addicting the last few weeks of game play.

I would call my self a competent tactical gamer, and i find the difficulty to be fairly brutal. The new card pool made it a little more level, but it's challenging.

You control 3 good heroes, and have a deck of 30 cards to fight Sauron's deck with. It's quest based, each quest having a few stages with different objectives to proceed. Victory unlocks cards and gets you coin, which can you unlock yet more cards with. 

I've had 2 glitches in the past 50 hrs of game play.
-1 lock up where i had to exit the level and restart because no cards would respond.
-1 game lock up because i minimized it for a few hours. 

Beautiful art. Original and based on the books details instead of Peter Jackson's films.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080865998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1686501347}

author: {'steamid': '76561198160810534', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 4437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1688, 'last_played': 1587000574}
review:
剧本全打完了，和电影版是两个故事。龙那么可爱，为什么老要屠龙？
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
在新西兰留学，霍比特人小镇平时就一个门+一圈摆设。要等到每年特定时间才会用吊车把树啊屋子里的一堆摆设等吊过去摆好，具体时间看运气（我也忘了啥时候了，不过预定婚礼场地这种应该会帮你摆好. 预定：https://www.hobbitontours.com/en/experiences/hobbiton-movie-set-tour）
游戏还是要挺多思考和抉择的。毕竟比炉石攻防外多一个行动值，无脑解怪很容易会因为威胁值/行动点被剧情杀，敲行动的门又会因为场面崩了而最后一个场景被一波打猝死。
我这种暴脾气喜欢2矮人—+1领导型英雄。矮人带把+2攻剑，6攻砍谁谁死。
最大优点是没有炉石花648*2买卡包+冒险+礼遇才能玩一年，没有内购，一堆冒险剧情，打折血赚。

author: {'steamid': '76561198353967343', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1686876973}
review:
Creo que esta es la primera recomendacion que hago, y parciularmente lo hare porque he leido comentarios sumamente errados. Primero que todo no se parece en nada a YuGiOh, o Hearthstone. Si quizas bebe algo de lo que es Magic, pero tampoco se le asemeja. LOR ACD es un juego de cartas muy estrategico, donde no gana el que tiene mejores cartas como ocurre en otros juegos de este genero. Si no que gana el que sabe mejor ocupar el mazo, aca ni siquiera la suerte es factor para ganar o perder una partida. Si sabes administrar bien tus recursos es suficiente.
Otro detalle que hace muy llamativo al juego es que cada partida cuenta una historia, y en cada historia debes ir completando misiones que influyen directamente en la trama. Doy un ejemplo. Primero te ves luchando con unas arañas, durante esta pelea Bilbo pierde su bolso, por lo que decide buscarlo junto a un par de enanos y un Elfo.Debes avanzar a un par de locaciones, he investigarlas. Todo eso se logra pagando puntos. Pero es mejor que aprendas esto jugando, porque explicarlo por aca es un poco engorroso.
A mi parecer es el mejor juego de cartas que hay para jugar en Solitario, ya que es complicado sin llegar a ser imposible. Ademas de dar la idea de estar leyendo un libro interactivo mientras juegas. 

9/10

P.D Estoy esperando mejorar un poco para lanzarme al online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033482609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1589775974}
review: This game isn't for everyone, but it does put a nice spin on the Lord of the Rings physical LCG by fantasy flight. It is just different enough to not feel like a digital copy, yet still similar that players would be welcomed if they have played the physical version in the past. It plays a lot better with coop, and for $10 it's not a bad way to spend a few nights gaming with a friend if you're looking for a unique coop experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019020138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1636744525}
review:
Reminiscent of hearthstone but much more tactical and challenging. if I had any complaints...
1) Currently tricky to get new cards. After your initial decks, you only acquire more through stage completion and achievements. Which isn't so bad except some decks you may want to build will feel underpowered until you can unlock key cards for them.
2) Some navigation hassles. For example, you can't change your card backs from the deck builder screen (as far as I could find). Instead you have to save your work, go back to main menu, and then go to 'vault' and change it in there. Or if you're in the middle of a quest and find yourself screwed. There's no "forfeit" button but have to go back to the main menu, and then make sure you uncheck "saved game" before going back in. Minor things, really, but can add up if you binge through the game for a few hours. Hopefully will be straightened up in the future.

review:
I came into this game expecting the LCG. Even though it wasn't that, the introductory campaign made me excited for the mechanics I got to see. But...then I played some more.

This game is challenging, and not in a way I enjoy. When I play on a normal mode, I don't expect to fail at a mission ten times. Moving to easy helps, but then that takes the enjoyment out of a challenge. Also, it feels clunky and could be more streamlined. All in all, not what I was looking for and a major disappointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060688156', 'num_games_owned': 10119, 'num_reviews': 1366, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1582745388}
review:
[b]画面[/b]
游戏的画风还是比较还原电影的人物形象的，卡牌的美工极其优秀，感觉就是直接用了电影里人物的经典形象，但是游戏的其他方面感觉就比较一般般了，场景看上去比较粗糙，攻击特效也是比较简陋。
作为一款18年的游戏，游戏中卡牌攻击的特效和打击感甚至不如13年就出来的炉石传说。
不过用魔戒作为吸引粉丝的卡牌游戏，在人设的表现上相当优秀，所以整体在画面上给个好评吧。
[b]游戏性[/b]
《指环王：卡牌冒险》是一款由Fantasy Flight Interactive制作，Asmodee Digital发行的以指环王为题材的策略卡牌游戏。
游戏的背景是基于指环王原著所建立的魔幻世界。
在游戏中，玩家将响应未知冒险的召唤，直面索伦的黑暗势力，为了保护中土世界的和平，开启属于自己的冒险之旅。
玩家可组建英雄牌库，挑战索伦的军队。可进行单人游戏，也可与好友组队，探索著名场景，完成故事情节任务，打造玩家专属的中土传奇。
游戏用原著上的人物用卡牌的形式展现出来，基本上原著中有名有姓的英雄在游戏里都成了英雄卡，而一些特殊的部队则成了侍从卡。
刚刚开始玩的时候，我还以为战斗是和炉石一样，每个人的魔法值用完并结束就轮到对手这样的游戏模式。
但是没想到，游戏的玩法和炉石还是有些区别的--比起卡牌游戏，更有些回合制游戏的意思。
你问回合制是什么意思？
简单来说，魔法值用来召唤侍从或者英雄，魔法的卡牌，这个和炉石没什么区别，但是回合制的原因就在于，召唤出的侍从或者英雄行动一次就算一个回合，接下来就换成敌人行动，等到双边可以行动的单位都没了之后，这一轮才结束，进入新的一轮。
卡牌版本的你打我一下，我打你一下！
这样就让玩家想要一波流带走敌人的愿望落空了。
但是相对的，游戏形式的转变，让玩家每一回合都需要考虑和计算更多的东西。
游戏的一些英雄卡牌有技能或是特殊能力用来代替炉石里面的回血和嘲讽等能力，魔法值可以累计，这样就可以在下一轮打出更高费的牌。
游戏有剧情模式，可以更好了解游戏所采用的剧情设计，每个任务都有多个关卡，只有通过“最后遭遇”，进行旅行，任务才能胜利。
剧情里面，敌人会使用一些魔法牌或者是是己方人物的威胁值来增加索伦的警觉值，警觉值达到五十，如果手牌里没有能够降低警觉值的卡牌，就会被判定失败。
除此之外，剧情还有一些不同的任务，有的关卡需要击败特定敌人，有的需要我方在几轮下不失去全部英雄，并不是杀死全部敌人就能获胜 。
胜利之后，玩家可以得到金钱用来购买卡牌背景等装饰，还可以自定义牌组和语音。
游戏有中文，翻译的相当到位。
[b]声音[/b]
游戏中的配音和对白十分地道，确认是有种让人看指环王电影的感觉。
配乐也是相当的优秀，这方面一般的卡牌游戏都是比不了的。
声音给个好评。
[b]评分[/b]
7/10
作为一个粉丝向的卡牌游戏，玩的人还是比较少的，服务器虽然可以裸连，但是基本碰不到人。
虽然有剧情模式，但是内容也并不多，再加上“极其丰富”的内购内容。
emmmm.....
比较推荐粉丝购买吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198797066880', 'num_games_owned': 1839, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1600870383}
review:
[h1] 在卡牌上重走一次护戒之路~[/h1]
[code] 人类也许会有失去勇气的那一天，我们也许会抛弃朋友，背叛同伴，但绝不是今天！豺狼横行，人类的时代也许会逝去，但绝不是今天！今天我们会浴血奋战！为了这美丽的大地上，你我珍视的一切！我命令你们，西方的人们！坚强战斗！ [/code]
[h1] The Lord of the Rings: Adventure Card Game - Definitive Edition[/h1]
《指环王：冒险卡牌》，由Fantasy Flight制作、Asmodee发行的卡牌策略游戏。经典的世界级IP下，带来的是游戏性与剧情度契合极佳的战役探索玩法，组建英雄战队和盟军牌库，迎战来自摩多的劲敌，体验沉浸式体验游戏剧情，在史诗般的音乐带领下，重走一趟护戒之路，直面索伦的威胁，踏上紧张刺激的中土之旅。游戏卡牌对战性极佳，角色配音也比较舒适，代入感十足。
[h1] 点亮烽火丘......正在集结伙伴.......正在敲响战鼓.......搜寻夏尔人...... [/h1]
·游戏目前只有三个战役扩展，悲~~游玩推荐加速器，裸连可用steamcommunity 302配合热点等一系列骚操作解决。
·游戏目前更改的貌似区别于之前的版本了，采取了买断制的方式(除了原声dlc）。目前在游戏中，玩家无需通过购买卡包等额外付费方式进行卡牌和英雄的解锁和收集，而是采取友谊点数进行解锁，点数可以通过游玩对局进行获得，卡牌和花里胡哨的装饰灯基本上都能靠肝获得，算是不错的改进措施。（部分卡牌作为通关奖励获得）
·游戏一开始，可以依靠点数解锁全部20名英雄,魔戒持有霍比特四人组、阿拉贡、阿尔玟、金雳、法拉米尔等经典人物都作为可操控英雄供你游玩，值得一提的是，甘道夫是作为有着“一闪而逝”特性的孟优卡牌登场，游戏对于IP的梗处比较多，魔戒粉入手这款游戏是个很棒的选择。
·可以进行单人游戏，也可与好友组队合作，探索著名场景，完成故事情节任务，打造专属与你的中土传奇~
[h1]索伦之眼注视着你，等待着你慢慢走向死亡~[/h1]
游戏主打的是剧情探索的pve式卡牌对战哦！玩家卡牌主要分为英雄/盟友/装备/魔术等，而索伦则有更多类型的卡牌！
具体术语可以进入游戏中的词表进行阅读，下面主要讲下单人模式的玩法，游戏的玩法非常丰富，可玩性也很高，不过总体来说并不复杂，可能是卡牌比较少吧。
·操控三名英雄共同抵抗索伦的军队，游戏中。英雄分为领导型/战术型/精神型三大类。战术型注重攻击，精神型注重意志力，领导型处于俩者中间。同样的，卡组中卡牌的选择，需要符合你所选择的英雄类型，部分卡牌需要你携带相同类型的英雄才能上场！而不同的英雄除了类型以及自身技能不同外，还有独特的种族值设定，某些卡牌也会受到种族的影响哦。
·游戏战斗中，采取的是你打一张、我打一张的独特战斗轮盘(没有先手不能攻击，开局英雄自动上场，而索伦的怪物也早就整备完成)，等双方都没有“法力”或没有进一步操纵手段了就会进入休整阶段，然后开始新一轮战斗.....游戏貌似没有烧条的措施，所以可以慢慢思考。和一般卡牌对战相同的是，游玩中盟友和英雄有生命/攻击/意志力三种属性，三种属性分别解决各自对应的属性；同样的，类似庇护、格挡、潜伏等盟军、英雄特性也是应有尽有，从游戏性来说，这款游戏算是卡牌游戏中的翘楚了。
·最符合指环王这一IP的一点来了，游戏有威胁度和命运事迹俩大系统；威胁度对应索伦对你的关注度，一旦到达50，即代表对局失败，而在威胁度到达50之前，也会根据威胁值触发各种DEbuff；威胁会根据英雄的强度以及游戏轮次的增加而逐步上升，基本上三位英雄，开局就有30左右的威胁度了，加之游戏少量的清场卡牌和你打一张我打一张的对战轮，威胁度的出现大大加大了游戏的难度。很好的还原了原著中主角步步惊魂的刺激氛围以及索伦之眼的注视......
而命运事迹则类似于威胁值，不过对应我方的buff，可以通过卡牌效果或者解放卡牌来增加命运值。不过命运值给予的buff明显不如威胁值，且每应用一次命运事件相当于你出了一次牌，不过在危急关头还是能雪中送炭的。
[h1] 沉浸式角色语音、史诗乐曲、魔戒粉熟知并有一定扩展改变的剧情以及较精美的卡牌立绘[/h1]
唯美的画面，细腻的特效，恢弘壮阔的场面，悠扬悦耳的音乐，低魔幻以及史诗感十足的风格，张弛有度的快慢节奏，这次自定义自己的魔戒主角，各种冲击感、代入感、震撼感、动人感这些才是最大的亮点。
[h1] 游戏缺憾[/h1]
1.游戏采取全程联网的方式，但是服务器对于中国玩家并不算友好。虽然可以裸连进去，但是不保证你不会掉线。而且本作虽然有着联机模式，但是因为鬼服等问题，大体上都是以单人为主的剧情探索副本为主，全程联网会大大降低中国玩家的游戏体验。
2.以本人的眼光来看，游戏英雄的立绘着实普通了一点，而解锁的立绘还不如初始立绘好看些，总体上来说反而是卡牌立绘比较精美。
[h1] 结束语 [/h1]
一句话，推荐魔戒粉入手！

喜欢这篇评论，也麻烦点个赞，让更多人能够看到。[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198106952045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1858, 'last_played': 1677187361}
review:
I really like card games, and this one is a good one.
But it has a major flaw design: it needs a permanent wifi connection (why ????). And during a mission, when your computer enter sleep mode, it is never able to reconnect to the server, ending the game.  Meaning that you have always to play a whole mission before stopping. That has a sense for PvP games as Hearthstone, but not here !!

review: This game is amazing. The creative team has obvioulsy got a vast knoledge of Tolkin's world and has created a masterpiece. Fun, dramatic and includes diffrent adventures for a variaty of challenge levals. Fancy a chilled game? they got that. Fancy an intence challange? They got that too. A seemingly endless array of deck combinations makes for hours of fun, interactive gameplay. The gamplay alone should apeal to those unfamiliar with the world/lore and theve even got that covered as all the facts and lore you need can be found in game. Outstanding job to all who worked on this exelent game.

review:
That's a great game for a single player. Especially when you are tired of pvp with too many shit decks in the rank game, the lord of the rings is an entertainment to relax. Tips: Good for a fan of the Lord of the Rings
