author: {'steamid': '76561198030455073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4627, 'last_played': 1702243111}
review: I prefer playing lotr lcg from fantasy flight games, but this is quick  and easy to play with a buddy as an alternative and definitely scratches the itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114258344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1645334935}
review:
The studio is closing and that's a crying shame because this game is really fun.  I just picked it up over the Winter Sale and am loving it.  They say they'll keep the servers operational, but who knows how long that will last.  If they were to make it playable offline, I'd say definitely go ahead and get it still; otherwise probably proceed with caution.

Figuring out how to navigate all the things the quests throw at you is lots of fun and there's good replayability value because there's so many different ways you can build your deck that will completely change your tactics.  The achievements are good, too, and there's lots.  Plus, as a huge LotR fan, you can absolutely never have enough LotR games.  It's challenging, but in a good way, so that you feel like you've gotten somewhere with each win.  There's a mini-quest mode (Mirror of Galadriel) which is really helpful for getting the hang of the mechanics and figuring out which cards work well together.  I just played that until I knew what I was doing.

In summary:  it's a great game for fans of all things Middle-earth, but the studio is closing, so while the game is absolutely playable now, who knows if that's going to last, and that's a real bummer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199823262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3259, 'last_played': 1691151633}

author: {'steamid': '76561198102767533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1699978991}
review:
游戏还是不错的，但内容更新慢，国内容易掉线，比较可惜～
另外期待一波诡镇奇谈电子版，有潜力启发一波卡驱rpg的设计。

author: {'steamid': '76561198102318936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1445, 'last_played': 1631479431}
review: El juego es muy recomendable. Destacaría el sistema de planificación del mazo y de su estrategia para enfrentarte a cada misión y conseguir superarla. Es un juego divertido y jugar las misiones me ha hecho disfrutar de un modo relajado tanto de la historia como de la propia partida. La posibilidad de poder ajustar la dificultad de cada partida hace que puedas probar nuevas estrategias, sin la frustración constante de ser derrotado si el nivel es demasiado alto o tu mazo no es equilibrado, pudiendo introducir mejoras en el mazo a medida que aumentas la dificultad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094152485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1702451638}
review:
Al principio es dificil y se diferencia del juego de cartas, pero es un desafio  lleno de emociones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006505943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3030, 'last_played': 1686573473}
review: The game is fun to play, quests are interesting and challenging, but there is simply not enough content to last for longer play. One can go for Galadriel's Mirror repeatedly, but it is the quests that are really the treat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315005531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1630077666}
review: I love this game. My girlfriend and I play the physcial editions of the game (LCG + Journeys in Middle Earth) and when we are apart, we play the Adventure Card Game online. It is truly a joy, the mechanics are easy to understand and fun, and just like the physical games, the endless ways of mix and matching cards/decks and trying to tackle difficult quests offer a lot of variety. Overall an amazing game, I can't wait for more extensions & updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198160693238', 'num_games_owned': 10610, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1578168566}
review:
[h1] 前言 [/h1]
魔戒作为奇幻文学界扛把子一般的存在，本身的人气和ip价值自然是不需要质疑的。但魔戒毕竟并非战锤40k那种只设置了一个极其庞大的背景，随着版本不断扩充世界观设定，加入角色和种族的“规则”。托尔金老爷子本身的故事已经足够完整和出色，想要依托魔戒的世界观创作游戏很难像战锤40k那般自由自在的发挥。所以魔戒的游戏虽然严格来说数量不算少，但真正得到市场和粉丝都认可的作品数量却不多，特别是近几年更是只有两部“兽人宝可梦”勉强算是卖座游戏。而本作无疑是在魔戒背景下对于游戏创作的一次大胆尝试，有别于一般魔戒游戏的动作类型，本作选择了更加小众的卡牌类型。但也许是制作组的谨慎，本作又没有大张旗鼓的去做传统的tcg。而是选择了更加突出故事背景，并大量结合rpg要素的模式。虽然这在某种程度上进一步压缩了游戏的体量和受众，使得本作从ui上就透露出一股资金不是特别充足的气息，游戏本身的知名度和销量也比较一般，但好处是本作对于魔戒的粉丝来说依旧具备极高的可玩性。无论是针对原著本身情节的合理改变和扩展，还是对于原著内各色角色在艺术表现上的还原，都能带给粉丝足够的满足感。可能作为卡牌游戏作品算不上特别让人惊喜的创新大作，但对于魔戒的粉丝来说依然是一部非常值得尝试的佳作。

[h1] 游玩中一些主要的问题 [/h1]
-让人厌恶的全程联网模式
考虑到游戏本身的玩家不多，多人合作模式基本搜不到人的现状。游戏本身需要全程联网就显得格外让人烦躁。游戏本身并不是炉石那种对战式的卡牌游戏，而是昆特牌王权陨落那种以剧情为主的rpg式卡牌，明明是单机的内容却必须要网络才能进行，对于临时不方便的玩家来说额外增加了一层毫无必要的阻碍。

-效果不佳的卡片交互
本作最蛋疼的问题在于，并没有实装目前几乎所有主流卡牌都会有的基础功能——鼠标放到卡片之上会自动浮动显示卡片详情。这功能对一款卡牌游戏来说几乎是不可或缺的，玩家就算对自己的卡片再了解，面对敌人的时候也难免需要查看地方陌生卡片的效果信息。而本作则没有这个方便的功能，想要查看看片信息，必须要用鼠标点击卡片才能显示。虽然只是多了一步操作，但整局游戏却要进行无数次这种操作，特别是在出牌阶段点击手牌还很容易让大脑卡顿一下区分看牌还是放牌，玩起来对游戏的流畅性打击非常巨大。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1959861246
（本作的ui绘制相比较于卡面也不够精细，关卡选择下左侧的大地图效果很好，但右侧的具体展示就显得有些粗糙）

-战斗中的“危机值”过于影响节奏
虽然现在卡牌游戏似乎都在以“快”作为改良的方向来吸引如今越发缺乏耐心的玩家。但个人最喜欢的依然在于一张卡片一张卡片，一个回合一个回合的布局，最终达成让人眼花缭乱的华丽combo。我不反感快攻牌组亦或是快速的游戏节奏，但很厌恶强制性打断玩家节奏的做法，而本作因为设定上“索伦阻拦”的原因，每一张战斗的每一回合都会积攒一个危机值代表索伦逐渐发现你。当危急值达到阶段上线的时候战场内会强制性刷出强大的怪物代表“索伦发现你了！”这样的做法如果放到正儿八经的rpg上没啥问题，放到卡牌上偶尔一个关卡使用也问题不大，确实很好的突出了紧张感和恐惧感。但每一场战斗都是如此基本就让玩家很难慢条斯理的布局，基本上注意计量值的情况下，玩家只能依靠不断地攻击尽可能的杀死场上的魔物才能低损耗的通关，这种设置让本来难度就不算低的关卡体验更加极端，一方面是通过条件，一方面又要注意不浪费太多回合，这种设置很容易让玩家短时间内连续产生较强的挫败感。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1960371829
（游戏中会出现的事件是固定的，第一次体验效果很好，但后续游玩不会有什么变化）

总的来说，入手这部游戏不要带着一部魔戒tcg的期待，这只是一部采用卡片模式展示的剧情为主，去掉了培养升级要素的rpg游戏。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1960371809
（每一关的过场写的都很细致生动，而且都是全程优质配音）
游戏本身并不是与其他玩家的牌组对局而是与关卡内固定的怪物对战，通关也是满足通关条件而不是消耗双方的血条。对于粉丝玩家来说，能看到原汁原味的魔戒设定下的有趣故事和熟悉的角色肯定会有很强的吸引力，但对于非粉丝玩家来说，强制联网，差劲的交互，不流畅的关卡体验和几乎找不到人的联网要素都让作品体验存在巨大的瑕疵，个人还是建议折扣期间入手。


[h1] 总结 [/h1]
本作作为一款卡牌游戏来说质量尚可。但游戏本身几乎找不到玩家联机游玩，而单人剧情内容虽然丰富，但必须通过网络才能进入游戏天然就带来了一定的阻碍。离线无法进入也意味着之后游戏一旦关闭服务器玩家将无法通过任何方式运行难免让人不爽。且游戏本身粗糙的ui，难受的交互以及“危机值”的设定都让游玩过程十分的不流畅。虽然每个关卡的故事都紧扣魔戒主题，过场语音和卡牌配音都十分优秀。但对于没有情怀的非魔戒爱好者来说并不具备长期的吸引力。总的来说魔戒粉丝可以直接入手，但对魔戒太多感觉的普通卡牌玩家十分不建议原价下入手。

[quote]點擊加入[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/itgameap]趣遊鑒賞組[/url]，一同探索遊戲的樂趣~
歡迎關註[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34803254/]趣遊鑒賞家[/url]，查看更多趣味性評測。
讓我們用愛點亮遊戲之光，加入我們，共同感受更多趣味的遊戲吧！[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198014205443', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 12817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6316, 'last_played': 1612862862}
review:
The game have many pros and one cons.

Pros:
The game after the third campaign starts to be various in deck making and generous in possible permutations against different quests or encounters. The graphic, music and mechanics are polished and well done. No bugs so far I have encountered and all the mechanic permutations works properly. The challenging difficulties offers a real challenge in deckmaking. The good part of that is you have (so far) unlimited deck saves.

Cons:
The multiplayer lacks of a lobby. Is quite impossible to find someone to play co-op (that is the most entertaining part of the game) since the community is not so big and you cannot see who is eventually playing in single player

4/5 to me. Once devs will create a lobby where to interact with other players (not essentially friends who got the game) the game will be 5/5.

Regards and enjoy

review:
I have played a little of the LCG but could never find friends willing to invest the time needed to do more than "play testing".  This digital version fits me perfectly. I think FFG has done some money grabbing moves of late but here I think you get a lot of game for the price. I find myself enjoying the deck building aspect a lot as well as the story interludes. I am looking forward to more expansions and really would like to pick up the LCG again.
I was a bit worried about the game but with a new studio in charge of development there is hope for a future.

review:
Fantastic game and structure, especially since it explores the "LCG" model - of which I am a huge fan.

The games plays really well, tactical and strategic decsions, as well as questing that contains an element of "push your luck".  Sequence and flow is well defined and the way the quests unfold is quite beautiful.

Overall, a postive buy for anyone who enjoys card based strategy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058567537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1577556188}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970257979', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3887, 'last_played': 1613830107}
review:
This is not a faithful recreation of the physical card game. This much you need to know up front. However, it is a very interesting game in its own right, which gives me the same kind of satisfaction as the LCG. 

I have a few minor complaints, mostly about the UI. But other than that, I recommend this game fully. You may have heard stuff about the early monetization, but that was growing pains from a tabletop company not understanding the Steam ecosystem. These days it's fair, and a very good value for money IMHO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041088160', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1577402692}
review:
The aim of this review is to provide some feedback to the devs, and try to explain the two main reasons that led to a refund. To provide some context I'll say I have no experience with the physical card game.

A general overview:
+ a pretty deep card game with varied keywords
+ all the content is free - you get it with currency earned in game and grinding is not necessary
+ cosmetic options for your cards, although limited

- I really dislike the threat meter. It seems like there's very limited ways to manage it, and it adds a lot of challenge to already difficult encounters, culminating in a "lol you lose" situation if it reaches its max.
- the game is very challenging. this isn't inherently a negative, but it really feels like it's only challenging to pad out gametime, because the campaigns themselves are very short (and there's only 3 as of time of writing this review)
- the UI is clunky when compared to other offerings. Hovering over cards in your hand doesn't zoom them, you have to manually click on each one to see details. Keywords on cards bring up tooltips explaining them, except they randomly don't work and you have to go to the glossary in the menu and scroll down a huge list to remember them. Tiny things like that are all over the place.

And here's the two main reasons that led me to the refund, and the real reason I decided to write this:
- The game is online only.
- It has all the UI infrastructure needed for the developer to change currency gain/costs and flood the game with microtransactions.

The first one is a negative despite me being lucky enough to pretty much always have internet access. The reason being, if the developer decides to take the servers down, you lose access to the game. This decision is doubly confusing when you consider that it's mainly a single player card game.

The online-only requirement coupled with the size of the unexplored campaign map and potential for so many microtransactions and scummy behavior in the future raised a lot of alarms in my head. Ultimately I decided to refund it despite also wanting to keep playing it and conquer the difficulty of the game.

I'll keep following the game. If it gets an offline mode, I'll for sure buy it again. Otherwise, everytime I'm playing it I feel like I'm up against a double time limit - the in-game threat meter, and the out of game server shutdown meter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013866056', 'num_games_owned': 2640, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 4892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4663, 'last_played': 1620782166}
review:
Based on the physical version by Fantasy Flight, with some changes to the mechanics and made for 1-2 players instead of 1-4. Both end up playing quite differently as combat is much different as is the way enemies are played but both versions are two of the better card games I've played. This one also borrows a lot of the excellent art from the physical game. Some very good synergy between many of the cards. Certain abilities or cards can have uses you might not originally expect from their normal assumed use, which can lead to effective strategies in dealing with certain situations or locations. Digital version allows more varied card types and random effects as well as more unique scenario situations. Well voice acted. For now has 18 different scenarios to play through as well as a tutorial and a newly added game type that randomizes things.

Hoping to see content added at a faster pace than the wait between the second and third campaign now that the improved tutorial is done and the console versions have launched.

Edit: ...Well, fuck. (Video and Tabletop employees laid off)

Edit Edit: New developer has taken over so I'll see how that goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984074803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1641725862}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027949038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1637339475}
review:
The game offers plenty of strategy. It is similar in many aspects to other LCGs from FF that I've played, except for the exploration feature--that is done by area specific quests rather than exploring. This makes the game less 'adventurous' and more strategic in some ways.

The writing and voice acting are fine. I'm a little jaded at the layered cheesiness that all LotR games get pasted with. I'll have to go read the books again to cleanse this.  

Overall I do enjoy the game and expect anyone who likes board games / card games to like this LotR digital LCG as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025520005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1708844304}
review:
I was surprised by this game, having figured that it would be a straight adaptation of the physical "Living Card Game" from Fantasy Flight Games. It is not. While it borrows certain ideas here and there, not to mention artwork, it really is its own game. Which is nice if you have already ventured into the LCG, as this gives you a different experience. 

I have played a number of digital card games and I have to say this is the most unique I've come across. It is a narrative-based questing card game rather than your typical dueling card game. You never battle other players, only Sauron (AI controlled), though you can team up with others to do the quests (which is another unique feature). 

It also has high production values for a card game. Naturally the art which is borrowed from the LCG is great, but so is the music, the voice acting, the story, even the effects are nice! All of these testify to the love and care its creators put into it.

Would I recommend it? Yes I would!
To whom? To Card game players (because of its uniqueness), to fans of the LCG (for a different take on the game they already love), and to Middle-earth fans in general (for obvious reasons).

UPDATE:
Sadly, in January 2020, it was announced that the development of this game had come to a close, and the game's studio shut down. 
Happily, in mid 2020, it was announced that development of this game would continue with a new team! I look forward to the new LOTR: ACG!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120628498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1630366006}

review:
LOTR: Journeys in Middle Earth.
War of the Ring: Second Edition.
LOTR: Adventure Card Game.

All of these games are great and have reignited my passion for Middle Earth.

Pros: Story, audio, and voice acting is top notch. 
Cons: not everything is taught. Mousing over keywords on cards doesn't work as best as it ought.

Sink 5 hours into this game, make a few simple decks, and make it through the first campaign - I think you'll end up liking this game quite a bit!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988000877', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1603126764}
review:
Long story short, it's not the physical game so don't buy it for the name. As an unrelated game, it's okay but not nearly worth the price tag. 

The physical game is "You Vs. The World". You aren't the singular threat to Sauron and if you control the threat tracker you can hide from that poorly timed cave troll for a while until you can find some better gear. The physical game is the story of Frodo, hiding in the bushes and trying to avoid Sauron's attention for as long as possible.

This game is a traditional 1 vs. 1 card duel. Sauron draws a hand of cards and plays monsters and trap cards. You fight those monsters and play trap cards of your own. Instead of damaging health pools ala M:TG, you simply each have set "Target" cards on the cable that need to be destroyed either my combat or adventure. You're Aragorn at the Black Gate fighting an enemy army. No subtlety or long term plans just trading blows.

As such, the mechanics of the card game are comparatively shallow. The new threat mechanics throw off any real benefits to using weaker heroes, and the active Sauron opponent vastly increases the randomness. While my play is limited so far, the new scene format has made me frustrated more often than entertained. The balance is tight enough that the player needs to know what to expect in future scenes or they will be stream-rolled by a surprise effect. This leads to a requiring you to play "Scouting games" where you fully expect to lose, just to learn how the scenario will work.   

But complaints aside, it's fairly well-made. There is alot of polish on everything and the simplified mechanics work pretty well with the UI.  The sheer number of cards is small and made smaller by new deck restrictions, but DLC will likely solve that. The voice acting, the narrative. the balance and even the feel of individual scenarios (Despite frustrations) are all solid.  I have my issues with the game design, but it's on subjective points. 

There are definite issues with turn transitions and I've found myself in game-breaking locked states twice in two hours of play. But, in truth, it feels solid and I just hope future patches will find the edge cases that cause this.

When it comes to recommending the game, I'd sum it up as "If you aren't looking for the tabletop game, wait for a big sale. (70% or better)" I'd hesitate to say I "regret" my purchase, but it's the only word that keeps popping into my mind. While massively overpriced, the game doesn't water down the experience with F2P mechanics and unfair loot drops and there is fun to be had.

review:
Really fun. It's not a carbon copy of the physical game, but that is OK.

The only downside at the moment is that it needs more expansions and content :) The company has a gold mine worth of stuff to work with, but it is coming out at a glacial pace. 

If you love FFG card games you will like this. If you like Heartstone, it has a similar feel to that but with a few more strategic layers. Also, like most coop games, it is much more fun with a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017155863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1574157038}
review:
Well, this is weird. 
I reluctantly bought this to see what the fuss was all about. I thoroughly enjoyed the tabletop game and was disappointed when they took the "dumbed down" road for the digital version. I thought that this would be ideal if I could have the tabletop simulator experience, or the octgn experience (yes I have played the card game extensively in digital form) with rules enforcement.

I was wrong. 

It is odd, but strangely enough, this game...works. And it captures rather well the spirit of the card game. Don't get me wrong, its rule-set and gameplay loop is more Elder Scrolls: Legends than anything that resembles the paper LCGs of FFG. However it captures very well the dynamic of these paper games in the sense that the core considerations are there.
You don't have engagement per se but you have guard which is kind of engaging an enemy in the card game. 
You don't have exploration of locations through travel but you have hazards that obstruct your progress like locations do in the card game. 
You have "travelling"  as a subscenario mechanic instead of a phase in the game, but still you have the strategic consideration of trying to defeat or neutralize the enemies that will attack you when you leave, like the tabletop game of threat management for engagement of enemies. 

In short, the gameplay is not the same but the spirit of the LOTR LCG is here. There are some unsafe design decisions from a board gamer's point of view but they must have been made in order to create more mass appeal. However this is not the point of the game. I'm gonna tell you what the point (in my opinion) is.

This game, this format, is the best solo card game that we have so far. Like it's tabletop counterpart, it doesn't just provide stupid bots as punching bags because the mechanics of the game are rather well defined. I do miss a mechanic of engagement based on arithmetics instead of a (again incompetent but irrelevant in the long run) AI, but I guess this is not going to happen. The creatures and their statistics are well balanced and the sheer volume of enemies in higher difficulties is a kind of numerical regulation of the subpar AI. 

Concluding, if you want a very good solo card game experience you can't go wrong with this one. I know that monetization is through microtransactions and I hate it, but that is also the model of the whole LCG. At least I got the option to buy all the content instead of rolling for it through endless purchases. I think that this is the least invasive business model for this kind of game.
I really hope that when this comes to tablets the accounts will be linked so as to not have to re-purchase the content. 

I am curious to see if this succeeds, what kind of mechanics they will consider for Arkham Horror...

author: {'steamid': '76561197969076610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1695801383}
review:
I'm deeply conflicted about the Lord of the Rings Adventure Card Game. On the one hand, we have a digital version of a game whose theme and mechanics I love, without any of the arduous and time consuming setup and tear down of the physical version. What's more, the UI has all the love and polish of Hearthstone or Magic the Gathering Arena and some much needed improvements have been made to the deck building component of the game without fundamentally changing the underlying mechanics. Brilliant and clever.

Unfortunately, some entirely unnecessary changes have been made to the game, presumably for the sake of simplicity, that do it a disservice. Threat is now just a counter until the next bad thing that happens to you, culminating in your loss. Gone is any concept of optional engagement or avoiding certain enemies by keeping your threat low. Questing, a rich and thematic mechanic by which you placed progress tokens (with little footsteps on them) onto location cards has been abstracted behind a meaningless "fate" value that robs the game of much of its flavor.

All of this could be forgiven, I think, if the attempt to create a more accessible, streamlined experience came with friendlier encounter design but, alas, it is not so. In my opinion, the designers of the Lord of the Rings Adventure Card Game have become so desensitized to their most hardcore fan base constantly complaining about the game being too easy, that they simply lack any perspective about what the experience is like for a new or casual player. As someone who engaged casually both with the physical game and the digital, I can tell you that every brief moment of triumphant success is almost always immediately crushed by a new stage or phase or enemy, often appearing without warning. It's soul crushing, it's not fun, and to add insult to injury, the "narrative" setting does little to alleviate the difficulty, leaving you feeling bad about being unable to play the game on a mode that is a thinly veiled euphemism for "easy".

And so we are left with a game that has the polish and accessibility of a Blizzard offering but the unforgiving depth and complexity of whatever fun-adjacent game Valve has most recently published. Its unnecessary simplifications to the game mechanics will drive away the hardcore players and the encounter design will have casual players putting the game down forever after their third or fourth consecutive loss. It's a game with heaps of potential but, sadly, is right for no one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065634595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1611685374}
review: This is not a digital version on the physical game Lord of the Rings: The Card Game. It has similarities, but if you go into this game thinking it will be the same experience, you will be disappointed. It is kind of a lighter version of that game mixed with Hearthstone. I didn't like it at first, but it has grown on me. The campaign has good storytelling and I think this game will only improve as more cards are made available.

review: Having played the LCG, I was excited for this game to come out. It's different than the cardboard version, but it keeps the same spirit. The mechanics here are interesting and challenging without being so difficult as to make it annoying. (Note: I haven't beat anything in challenge mode. I consider that to be a mode for people who WANT to be annoyed.) There's a lot of re-playability here, in terms of running the missions with different groups of heroes. I recommend it highly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042815435', 'num_games_owned': 1629, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 8169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3639, 'last_played': 1626485908}
review:
Buen juego, llevo ya 60 horas jugadas y cada vez me parece más divertido ya que me monto mejores mazos. Sí que es cierto que no se parece demasiado al LCG físico ya que lo han hecho más ágil a propósito para que puedas hacer partidas en 20-30 minutos (algunas te llevarán más). 

Personalmente si te gusta el mundo de Tolkien y los juegos de mesa, este juego te va a gustar.

Esta completamente traducido al español (he leído comentarios negativos diciendo que no lo estaba pero hacen referencia al early access).

Sí que es cierto que fallan algunas cosas como por ejemplo:

* Falta de nuevas campañas y mazos (ya me lo he pasado todo 3 veces con todos los héroes)
* Que no sea gratis provoca que la comunidad de jugadores sea reducida y por tanto cueste hacer partidas online, pero es cuestión de buscar a gente y quedar para jugar
* Que las cartas no se vean más completas a menos que te pongas encima, esto es bueno y malo a la vez porque si fueran más grandes, si bien veríamos el dibujo, ocuparía quizás demasiado.

review: 魔戒题材个人唯一喜欢的卡牌类型，虽然制作水平确实比不上昆，不如实体版本也挺蛋疼（讲道理，既然抬到电子版来了，完全没有必要阉割，毕竟来玩电子版都是嫌实体版手动麻烦的人，虽然实体整理确实太麻烦耗时，真的电子版阉割了有点失望，电子版由于其方便操作的优点应该比原版更多的设计才好啊），但是也算是可以玩，迅游已经解决网络问题，目前已全通，可惜公司解散了，希望后续继续有DLC，会一直等下去，仍然会继续玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198093761320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1456, 'last_played': 1682509827}
review:
The game is good, different than the real life version but it is good :) i think that "Player vs Deck" with friends or solo should be practiced by all card games. It gives that extra kick to PVE or PVP possibly that people would be interested in.

Nevertheless, i recommend this game to those who do not wish to play the real life version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046688668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4475, 'last_played': 1616356290}
review:
As I write this review the rating is "mixed" and I honestly cannot figure out why.
Well, besides a couple of educated guesses: perhaps the game is harder than some people expected, and perhaps it is less adherent to the physical version than some other people expected.

As far as actual flaws go, I'd be hard pressed to name one.
The art is GREAT, the music is fitting, the voice actors mostly perfect for the roles; overall the LotR theme is genuinely evoked, and the game - which IS somewhat hard but can be mastered (of course that may require some patience) - is FUN.

I can get behind the business model too: finally a card game that can be enjoyed by single players and without the slippery slope implied by packages of random cards to buy.

I'm very happy with the purchase and look forward to the next expansions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028437402', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1661540307}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064750395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1636820195}
review:
je trouve ce jeu vraiment top. j adore l univers de la terre du milieu donc je ne suis peut etre pas objectif
Mais au dela de l'univers, on sent que the lord of the ring adventure card game beneficie du vécu du jeu de carte physique qui est fantastique.Le jeu est vraiment tres riche grace à cela. Le fait qu'il soit sorti en acces anticipé permet d'avoir une version nickel sans bug. Et un tarif de 20 euros tout à fait raisonnable.  La VF est bien presente malgre quelques toutes petites erreurs mais qui ne gachent en rien le plaisir.
Vraiment de l excellent travail, bravo à toute l'équipe!
Nul doute que je vais acquérir rapidement la nouvelle campagne.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006025761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2876, 'last_played': 1611540781}
review:
Thanks for reading this review. 

First off, is this a good game? Yes, it has the potential to be much better though. There's a requirement to be 100% online at all times, for no reason whatsoever. Even solo. 

A lot of the "good" reviews here come from people who have played the physical version, myself included. Boy did FFI rinse us physical users good. We've now paid the same company twice, for the same game. The artwork is the same, look it up. With the recent announcement of discontinuation of the physical version, this is the only option going forward to play LOTR LCG. 

The reason I'm giving this a bad review is that the developers do not listen to the community, at all. As of this point, we've only had two releases of new content this year. They have missed time frames to release new content, with no communication to us as consumers what so ever.

If you're new to the game or thinking about buying this, avoid it. Honestly, you'd think you'd at least be able to play the heroes from the fellowship right? It's LOTR.
No you can't do that. As of now, there is only Aragon, Gimli and Legolas as playable heroes from the fellowship.

There are plenty of random creation heroes though, the new pack that we were getting at the start of September, (which still isn't released) adds more random creation heroes.

Maybe it's just a small team. You're right it is, but they spend more time releasing vague news articles, that tell us nothing, or when we can expect the September pack. Do yourself a favour, read the books again or watch the films for the kick you need. Avoid this like the plague.

I hope they prove me wrong.

Edit: 24/02/2020.

This game sadly didn't even outlive the game it was supposed to be replacing, lasting only a mere 3 campaigns, this is now the only content there will be and FFI as a studio has shut down. 

- Zukin

author: {'steamid': '76561197994432253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1616973573}
review:
This would be a perfectly good game if the idiotic money grabbing corporation behind it did not force an always online connection to play the solo game. What a load of bollocks.

The deck building UI not great which is a shame for a game that lives or dies on your ability to craft good decks for each encounter.

It's not a bad game, it is very thematic, and I appreciate the great voice over during each intro scene.

Sadly it lacks a bit content (new camaigns) and it is unclear if more is to come.

If like me you are a fan of the LCG and / or all things LOTR then you will find some enjoyment without a doubt. 

But I can't really recommend this game, not in its current implementation.

Edit: the game now has a proper offline mode. Now I can wholeheartedly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012308333', 'num_games_owned': 832, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1642963414}
review:
Really enjoying it.

High quality art and voice acting. The story elements I think are interesting and justify mechanically why the cards and various goals are how they are. Given how people into card games gush over mechanics and theme I'm glad to see this implemented so well. 

I played the LCG version of this and thought it was good but wasn't overly keen on deckbuilding without loads of cards and I wasn't willing to invest more money into it so I sold my base game. This game however, is really streamlined so deckbuulding is fast. I've been waiting for the day that this game had a digital adaptation so very happy to see this. I'll definitely be purchasing the DLC to support this game.

NOW CAN WE HAVE A SIMILAR VERSION BUT FOR ARKHAM HORROR LCG PLEEEEEEEEEEEASE?

author: {'steamid': '76561197969594479', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1639347557}
review:
I'm so happy that there is a digital deck-building card game that is not based around random card packs or loot boxes. You get what you pay for without any annoying randomness. You must pay for some base cards and heroes, and you must EARN other powerful cards by playing well (they cannot be bought). I love how there are distinct categories.

I've played hundreds of games of the physical version of this card game and absolutely love it. This version is very different, but I'm still enjoying it quite a bit. However, it is certainly not dumbed down! Wow, is this electronic version HARD! Especially on the Challenging level.

Update: I’ve managed to unlock all the cards now available except for a few from the Hero Specific Achievements. It’s much more fun playing with a co-op partner.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993194051', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1666182438}
review:
A very fun, very replayable, very different digital card game. A really worthy buy.

This game is great for 5 reasons:
[b]First[/b], it is inspired by a board/card game, which means that it focus on your entertaiment. It is not a game as a service, and it feels really rewarding when you persevere (sometimes alone, agains an AI) for the sake of it, and actually make it.
[b]Second[/b], it is simple, yet difficult. The base of the game is really straight foward, which can seem monotonous at first, but the AI and the difficulty and situations that you face are made in such a way that you suddenly are facing a new puzzle every round.
[b]Third[/b], because of the previous, and because it is a PVE game, deckbuilding is actually FUN. It has different difficulty settings and you are facing an AI that doesn't netdeck, so you can go wild, try weird things, try different heroes. Everything can end up working (or not), and it is now one of the very few digital card games that makes the deckbuilding experience actually interesting instead of futile.
[b]Fourth[/b], it IS a cooperative game. Again, this is PVE, there is no netdecking, so playing with friends make sense, and it's fun, and even more fun with weird decks. The multiplayer doesn't feel a subpar experience, something pointless that you do on the side, but actually one of the most fun experiences of the game, and something that you can look foward to.
[b]And fifth[/b], it has plot, and voice acting, and it is actually cool. Maybe the plot is not that awesome, but it adds to the atmosphere, and every new quest is a chill experience, with both a cool introduction to every step of the quest, and then the process of discovering the encounter and how to solve it. Sometimes you will even encounter hidden paths that take you to different situations.

I am really glad that I bought this game. It is very replayable, not in the sense of the other digital cardgames in which you will sink hours, but in the sense that you will play every quest multiple times, with different decks and different expectations, and feel that your time and money were properly expended. As a boardgame would.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084514707', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1670604621}
review:
I played 20+ CCGs during the years, and I got through the tutorial + first campaign in four hours on easy. What felt like one hour was actually three, and  I want to go back and play the game again. The mechanics are interesting, you got lots of options to beat a stage, the combats diverse and fun, and I died twice during the 24 or so games (on easy!). I'm going to buy the expansion now, and I'm eager to see how well co-op works.

Btw, there aren't any micro transactions any more. The reviews talking about it are talking about the early release.

PROS
• It's not a CCG. Cards are locked but you spend in-game currency to unlock just the cards you want.
• You're encouraged to try out different heroes in each part of the campaign.
• Different ways to win.

MISC
• I found patterns in the AI after a while, in how the cards are activated. However,I don't think this is bad but adds to the strategy of the game. The AI has more powerful cards than you, which makes up for not making humanly clever moves.
• The progress in achieve cards seems alright. I can buy the cards I want after I finished a stage (containing 4-6 battles), when I want to change my deck.

CONS
• In game purchases to get new campaigns. Yeah, OK. This is a micro transaction but I also think this is a winning business model (DLC).
• Possibly too few combinations of heroes to start with.
• The hero animations of the start of each stage is annoyingly long.
• Can't hover with mouse over power names to see what they do during the game, but instead have to go to a submenu outside the game  to search for the power.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008498820', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 28767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21607, 'last_played': 1707524149}
review:
Just for clarity , this is not a "PORT" of the TT version . That is NOT a bad thing either . Like many of you ,I would have accepted a TT port without question and enjoyed it. This version does share artwork from cards with the TT but for the most part, Lore aside , thats where it stops

         Yet this game stands on its own nicely and I find it very fun to play. It can also be very frustrating and is  always a challenge no matter which of the 3 tiers of difficulty you play. The highest tier is simply a lesson in humility if you do not have the mechanics and oh so subtle nuances of the game down pat. Those that can not handle defeat , or become quickly agitated if they are not dominating a digital game should know right from the start they simply are not going to win every game , and for sure will dominate only in the rarest of instances.

  The first mechanic you should concentrate on learning  is GUARDING , you will get no where in this game till you understand the ins and outs of who , when, and why to use this game mechanic. Deck building skills are another critical thing you should concentrate early on. There is NO certain cards that simply dominate and hand you a win, though many very strong cards can be added to your build , just no single one will assure victory like it can in many other games of similar nature.

  The games pricing  structure is very similar to that of the TT version and expect add on purchased Adventures and such to be the near equal of it. There is a good amount of value to be had in the initial bundle offering so I would suggest you do so if possible. Many of the other cards not in the base set or adventure pack are simply earned in game through play ,  There is no WHALE type situation either, if you no longer can gain from a given HERO pack or Adventure set , you are unable to purchase it in any way. This greatly levels the field in the co-op mode and allows for all players to have equal success against the AI. 

Lastly be aware that this is a CO-OP or Solo PVE based game, NO PVP . Honestly though, the AI is so good at just beating you like a baby kitten that it does not matter. You will simply hate this AI at times more than you ever could a player thats doing the same to you. It is that good.......

author: {'steamid': '76561198103393335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1653282589}

Me gusta la narrativa e historia del juego, lo cual me pierdo cuando en las partidas narran la historia que solo lo hacen en idioma ingles, se que igual es una mejora grande traducir las voces pero aunque sea colocar los subtítulos en español para entender y seguir la historia del juego pero no me gusta perderme la narrativa y simplemente jugar a lanzar cartas.

Agrear subtítulos en la narrativa de la historia le agregaría un valor muy grande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030679576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1649154498}
review:
The game is alright if not lacking a bit in content. At certain price points if you have a stable Internet connection it is alright. 

My biggest problem with the game, and it is enough to not recommend the game, is that it requires you to be online to play single player. I bought the game on a business trip where the hotel I was in had a wonderful Internet connection. Now that I am back home, the game cannot connect to the servers unless I turn on a VPN. My VPN has trouble connecting and staying up. Often it cannot even load up (stays on the loading screen forever as it cannot connect to servers) and I gave it a go when I did have a stable VPN connection and in the middle of gameplay it kicked me out. 

Is this really necessary so I can "unlock" cards that I theoretically already paid for? It shows in my countries game store but doesn't work in this country. Bleech!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964928431', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1569773073}

author: {'steamid': '76561198274542596', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5677, 'last_played': 1619149203}
review:
How much you'll enjoy this game partially depends on your expectations beforehand.  If, like many others, you're a huge fan of the physical card game you might walk away disappointed, as it changes quite a few mechanics.  

That being said, looking at the product objectively as a whole, it's pretty solid.  Personally, I think they improved on the game quite a bit.  Granted, I find the physical card game it's based on to be pretty mediocre.  It's probably one of my least favorite card games from fantasy flight.  Whereas the physical version felt a little stale and slow, the digital version feels a lot snappier, interactive, and overall more intriguing than the physical version.  

[u][b]For those who are familiar with the physical card game:[/b][/u]

So the main changes to the game are how threat level is handled, and how the general flow of the game is played.  

In the physical game, cards have their own threat value that determines whether or not they interact with players.  This mechanic is non-existant in the digital version.  In this version, every card engages the player.  Instead, threat has certain thresholds where, if met, bad things happen.  Both share the similarity of causing you to lose the game should you go over a certain amount.  

As for the flow of the game, in the digital version the players alternate with plays with sauron.  So for example, if you play a card, sauron then gets to act (such as by having an enemy attack one of your characters, or playing his own card), then the play goes back to you, and so on.  This continues until both the players and sauron pass, in which case a new turn begins.  This is wildly different from how the physical card game plays.  There are no combat commitments and checks (with hidden card boosts), and players don't have their own threat areas (sauron's minions will attack whoever, unless you have a character guard).     

This game also adds some other new mechanics not found in the physical version (characters can commit willpower to fill a meter and get special bonuses, for example).  It can't be stated enough, while there are some similarities this game is ultimately a different game altogether.  

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________

Now on to the pros and cons.

Pros:

[list]
[*]The game is quite a lot of fun to play
[*]The game does a good job of making you feel like you're playing a party of adventurers on an adventure.  Granted, when it comes to this it's no Arkham Horror but it does this better than the physical lord of the rings lcg.  
[*]Each scenario is very different in their mechanics and how they play out. 
[*]It offers a unique experience compared to any card game out there right now.  Mechanically, I don't think there's another card game out there like it.  
[*]Scenarios can range from half an hour to an hour to complete, but there's a save function in the game to pick up where you left off.  
[*]Different difficulty options.  If you're a hardcore gamer of the genre the hardest difficulty probably wont stump you, but you'll still find it at a level that's entertaining.  Likewise, if you're new to the genre or casual, the easiest difficulty is pretty forgiving.  
[/list]

Cons:

[list]
[*]This game only supports up to two players (a con for those expecting up to a 4 player game like the physical version)
[*]It's really rare to match up with someone for multiplayer.  You have to go to the discord chat for that.  
[*]Currently there aren't that many scenarios.  With the base game you can play 9, with 4 more if you get the expansion.
[*]There are many cards that aren't useful.  For example, most events (1 out of the 3 card types) aren't good.  This really limits deck construction, even more so if you only have the base game.  
[/list]

Overall I'd give it a solid 7/10.  I think it could use more options in deck construction and more scenarios.  Furthermore, it would have been great to be able to play this game with up to 4 people.  At the moment, this is more of a single-player game than a co-op game.  For the amount of content it currently has, I'd probably wait to pick this up while it's on sale (I picked it up back when it was only 8 bucks, and I feel that for that price it was a pretty good bargain).

author: {'steamid': '76561198009611882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2002, 'last_played': 1604778225}
review:
This doth be a neat Lord of the Rings themed card game, whose development path was wrought with hazards. Alas, there was not enough precious lure in the first impression to coax my fellowship to try the game out. Thus I've wandered the wilds by meself.

You get to hire heroes of the ring and have them merrily bash through various object(ive)s. It's fun enough casually in spider-sized bites. The UI has gone through a few revisions, yet it's still something of an adventure locating all these knick-knacks.

Pricing is transparent enough. Card games operate in a niche in Bag End, but a hobbit bounces off the road through Woody End faster than you'll bounce off this game, I wager.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002258955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2701, 'last_played': 1609629465}
review: Awesome game, totally took me by surprise. I love how the developers have made cards and aesthetic features of the game unlockable, it's a very clever way of easing into the mechanics and trying out new combinations (as you gradually unlock new cards) so you don't feel overwhelmed. Deck-designing on so many card games is such a stressfest because the choices are completely intimidating. Here the diversity builds little by little. Every playthrough of a quest feels very different, even when you use the same heroes. There's a ton of strategy and planning involved, and with some careful play even a desperate situation can be saved. I love the game; the art  and atmosphere are perfect, and I can tell that a lot of dedication has been put into making the gameplay a delight. Strong recommend for turn-based game lovers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965884925', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1567217308}
review:
The people giving negative reviews all seem like the "gimmie free stuff" people.  They need to get over themselves and quit thinking every game company is here to give hand outs.

The game is not a direct translation of FFG's physical card game, but it's pretty fun and there's plenty of space for deck building strategy.  There needs to be a lot more content if they want to keep this game interesting, but it's coming.  For now, there's plenty for new players to unlock and strive for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364446070', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1646999331}
review:
我是玩过魔戒LCG(以下我简称桌游)甚至买了几个扩充包的，各有各的优点，更改的地方挺多的，差不多是两个游戏了，我个人还是比较喜欢实体桌游吧（由于是几年前的桌游所以扩展包可能比较难找到，小扩展甚至绝版了，某宝本体加所有扩展2999的其实是差不多的），更改的地方把游戏改的有点像TCG，更加容易上手，而且威胁值更改比起普通桌游的更好，不容易突然暴毙，还加入了以前没有的系统
我求求各位吃我安利去看看实体桌游吧，真的是我玩过最好的桌游之一了，淘宝搜索魔戒LCG就可以搜到了

author: {'steamid': '76561198013317537', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 4644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1674603067}
review:
Большинство существующих игр по Властелину Колец привязаны к кинотрилогии. что с одной стороны гарантирует крепкую стилистику, знакомые образы и дух вселенной Толкина. С другой наблюдается явная нехватка индивидуальности, и часть того же духа растворяется во вторичности. Этой игре (а точнее - ее настольному первоисточнику) удалось воссоздать атмосферу Средиземья совершенно новыми красками, не уступающими в яркости произведению команды Джексона.

Но сначала коротко об ее игромеханических возможностях. В распоряжение игрока поступают 3 знаковых в повествовании героя, каждый из которых обладает четырьмя характеристиками: атакой (служит для приведения монстров в стабильное состояние), умением (отражает способность персонажа обходить препятствия, превозмогать проклятия, получать расположение сил света), здоровьем (критерий существования персонажа на поле) и еще одним параметром, который со стороны сюжета выражается в заинтересованности нашим персонажем темными силами, а со стороны игрового процесса - продолжительностью партии: более сильные персонажи, увы. имеют меньше ходов для разделывания сил противника. Под началом наших героев колода из 30 карт, уже знакомым способом перемещающихся по траектории "колода -> рука -> поле боя/мгновенный эффект -> сброс". В этой тридцатке умещаются снаряжения (оружие, броня, щиты и ауры, которыми могут быть снабжены любые персонажи на поле боя, включая супостатов), события (дающие положительный эффект здесь и сейчас), ловушки (срабатывающие при определенных условиях) и союзники (те же герои, но со второстепенными характеристиками и ролью в сюжете).

Вся эта рать, которая может быть собрана вручную или выбрана из уже существующих, противостоит аналогичной колоде противника, которая намерено сильнее и работает по определенным правилам.

Структура хода проста, но именно в ней кроется изюминка игры: в его границах можно совершить одно (если нет дополнительных эффектов) действие: разыграть карту, атаковать, защититься, открыть дверь, разгрести завал, взять в руки секиру, обратиться к Свету за помощью, применить способность и т. д. Аналогичный инструментарий и противника, предпочитающего сначала атаковать, а уже потом использовать нетривиальные приемы. Приходится мудро распределять ресурсы. Если, допустим, первыми ходами пытаться разыгрывать карты, можно можно существенно расширить количество тактических маневров, однако подставить под удар слабых персонажей. Или наоборот, если отложить подмогу картами на последние ходы, уставшие (совершившие действие) персонажи смогут воспользоваться преимуществами только в следующей фазе.

Всевидящее око не дремлет, изливая на наше братство целые легионы пауков, варгов, орков, намереваясь не только устроить геноцид. но и сокращая время партии, изымая карты из руки, проклиная наиболее ценных союзников. Но и у сил Света есть запасной прием: можно обратиться за помощью к Валар, которые по достижению определенного числа на школе "добра" сподобятся прислать нам бонус разнящийся от миссии к миссии.

В итоге получаем весьма "вкусную" формулу, обсчитывать которую раз за разом все интереснее: "колодостроение" + "распределение ресурсов" + "тактика". Первая переменная особенно интересна, поскольку часть карт изначально недоступна: их приходится открывать по мере прохождения квестов, выполнения специальных заданий, часть из которых привязана к героям. За эти же очки доступен пока незначительный набор для оформления: аватары, рубашки карт, несколько рамок.

В игре присутствует кооператив - совершенно отдельный фонтан веселья и тактических изысканий.

Великолепное визуальное оформление, многочисленные цитаты из книг, часть из которых хорошо озвучены ("Возвращайся во тьму!" от Гендальфа особенно вдохновляет) позволяет составить совершенно новый образ знакомого мира, сохраняя изюминку его автора.

Из горького на сем пиршественном столе - многочисленные огрехи в интерфейсе. Но регулярные обновления, думаю, не оставят их залеживаться. Также где-то потерялась локализация на русский (совершенно не помеха в игре, поскольку ничего сложного в ней нет).

Однозначно рекомендую и как поклонник творчества о Средиземье, и как любитель цифровых воплощений настольных игр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020173973', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1568136821}
review:
A great platform for a game, but lacking in content.
It's a single-player card game with CCG elements and campaign mechanics designed to make one match consequential on the following matches. The game is well-designed, but there isn't enough "game" for me to recommend it.

Things I Liked: The mechanics and systems this game has put in place make an excellent platform for future development. The underlying idea is sound. The game is also well polished, complete with fully voiced narration, good artwork, and few bugs.

Things I Disliked: The amount of content. I hit the "DLC-wall" with a resounding thud about 7 hours-in. The base game comes with 1 campaign, which has 5 missions. You also get to "start" the 2nd campaign, but can't really play it until you buy the DLC. The base experience doesn't feel like a complete game, more like a demo.

Recommendation: For those looking for a game similar to this, but with much more content available, I would recommend Thronebreaker. Same kind of game, but with much more to enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007599656', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 10948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1705530577}
review:
Excellent jeu même si j'apprécierais plus de paliers dans les niveaux de difficulté qui me mettent en position ou mes parties sont beaucoup trop faciles (en facile) ou bien trop difficiles (en intermédiaire).

Malgré cela TLOTRACG est fidèle à l'esprit de son modèle et très agréable. Il faut envisager l'échec sur un deck mal construit et parfois un simple ajustement de 4 ou 5 cartes fait toute la différence sur le restart.


MAJ 04/2021 : La reprise du jeu par un nouveau studio a été suivie d'une mise à jour qui a supprimé le problème de connexion même si ma réserve principale sur les niveaux de difficultés avec une trop grande différence n'a pas changée. Néanmoins, TLOTR:ACG  reste très bon il n'y a maintenant plus aucun obstacle pour y succomber. 

L'interface du menu à été revue pour privilégier la lisibilité au détriment de l'apparence ce qui n'est finalement peut être pas plus mal.

la modification qui permet de recommencer une Quête au début de chaque chapitre dans sa situation initiale au lieu de recommencer toute la quête depuis le début est vraiment salutaire et améliore complètement mon expérience de jeu.

La Quête des rencontres aléatoires de Galadriel est la bienvenue ainsi que l'aventure en Rohan, le tout en update gratuit, c'est plutôt classe. Le contenu global devient plus que généreux et personnellement je me précipiterais sans hésiter sur une nouvelle campagne DLC.

Un jeu que j'apprivoise de plus en plus avec le temps et avec un grand plaisir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019956635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1579372011}
review: Unfortunately, I never had the chance to play the LCG from Fantasy Flight Games and, although this adaptation is only inspired by it, I'm enjoying it nonetheless: the quests are well written and fully dubbed; the art style is taken straight out of the FFG's original  digital art, which displays some of the best illustrations I've seen so far for a boardgame; the soundtrack is fine and helps for immersion and overall feel. By simply playing the game and completing tasks you'll unlock all the cards currently available to build your deck: yes, there's in-game currency, but you will gain it just by playing the game and finishing quests (no real money whatsoever), whilst the DLC (and future ones) will provide new quests, heroes and content as expansions of a solid, story-driven core game. From what i've seen so far, it could be worth it for any Tolkien's fan: I'll be sure to keep an eye on future developments, as Sauron would... ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025273374', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1567927171}
review: the overall gameplay is really confusing and lack of challenge. it seems the devs just trying to jam a ton of interactions into the game without giving them much thoughts. the tutorial didn't do a well enough job of explaining the interactions. the UI is extremely unpolished. it is a poorly designed a game with the lord of the rings skin slapped on top of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099214374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1672839895}
review:
没玩过实体的魔戒LCG，实体的AHLCG玩到4循环。感觉这个电子版魔戒最失望的是组卡的乐趣没有发掘出来，内容少，受限多，也玩不出来什么花花套路，主要靠3张英雄打天下。
首先，服务器连10次有7次上不去。挂VPN开加速器没什么鸟用。
然后，游戏内容感觉很少，就2章共10关战役+3个遭遇。
最后，组卡的乐趣没有感受到。部分关卡高难度被打的蛋疼，过牌速度太慢，钱也不够花。

author: {'steamid': '76561198173100463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1652594338}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060690864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1647799668}
review: I don't write many reviews, but have to say that this is a fantastic game for folks who like strategic card games with their fantasy.  The artwork, presentation, and narrative campaign delivery is very well done and effectively helps set the atmosphere.  Tolkien fans will love this.  I have played the physical card game on which this is based (solo), but could never get into the housekeeping management aspects - it was just too fiddly to keep track of everything.  The digital version takes care of this for you while improving the core gameplay imo.  It has that "just one more turn" feel to it that will keep you going for hours.  I also like having the option to choose the difficulty (narrative - for enjoying the story, adventure - offers a challenge while not being impossible, and challenge - for advanced players).  Great job devs!  I hope to see more campaigns and future digital versions of Fantasy Flight games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123897072', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1618033160}
review: 和魔戒LCG相比改了很多机制，移除了卡牌的防御值系统；交锋，探索，以及派系资源使用都删掉了；回合变成你动一下我动一下，这点上暂时说不出来是好还是不好。目前最大的问题是相比魔戒LCG，卡牌和任务数量都太少了，另外这联机功能只能和好友联机吗？

author: {'steamid': '76561198020659445', 'num_games_owned': 1406, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1576524031}
review:
I enjoyed Hearthstone PVE mode when it first being introduced and I expected this game looked and played like the Hearthstone PVE mode. But what I played so far proven me wrong, the game has different mechanics and even more contents (in-term of Singleplayer) from Hearthstone and the full-voiceover narrated stories also bring me into the situation of the card battles. 

Played it and enjoy it so far and recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983080575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1577029290}
review:
I haven't played any of the digital card games, and my memories of physical card games are very distant memories of Magic and some fancy Pokemon I collected and did not understand.

So, this is a new genre for me, and I like the LOTR setting, so I thought I'd dive in.  I'm glad I did.  The game is engaging and the story is good, based on the lore of the books.  I love the artwork and the 'feel' of gameplay. 

It's a complex game, with some strategic layers not yet apparent to me.  It's also a 'one more turn' sort of game, but more with the campaigns. Relaxing but strategic and easy to pick up and put down - my sort of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198421035761', 'num_games_owned': 1807, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1567521708}
review:
[quote]
[h1][spoiler] 这是一个攸关生存与勇气，为了人类的光明未来，誓死抵抗黑暗的动人故事。
                                                 ——彼得·杰克逊[/spoiler][/h1]


[h1] The Lord of the Rings: Adventure Card Game 指环王：卡牌冒险[/h1]
本作是一款以指环王为题材的策略卡牌游戏，游戏基于原著所建立的魔幻世界，在游戏中，玩家将响应未知冒险的召唤，直面索伦的黑暗势力，为了保护中土世界的和平，开启属于自己的冒险之旅。游戏元素丰富，游戏性较强，并且画风极大程度还原了人物在玩家心中的印象，魔戒老粉快来入手。

[h1]👉前言👈[/h1]
第二纪元1200年，黑暗魔君索伦以“天赋宗师”安纳塔的身份出现在伊瑞詹。伊瑞詹领主凯勒布理鹏受索伦的欺骗，铸造了十九枚统御魔戒——精灵三戒、矮人七戒和人类九戒。
1600年，索伦暗中铸造了至尊魔戒，以控制其他的统御魔戒。
1693年，索伦率军入侵伊利雅德，精灵与索伦之战爆发，人类九戒落入索伦之手。
巴拉巴拉巴拉巴拉 索伦太牛批啦 巴拉巴拉巴拉巴拉~~~
3441年，索伦在巴拉多之围中先后杀害了伊兰迪尔和吉尔加拉德。埃西铎捡起纳西尔圣剑的碎片，斩下了索伦戴有魔戒的手指，索伦的肉体因此消亡。埃西铎夺取了魔戒，但他拒绝销毁它，并将它作为自己的传家之宝。
第三纪元2年，埃西铎在格拉顿平原被半兽人杀害，魔戒掉入安都因河，从此被人们遗忘。
第三纪元1000年前后，索伦以死灵法师的身份重新出现在中土大陆，建立了多尔哥多。
第三纪元2463年，魔戒被霍比特人德戈发现，他的好友史麦戈被魔戒诱惑，将他杀害并夺取了魔戒。史麦戈后来被族人逐出家乡，他藏身于迷雾山脉的洞穴中，并被魔戒转变为一个名为“咕噜”的扭曲而堕落的生物。
2941年，霍比特人比尔博·巴金斯应灰袍巫师甘道夫的邀请参与了孤山任务，他在途中偶然发现了魔戒。
-------------------------------------------------------------------------[i]故事背景时间摘自百度百科[/i]

说到世界上最顶尖的奇幻文学，不用思考，必须是魔戒。魔戒一书的名声响彻全球，魔戒三部曲也是很多少年奇幻文学的启蒙书籍。魔戒这一系列的成功不只是体现在书籍之上，根据这一题材，“彼得大帝”导演的系列电影更是在二十一世纪掀起了一股“魔戒风”。从古到今，文学界没有人不赞叹托尔金的伟大，也没有任何一部作品能够超越魔戒，魔戒这两个字在人们心里早已根深蒂固。到如今，游戏届也有不少以指环王或是霍比特人作为题材的游戏，有些只是将着重点放于中土世界，并且收获了极高的评价，有些只是以寓教于乐的方式推广魔戒的主线剧情（乐高真好van）。当然，本作作为一款卡牌游戏，以魔戒为题材，用魔戒背景故事加以润色，将原著上的一些人物代以卡牌的形式加以表现，玩家可以定义自己的初始牌组，改变出场的英雄，利用一些小技巧达成当前的目标，并同时保护自己的主将，降低索伦的警惕。但就目前来说，游戏的服务器一般，卡牌的数量相对较少，剧情内容也并不是很多，并且游戏的内购真的不少，好在游戏剧情以及人物都有配音，给游戏的整体体验提升了一个档次。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1851134148
[h1]👉游戏体验👈[/h1]
玩家如果想要更多了解一下剧情，可以在游戏中选择进行剧情模式，可以更好了解游戏所采用的剧情设计，游戏中的配音十分地道，让玩家可以更好的融入剧情。游戏采用回合制的玩法，卡牌战斗的方面制作的比较偏向炉石，使用卡牌放技能或是召唤随从都要看指定卡牌是几费的，能量可以累计，以便在下一轮打出高费的牌，主将之外还有仆从，有一定的攻击、技能或是特殊的保护主将机制。玩家还可以利用特定技能的卡牌回复将领血量，增加护盾等等等等。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1851134188
游戏中的仆从或是英雄都有相应的攻击值、法力值以及血量，攻击值以蓝色斧头标志展现，法力值以黄色方块标志展现，我方人员血量均为红。对于敌人方面，因为在游戏一开始，我方三位主将会直接上场，但敌人可能会有多位怪物或是加上几张效果牌，对于效果牌，下方通常会有写有数字的黄色方格表示其血量，拥有法术攻击的角色才能给效果牌造成伤害（一开始没看明白，傻傻的拿着自己攻击3法术1的英雄哐哐冲，一点一点磨法术牌，刚刚磨完对面直接再放一张瞬间崩溃）因为每一轮，每位英雄只能进行一次攻击，所以玩家需要合理计算我方英雄所能造成的最大伤害。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1851134271
在游戏中，每个任务都有多个关卡，只有通过“最后遭遇”，任务才会胜利，在游戏过程中敌人的一些诡术牌或是一些事件会增加索伦的警觉值，警觉值达到五十，如果自己没有能够降低警觉值的卡牌，则直接gg。有些关卡是有相应的任务，比如击败一定数量的特定敌人或是击破幻像，没有必要在一轮里清空敌方的所有随从，达到目标即可直接点击旅行进入下一场景，没有必要浪费太多时间。有些关卡还需要注意其特殊规定，比如游戏中有一关是敌方出现三张“冰裂缝”则游戏直接失败，玩家在完成任务的同时需时刻注意这些特殊限定。
任务胜利之后，玩家可以通过使用获得的金钱购买卡牌背景之类的装饰等等，自定义人物牌组以及人物语音。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1851134302

[h1] ❤️优点❤️[/h1]

👍 题材好评

👍 配音好评

👍 战斗机制好评

[h1]💔缺点💔[/h1]

👎 剧情不多

author: {'steamid': '76561198057730015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1455, 'last_played': 1629757968}
review:
Viciei muito nesse jogo. Apesar disso tenho certeza que se não houver atualizações frequentes as pessoas ficarão enjoadas dele. POR FAVOR NÃO DESCONTINUEM ESSE PROJETO!

Pontos positivos:
-Jogo bastante semelhante ao de "tabuleiro" da Galápagos, que é muito divertido
-Campanhas legais. É possível ver que houve um esforço dos desenvolvedores em fazer mecânicas que deixassem o jogo desafiador .
-Gráficos bons
-Forma de desbloqueio das cartas sem pagar é muito legal (vencer campanhas ou realizar objetivos com os heróis). Recebi as DLCs por ter comprado o jogo base, mas compraria outras sem pensar muito à respeito
-Arte bacana/Música boa
-Filtro de cartas tem uma busca que facilita encontrar palavras específicas nas cartas


Pontos negativos:
-Não disponível no idioma PT-BR 
-Seria legal ter mais opções de arte das cartsa, seja dos personagens ou mesmo do verso.

Atualização:
Gostei bastante da DLC. Melhorou muito as possibilidades de construção de deck e gerou uma nova campanha. Espero que façam várias outras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004286010', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1595059652}
review: Je m'attendais au pire à la lecture des évaluations steam mais l'appréhension a rapidement été démentie par un gameplay vraiment soigné (je n'ai pas joué à l'early access). Très fun à jouer une fois les mécaniques comprises, avec une bonne grosse dose de stratégie et finalement assez peu d'aléatoire. Bref, conquis, même si le jeu n'atteint pas la profondeur du jeu de carte physique.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965768956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1597264986}
review: Nice digital version of Lotr LCG Game, its like hearthstone with Lotr's card game mechanics and bits of tolkien's middle earth narrative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151328408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1139, 'last_played': 1661681657}
review:
I have played the game now for about 30 hours and am most of the way through the initial quest on the 'easiest' setting. The game is a challenge to play, and no one single deck will get you from the start to the finish. There is a good selection of pre-built decks, but of course once you have a good idea of the mechanics, and knowledge of the cards, building your own deck is fun and the way to go.

However, this is not the LCG, the separate phases of the card game are not really there, that isn't to say that it isn't a good game because it is, but if your are expecting to play the LCG in its purest form then this is not that game.

My only complaint is that the game desperately needs a manual save facility, as I keep disconnecting from the server, if this happens and the game doesn't reconnect quickly then you face having to keep going back to the start of each set of linked quests which can be a little frustrating.

Otherwise, I am really enjoying it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031028950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1669611981}
review: gotta admit this game is fun. I  play the LCG version and there are some similarities. This is a laid back, relaxing game with good storytelling and fun mechanics. I've only played the single player campaign. But yes if you like card games and LOTRG grab this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004527772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1667532710}
review:
Um jogo de cartas com foco em single player e co-op, com longa campanha, muitas cartas e itens para desbloquear, tudo com uma implementação excelente de O Senhor dos Anéis que inclui voice acting dos personagens clássicos da obra de Tolkien e uma trilha sonora belíssima.

No gameplay há bastante desafio (regulável em 3 níveis) e variações estratégicas conforme a base de heróis que você escolhe.
A barra do olho de Sauron acrescenta um desafio considerável e tira o foco total sobre o que acontece entre as cartas, já que você deve considerar sua estratégia para não perder o jogo ao encher a barra por completo. Avançar na campanha tendo que tomar decisões entre uma batalha e outra ou cumprir missões para conseguir cartas extras é outro aspecto muito interessante e divertido do jogo que o diferencia dos CCGs tradicionais.

O jogo conta com um editor de decks completo que permite a você usar as cartas que for desbloqueando conforme completa missões.

Gráficos e design dos cenários e cartas é bonito e nada pesado, podendo rodar em notebooks com tranquilidade.

O fato de ainda não ter um multiplayer PvP pode afastar alguns, mas é um jogo imperdível para fãs de Tolkien e CCG games.

Pra fechar: nada de microtransações. Isso mesmo, zero. 

Altamente recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058414664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1586398955}
review: Great card game, no pay to win, no ridiculous grind. This game has around 20 hours of solo game-play in the base game and more if you play with a friend. The voice acting is spot on and it follows the books rather than the movies. The music and atmosphere are spot on. Overall its more of a puzzle card game, the game isn't competitive just lots of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181862905', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1604952312}
review:
Great job devs.
I owe the card game and this digital version is done really well. Intuitive interface and faithful to the original.
I find that buy to play concept is refreshing for a digital card game. No need to grind mindlessly to get the needed cards or buy loot box card packs.
Good idea to put variable design covers for cards and etc, under points received for achievements. Feels like getting rewarded for playing the game well.
As improvement, I would love to see more animations for cards.

Keep up the good work for the expansion packs. 
Thanks and good luck

author: {'steamid': '76561198030925878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1567122691}
review:
I refunded the game/i am in the process of it. 

I watched gameplay footage and thought it looked quite good and the core concept wasn't as convoluted as heartstone turned out. 
The only thing i didn't notice during the gameplay footage was the voice acting. Needless to say i think it is bad. It was corny, completely over the top oneliners which made no sense coming from a character like aragorn or arwen. 

i think this is why tolkien didn't want adaptations for his works. Any character, anything in his works really is interconnected and has a reason for existing. The movies depicted it perfectly. ANy character carried with himself aa certain level of gravitas, nothing obsolete and convoluted. The characters never ever would have spouted oneliners and rarely if ever did things without purpose. In my opinion there are good if not great or amazing adaptations from his work. I have watched the movies at least 20 times at the very least read the books twice as many times, i have hundreds if not thousands hours in LOTRO and played the shadow of mordor/shadow of war (both of which i loved storywise, which is to say i like non-canon as well.)

As for the game itself, the graphics are outdated, you have to buy more campaigns/cards all of which are pretty limited atm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079811193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1588295837}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011257546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 27881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25872, 'last_played': 1615559207}
review:
[h1]I give this game 3 thumbs up... wait, that's not a thumb![/h1]    [i]giggity[/i]



If you love card games, but have grown tired of the competitive meta slog that so many TCG's/CCG's fall into, where creative expression and fun are replaced with dull rock-paper-scissors game-play and a constant feeling that validation can only be achieved by winning against another person, then this might be the game for you.
If you just want to relax, create a deck(machine) and use it to solve puzzles (difficult and easy), while also being told a short tale set in the fantastic Middle-earth universe by Tolkien... then this is the game for you.

Are you tired of Card Games that utilise the lootboxy system of card packs, and would prefer getting new cards and quests through regularly released expansions (some of which are free)... then this is the game for you.

Do you hate a challenging or difficult games, and would rather not meet a game on it's own terms, or are you likely to blame your losses on RNG? Then this might not be the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039658885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1603246800}
review:
I've really enjoyed my time with LOTR Adventure Card Game. Deck building is fun and the quests are interesting and fairly varied / thematic.

I'm not that interested in playing the same quests over and over again, but it is fun enough the first couple times with different decks. After playing through each campaign and challenge quest a couple times i am happy to set aside the game until the next dlc drops. Which i will pick up on day one for another few hours of entertainment. 

The interface could use a lot of work as the game feels pretty clunky as a whole. The deck builder is particularly bad. Having keywords explained in hangers when you've right clicked on a card would be a huge quality of life improvement. Having to go into the options menu to look things up in tedious and unnecessary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088468223', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2574, 'last_played': 1698501957}
review: I am a big fan of The Lord of The Rings and Tolkien writings. Great epic stories about a fantasy realm than never before. First I was skeptic about this game, cause don't really liked Heartstone when tried to play. And not a big fan of card games, but gave it a chance and now, love it. It's different than the others, more adventure and smart playing card game than any others available. Plus, favorite Lord of The Rings characters are present. In the future I suggest to not abandon the game at one time but continuous development and improvements. Also, improve cross platform playing, including IOS and Android with Multi-Player matches between every platform.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054070420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1612624943}
