Coming out of EA on 29/09/19 ( next week for those reading now ) If you enjoy your card games, rpgs, or even the wonderful world the J.R.R Tolkien created then snap this up you'll love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967592718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1604111895}
review:
Quelques différences avec le jeu sur table mais au final sans impact négatif sur le jeu, c'est juste différent, ni meilleur, ni mauvais, donc c'est tout bon.

Modèle économique avec core game + DLC beaucoup plus intéressant.

Jeu très sympathique, et encore meilleur à deux ! Je le recommande !

Bref, un très bon portage à mon sens, et je pense que les avis négatifs viennent surtout des joueurs qui n'aiment pas le jeu contre moteur de jeu et les JCE en règle général.

Et pour ma part je n'ai pas vraiment eu de bug très méchant, faut quand même rappeler que c'est un EA !

author: {'steamid': '76561198165524585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1571567704}
review:
The good:
   Great gameplay, the core mechanics are really fun, different from the usual TCG's. Every quest is it's own goal and the goals vary a lot. It's not just "Get your opponent hp to zero". Each quest feels like a puzzle you need to solve.
   Good monetization.
   Good voice acting.
   Good story, especially if you are a fan of LOTR universe.
   Good soundtrack.

The bad:
  Buggy. Had multiple crashes and UI glitches. Tends to be ok since it saves your progress between rounds. I would say it's fine since it's early access, but they are planning to release the game on consoles this month, so I'm not sure how they can do it at this state.
  Poor UI. Honestly just confusing, hard to see buttons, the keyword effects are not explained on the screen so you need to look at glossary, etc.
  Confusing out of game mechanics in general. Like, for quests you get coins, but then it's not clear what do you do with that. You can buy some visual changes(card backs, frames, icons, alternate art) but I got more than 20k coins from playing for 3 hours, which seems more than enough to get anything you want. 
  Or  you look at the cards you don't have, it says to unlock it I need to purchase Campaign 2: the shadow fall. Ok, that's fair. But then I try to play the Campaign 2 and it let's me. So I can play it, but I need to buy it to unlock the cards? It's hard to understand what exactly are you getting with the core pack, and what the expansions give you. I thought with the core pack I get only core cards, but then there are some cards that you unlock as you play. So who knows.
  Not possible to play with touchscreen. A certain action requires a right click, and hold doesn't register as a right click. Which is a shame since touchscreen tends to be the most comfortable control method for card games.


Overall:
   If you always enjoyed the concept of TCG's and card building, or wanted to get into it, but you don't like the never ending grind and money sink, this is a best thing you can get. I really like it, and I hope the developers will improve on the issues since the core gameplay is superb.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019888585', 'num_games_owned': 975, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1573315810}
review:
한국어 리뷰가 없네요.
리뷰를 계속해서 업데이트 해보겠습니다.

1. 2019년 8월 6일
- FFG 사의 반지의제왕 LCG 가 원작입니다. 그걸 디지털로 만든게 이겁니다.
- 아직 몇 판 안해봤습니다.
- 한글화가 안되어 있어 언어의 압박이 있지만... 영어 수준은 높지 않습니다.
- 인트로 나레이션 및 캐릭터 음성 더빙이 잘 되어있어 게임에 몰입하는 데에 도움이 됩니다.
- 카드 이미지에 FFG 사의 실물 카드게임인 반지의 제왕 LCG 일러스트를 채용하고 있는데... 일러스트 하나하나가 훌륭합니다. 
- 스팀판은 원작 반지의제왕 LCG 와 룰이 다릅니다. PC 게임에 어울리도록 개편된듯 합니다.

이 게임은 기본적으로...
우리가 잘 아는 영웅들이 책과 영화에서 소개된 시나리오대로 여정을 떠납니다. (반지원정대)
다음 여정으로 가기위해서는 토큰 카운터를 공략해야 합니다. (=일종의 메인 퀘스트)
하지만 사우론의 거미들이 계속 공격해오기 때문에... 얘네들을 좀 잡아줘야 합니다.
고유 능력들이 있는 카드들이 많기 때문에, 이런 카드들을 전략적으로 이용해야 합니다.

돈법사의 매직더게더링 과 FFG 사의 LCG 게임 (반지의제왕)의 가장 큰 차이점은...
LCG 는 카드팩을 사면... 해당 덱을 전부 보유하게 됩니다.
매직더게더링의 경우 카드팩을 사면... 해당 덱중 랜덤하게 5장, 10장 나와서 풀 셋을 맞추려면 여러번 사야합니다.

LCG 역시 이러한 확장 카드팩 자체가 꾸준하게 출시되는 편인데... 
한번만 구매하면 되니 상대적으로 돈 부담이 덜한 편입니다.
아마 스팀판도 마찬가지 아닐까 생각됩니다. (DLC 방식으로 구매...)

이 게임은 스토리 텔링 + 덱빌딩 카드 게임입니다.
반지의제왕 분위기에 맞는 음악, 멋진 일러스트가 게임의 재미를 더해줍니다.
음성 나레이션, 더빙도 나쁘지 않네요.

제가 거의 30년째 반지의제왕 덕후라... (아... 아재입니다) 처음 몇 판 해본 소감은... 재밌다 입니다.

반지의제왕 테마 좋아하면 => 괜찮은 게임입니다.
그렇지 않다면 => 별로 재미없을 겁니다.

반지의제왕을 비롯하여 FFG 사의 LCG 게임들은 테마에 몰입되지 않으면 영 재미없습니다.

아직 얼리 액세스에 몇 판 안해봐서... 추후 업데이트 하겠습니다.

2. 2019년 8월 26일
- 종종 하는데... 한 판에 10분내에 끝나서 가볍게 할만합니다.
- 이거 난이도가 거의 크툴루 코즈믹 호러 급이네요. 몹들이 아주 쏟아져 나옵니다. 퀘스트 빨리 클리어 안하면... 몹들에게 다구리 맞고 끝나기 십상이네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998918666', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1643301869}
review: The music is recently my favorite track- deck building theme.  From the presentation to the audio quality, animations, rollout of dlc, early access, content, mechanics, everything about it is top notch quality.   I am new to CCG and this is easy to get into but challenging to progress through.  Graphics 5/5, music 5/5, game play 5/5, challenge, 5/5, new content seems to be coming in every so often, so it is worth getting into.  The content of the story is enjoyable and engaging, yet delightful, it is not grossly dark or overly childlike, there is quality voice acting, responsive UI, no noticable flaws in the networking of the game / netcode.  Overall, i am glad i purchased this and i have purchased some DLC as well and will continue to do so for this amazing combination of FFI and the intellectual property of LOTRO which is inspired fiction by a sensible and respected author.  The mechanics of the game is similar to a perpetual raid, as the enemy cannot be taunted beyond a certain gauge limit.  This mechanic of adding cards to the deck is also a nice meta experience and the software could not be more polished.  There seems to be an under-estimation of the support this game should get, i think it should leave early access sooner rather than later if this turns out to be the case.  I like this kind of game because it is easy to get into and does not require an excessive amount of user interaction with the UI dialog / event loop.  The difficulty is infamous in this game, and correctly sets the expectation that it should take several attempts to complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011902372', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1681427751}
review: Game isn't fun at all. It's a shame having an incredible IP and making this. Harsh UI, the cards that truly have beautiful artworks are shown like Hearthstone's pawns, boards are just common. This isn't the LCG, that's why the name change. Tried three times to come back to this game and it couldn't keep me. My suggestion, rework the whole thing and make a descent card game. It's still in early access, although i don't how much better it can become...as it is now...it's just a waste of IP making some moneygrabs for FF. Lord of the rings enthusiasts and card game lovers should look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004710228', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1777, 'last_played': 1630567583}
review:
The Lord of the Rings is an adaptation of Fantasy Flight game's Lord of the Rings LCG. Instead of playing against a random deck, the developers have changed the game to incorporate actual AI that you're playing against, making this closer to a traditional TCG like magic.

I'd love to see more variety in terms of quests, but these will be added at a later date- so I'm not holding it against the game right now. 

The game is very generous with its rewards, you're able to purchase at least 1 card after completing each quest, meaning you're constantly unlocking new things and possibilities to try.

I'll be updating the review down the line, especially as it comes out of early access or as the issues are addressed. I really do want to love this game, but I can't recommend currently.

The biggest issue currently is major server issues, which the devs are aware of.  This is the primary reason I can't recommend the game in its current state. Several times now I've attempted to play the game but been unable to due to the developer's servers just not functioning. I can understand this for the multiplayer aspect, but the game also has singleplayer that is requiring a constant connection to their server for no reason. The devs need to 1. Fix their servers and 2. Add the ability to play offline for single player content.


UPDATE 10/2020
Rejoice fans, for since reviewing this game last it has died. Asmodee shut it down, but it has since been revived by Antihero studios, who as of yesterday just added the feature I wanted most - Single Player offline ability. 
So, thumbs down to asmodee for launching a mess of a game and then abandoning it, thumbs up to antihero studios for swooping in and accepting responsibility. Things look promising.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048387441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1569794268}
review: Though very different from the physical LCG, this is a fun and interesting adaptation. Some mechanics take some getting used to, but I have, so far, enjoyed the game. I have been pleased that the game has improved through the Early Access process and I hope it continues. Picked it up on EA launch and was a little disappointed, but have enjoyed the improvements and updates. Much more playable nowadays. Looking forward to trying out the co-op side of things (haven't had the chance yet). Pick it up if you enjoy LotR, which you should.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007340885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1578055022}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057216839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1562177540}
review:
Un juego bastante entretenido. El sistema de deckbuilding que propone me ha parecido interesante aunque, no sé si es la inexperiencia, pero las cartas de Saber me han parecido imprescindibles para mantener a los héroes razonablemente bien de vida así como para poder robar cartas y mantener el ritmo.

Las voces y los efectos de sonido consiguen una buena ambientación, y afortunadamente, el juego no será siempre un camino de rosas, lo cual es de agradecer, pues siendo un juego de campañas cerradas, el que tenga su complejidad y que haya diversos caminos en la historia de la campaña ayuda a querer jugarlo de nuevo con otro grupo de héroes y/o en otros niveles de dificultad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101873377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1565880886}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060869317', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2252, 'last_played': 1641518532}
review:
Do you like Magic of the Gathering and Hearthstone but want a game that focus more on CO-OP and PvE? Then this game is for you! Especially if you are a fan of Lord of the Rings.

While it is in early access still at the time of this review. I feel that this game is shaping up to be really solid game. the best part is that there is no predatory microtransactions or any of them whatssoever.  [strike] Unlike a certain game company that said that lootboxes are a "surprise mechanic" and there is noting wrong with them [/strike]

The new content you get can be pay in DLC (expansions). This is just like the tabletop game, the only expectation is that you get free encounters (levels) from time to time provided by
Asmodee Digital, and earning cards in the game without needing to pay real word money for it (in fact, you can't even spend money to earn more in-game currency). That said, if you are not really a fan of card games or digital ones. Then i'm not sure if you will enjoy this. However, to do those that do. This is a game that does things differently while being fun to even veterans of the card game genre.

review:
Es ist ein Mischung aus dem Lotr: LCG und ein bisschen von Hearthstone. 
Die Entwickler geben sich wirklich mühe und überarbeiten das Spiel um wirklich sicherzustellen das der Spielspaß garantiert wird.
Das Spiel an sich selber ist nicht zu leicht, man muss öfters sein deck öfters anpassen um gegen bestimmte Scenarios zu bestehen, was ich gut finde.
Freu mich schon auf die neuen Scenarios!

author: {'steamid': '76561198870410143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1638904713}
review: Being someone who has been playing the card game, I did not enjoy my first few digital games but then gradually the mechanics started to fall into place and I was able to understand and  plan each round. I am having a blast with it and it gives me my fix when I can't get the cards out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977820959', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2964, 'last_played': 1637818337}

author: {'steamid': '76561198143973333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1366, 'last_played': 1704143563}
review:
Très bon jeu de cartes: 
- points positifs, 
Interface fluide et claire, création de decks facile, personnalisation du graphisme de ses cartes et avatars, cartes accessibles en jouant au jeux. Mode solo : didacticiel clair et bien fait, récit et narration intéressante, 3 modes de difficultés (Récit, aventure et récusation), traduction écrite en Français.
- points négatifs,
Faibles nombres de quêtes (10) + 2 rencontres, jeu difficile même en mode récit et niveau des rencontres hardcore, manque encore quelque cartes pour pouvoir construire un decks assez puissant de n'importe quel types ( noldor, nain, gondor, hobbit ...), cartes de niveau de sphères 3 difficiles à introduire dans un deck. Narration en Anglais.

Pour conclure je vous recommande ce jeu, il est excellent pour une version en accès anticipé. Si vous aimez les jeux de cartes et le monde du seigneur des anneaux et hobbit fonçez.  Vivement sa version complète !!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978833101', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1598111974}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005574775', 'num_games_owned': 899, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1570146762}
review:
It is just awful. Complete waste of time. I wish I had the 2 hours of my life back I spent playing this. Uninstalled it.

Update in response to developer comment. 

Reinstalled the game and played through it some more just to get my notes correct. The issues I have are below. 

Whole game play lasts about 2-3 hours (including expansions) which is pretty short. 
Appears to be focus on repeating playthroughs to get some sort of unlock, but these are needlessly hard to find. The mission ones you need to click on each individual mission in each mission group to see, there is then a flyout tab for the heroes who have been on that mission which is a separate location, then there are apparently unlocks for doing certain things with heroes but I cant see where they are listed at all.
Again, if the focus is to play through multiple times with different decks, that process is made needlessly difficult. As far as I can tell you cant replace a hero in a deck without removing them first and if they are the last hero of that type in the deck then it also removes all cards of that type. 
The card pool is really small. I realize this is early access, but it has been in early access for a year now so clearly the progress is lacking. 
The mission pool is really small. See above.
There is a mechanic in one of the missions that is just reset all progress you have made towards the goal. This is lazy way to add difficulty that serves no purpose but to annoy the player. 
At the beginning of each adventure you have to listen to the voice line for each hero (which you have heard 2 dozen times by the end) and you cant play the game until they all do it. 
The UI is poorly designed. In several places you run into a situation where you click something, nothing happens immediately so you click again only to see it did work and you just screwed something up by clicking the thing that it changed to. An example of this is when you go to edit a deck, if you double click the deck by accident it opens the deck and then starts removing cards from it. 
I cannot find my discard pile. The enemy removed cards from your hand and deck very frequently (another poor design choice, see loss aversion), they flash on the screen for a second and then they are gone. When they remove 6 cards this way there is no time to read them all and I cant find a discard pile to look at what is in there. 
On that same thread there are a lot of mechanics that the enemy can do that you have no response for. There are almost no cards to recover cards from discard even though you almost always loose random cards because of the enemy actions. 
There is no filter to see what cards you only have 1 of (if you are looking for something to spend the in game currency on). 
The news takes up more space than anything else on the main menu and tells you almost nothing.
developer_response:
Hi DropDeadCriminal. 

While we do appreciate all reviews, both negative and positive, those that do not provide us constructive information as to what causes a negative experience does not assist us in improving the game.

Can you update your review to explain why it is that you feel Lord of the Rings: Adventure Card Game was not an enjoyable experience for you? With that information we can look into potential improvements and changes that might help to improve the game for when you next try it out.

Update: Thank you for your updated and clear concerns that you labelled in your review. I will forward these on to our developers so that they are aware for future changes and improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198429059277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1560699898}
review:
Dont buy this game!!!
If you want to start single player game, it requires an email confirmation from the asmodee account,
which you will never get at the moment -> stuck at the tutorial.
Great Job Asmodee!
developer_response:
Hi Komplete. 

We're unaware of any issue that should prevent you from receiving the confirmation email. What we recommend is that you try two things to solve this problem:

1) Check your spam folder for your email to see if it got redirected there due to filtering.
2) Contact our support team with your account name and email, and they will be able to resolve any issues you might be having with validating your account.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029242857', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 12804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1675809857}
review:
First of all, i'll add a proper and lengthy review anytime soon,.. I barely scratched the surface of what this deep and challenging card game has to offer and i really want to give all you guys, my honest impression about everything this game has to offer, especially as soon as i'm confident knowing plenty about and having played the game thoroughly enough before doing so.. 

However, i have a couple of card playing friends on Steam here which i bet would really like to get their minds into this one too.
The community for this game is really great, friendly and helpful and tbh they did an amazing job as to explain some key elements to me before i was actually convinced that purchasing the game would be something i wouldn't likely regret..
Thankfully i took a leap of faith (with the help of some newly made friends) and 5 hours in, i can't say i've regretted it one moment since.

The narrative voice acting is really nice (like The Lord Of The Rings basically) and the graphics and overall design quality is pretty pleasing as well (please note: I never played any games like this one, like Heartstone or whatever..) so for me personally speaking, i couldn't be happier about how it all looks, sounds and behaves really.. I'm just a sucker for LOTR, i confess! 
So, my friends who're watching this "pre-review" i hope you will put this game on top of your wanted list soon too because you know me, if i like it, you'll likely do too. 

One additional note: The game is no longer free to play (i didn't even know about that it was before anyway) and it's still in Early Access, so there are some bugs and changes bound to happen (although i haven't seen any so far, so i'm keeping my fingers crossed) No Jinxing!!! 
Anyway, i'm very pleased for buying the game and i'm already learning a few things the hard way now, which keeps me pushing myself to try harder.. Even after making many mistakes and believe me, you'll make plenty of those too because as i mentioned above, it's a deep and challenging game, yet the greater rewards are always there for the taking whenever you succeed...

author: {'steamid': '76561198059588400', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1560171073}
review:
Pour les personnes qui affirment que le jeu est très différent du jeu de carte IRL il faut savoir que c'est en réalité faux. Les tours de jeu ne sont pas découpés comme le jeu original et les mécaniques ne sont pas les même mais ici tout est agencé pour que le résultat soit quasiment le même. 

De plus s'agissant d'un early access il est important de noter que ce jeu va être sujet à de nombreux changements, mécaniques, de contenu et graphiques. 

Je vais lister les mécaniques qui changent par rapport au jeu digital pour que les joueurs sachent à quoi s'attendre : 

- Déjà le système de voyage est différent et simplifié. Vous n'avez pas de cartes "lieux" à explorer et ils ne vous retardent pas dans la poursuite de la quête. En fait il n'y a pas de cartes lieux du tout (remettant en cause l'existence des cartes notamment naines du jeu digital qui pouvaient accelerer ce genre d'exploration). A le place vous "voyagez" après avoir franchit les 3 (ou plus) étapes de quête qui sont retranscrites dans le jeu. 

- Le système de menace est toujours là et on perd toujours à 50 mais les ennemis dans la "zone de cheminement" (qui n'est pas représentée c'est juste le terrain) ne génère plus de menace et n'ont plus de valeur de menace. A la place la menace est augmentée par des sorte de cartes evenements côté sauron. D'ailleurs il y a maintenant des paliers de menace qui génèrent des évenements négatifs si vous la menace les atteint. 

- PAS DE CARTE OMBRE (ce qui je trouve enlève beaucoup de défi pour les combats)

- Certains personnages qui n'étaient pas héros dans le jeu digital le deviennent. 

- Le combat et la mise en jeu des personnage se fait à la même phase, qui est gérée en tour par tour : Jouer une carte vous coûte une action --> c'est au tour de l'adversaire de jouer --> jouez une carte ou attaquez/avancez dans la quête, etc ... 

Il y a pas mal de choses à faire le contenu à l'air conséquent contrairement à ce que beaucoup d'autres disent. IMPORTANT : Le système de multijoueur ne vous permet de jouer qu'avec vos amis, vous ne pouvez pas rejoindre la partie d'un inconnu. 
Conclusion c'est un jeu différent mais avec quelques ressemblances avec le jeu digital, ne vous attendez pas à jouer au même jeu mais ca peut bien vous plaire. (PS : la narration est géniale et les décors sont pas mauvais du tout).

author: {'steamid': '76561197961586350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1710509423}
review:
Great fun!

Rules are different from the physical LCG (concepts are very similar, yet executed differently), however they still feel very close to the original and make for a great digital experience! 

Coop is a lot of fun, too. Coming from a 3 player physical LCG group, I'd love to see more than 2 player coop, however I don't see how that can be done properly without running out of space to display cards.

Deck-building and tinkering is as engaging as in the physical game, having the option for alternate artwork is a very nice personalisation option (though locked behind in-game currency).

Unlock rewards and time spend to earn currency feel fair and engaging.

Overall a great experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007551571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1662561802}
review:
Un peu plus simple dans son approche que le LCG physique, il reste agréable à jouer avec un peu de challenge si vous augmentez le niveau de difficulté. Un peu de deckbuilding suivant les situations auxquelles vous êtes confrontés et les différents scénarios mais la plupart peuvent se réaliser en mode histoire pour débloquer les bonus pour chaque héros avec n'importe quel deck (je veux dire par là en combinaison de héros).
Un gros bémol tout de même et qui vaut sa petite attention, je trouve le jeu très cher par rapport au contenu. Le prix du jeu de base soit, vous avez (pour le moment) 1 campagne de 5 scénar, 2 défis et un tutoriel. Par contre si vous voulez la 2ème campagne (dc une nouvelle suite de 5 scénar) il faut payer 10€, et à priori cela sera comme çà pour chaque nouvelle campagne. Cela fait un peu cher le contenu à mes yeux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256736699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1688527751}
review: I knew this would happen. tons of micro transactions, and absolutely nothing like the physical copy. From day 1 asmodee said it wouldn't be a faithful adaptation, but I didn't expect it to be this bad or for the company to be soooo greedy. Honestly the quality just isn't there. The brain teaser puzzle box that exersized my brain like the physical copy did isn't there. The game is monotonous and does not strategically challenge the brain. Yes it's overly hard but that's not because the puzzle of solving and defeating the encounter "Sauron" deck is there. It's because the developers purposely made the quests over difficult so if by random chance you won you might feel accomplished if your an idiot. Another thing is the quests lasts a very short time. I'm talking 15-25 minutes top. The physical copy could last as long as an hour. Not impressed, stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013849180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1565602637}
review:
I love LOTR world, also the physical LCG card games from FFG. They make a digital game, I saw it and I had a doubt on it. Now I'm playing 2 tutorial quests and I think they did a good job. Artworks still the best, LOTR world immerse, good AI and I realy love the voice acting for every quest and also in game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970649786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1565521361}
review: I appreciate the adaptation of the rule set of the actual card game because it's frankly beyond my patience.  I also appreciate the difficulty level scaling because again, the way FFG/FFI wants me to play the game is beyond my patience.  What I want is a narrative card adventure set in the LotR universe with familiar characters and lore that isn't gonna bait me to grind or spend money for better cards, but I *will* spend money on more story.  I appreciate the artwork and the writing and the voice acting so much.  It's very involving, much better than my gaming groups reading of the card text.  That's what I'm paying for.  A better interpretation of the game than I can do.  But don't turn it into a cash grab.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031233329', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1530, 'last_played': 1573848792}
review:
I still don't understand why the game doesn't follow the Tabletop rules, why the devs decided to make a dumb down version of an amazing game. So much wasted potential.

Nonetheless it's still an ok game worth your time, but not your money, and it's definitely not as good as the original card game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011423551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5844, 'last_played': 1673726929}
review:
Very enjoyable game with a lot of unique mechanics. This is the best PvE card game I've played, and the co-op mode is a blast. The amount of deck-building synergy you can design with other players is great.

The developers are very open about their work, and monitor feedback closely. As of the time of this review, they do regular live streams showcasing what they've been working on, and responding to player feedback.

If these things sound interesting, I would recommend you try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299653087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1653846278}
review:
[h1] 1st review: After 7 hours of gameplay[/h1]

The game is really nice. I was a little bit afraid that my old laptop won't launch it but works like a charm on low graphics and the game still looks good.

I have the physical card game at home. The two games are somewhat similar altough they have real differences. I find the digital version somewhat easier and more balanced. The threat management, the questing, and the fighting is also different but not worse. It also has different quests than the physical LCG. This digital version has three difficulty options, too but with better names (narrative mode instead of easy mode). 

EDIT: There are no "locations" in this digital version - at least not like those in the physical one. I hope they will add them later in the game in some form because they can make the LOTR feeling much better. In the digital version there are "obstacles" instead of locations.

It's also cheaper and therefore you are able to have more content in my opinion and you can also obtain cards with in-game currency which you get by doing scenarios (playing). You can see what you buy so it's not like Hearthstone and other card games. Also, since it's digital you can buy the game anywhere in the world, unlike the physical version which is really hard to obtain in some places (I mean the expansions).

The tutorial is very friendly and tells you the mechanics quite well. I enjoy replaying missions and getting new cards. The developers make a good job: they are listening to the feedbacks and also making new scenarios.

This game has a great future and I hope it stays this way. I'll edit this review after playing more.

[h1] After 12.5 hours of gameplay[/h1]

I did find a very annoying bug. I had to escape during a quest and when I wished to continue the saved game, after the round during the "upkeep" phase "an error happened with the server" and the game froze in the upkeep phase so I couldn't continue playing. It was annoying since the quests take a lot of time, and it was the final encounter...

author: {'steamid': '76561198074113072', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1605809994}
review:
Altes Review vor der Veränderung:
Ein erbärmliches Produkt, welches versucht ein tiefes Kartenspiel mit der Leichtherzigkeit eines Hearthstones zu verbinden, auf voller Linie scheitert und es schafft niemandem zu gefallen. Gierige Geschäftspraktika wie DLC im Early Access mit denen man noch mal extra berappen muss um alle Karten des Spieles zu haben (Bei einem so schon erbärmlich kleinen Kartenpool) zerschießen auch den letzten Spielspaß. Und Spielspaß den hätte man vielleicht haben können wenn das Spiel überhaupt funktionieren würde. Regelmäßige Serverabstürze die zum Spielstandverlust bei Quests von manchmal einer Stunde Spielzeit führen und Tage an denen der Server schlicht überhaupt nicht geht machen diesen Müll grenzwertig unspielbar. Eine Beleidigung der Herr der Ringe Lizenz.

Nach einigen Veränderungen und vor allem einem Wechsel des Entwicklers hat sich die Qualität des Spiels deutlich gebessert.
Die DLC sind nun alle im Hauptspiel enthalten, die Serverabstürze und Bugs selterner und durch ein solides Speichersystem weniger frustrierend, der Kartenpool is angemessen groß so das zumindest annährend genügend Abwechslung aufkommt.

Nun eine generelle Kaufempfehlung für Leute die Herr der Ringe oder Kartenspielen etwas abgewinnen können, obwohl vieles am Spiel immer noch archaisch ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993961662', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1558273786}
review:
Firstly, although this game is somewhat altered (simplified) from the physical LCG, I would like to start by saying that, mechanistically, this is an excellent and fun game.

However - and I appreciate this is still early access - the game is completely undermined by the client software. Functionally, it runs very poorly, with severe lag and frame drops, with very bad responsiveness - often having to click on cards multiple times to get any response, sometime leading to the wrong actions being taken. Secondly, for reasons unknown in a PvE game, a continuous connection to the game servers is required, and if this is lost your game ends and you are dumped back to the main menu.

For both these reasons, and various unexplained softlocks, I was unable to even complete the tutorial quests.

Of course, much of this may be fixed once it comes out of early access. But fundamentally the client UI design is poorly thought through, with basic functionality like having to right-click to view card details so far behind the kind of experience you expect from modern games. Secondly, the always-online requirement is an incredibly poor design decision.

So, overall, a faithful adaptation of an extremely enjoyable LCG sadly completely undermined by a dated and unresponsive client framework that needs to be sent back to the firey pits from whence it was forged.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026979687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1581195894}
review:
After not playing since February, I tried the Tutorial and found out that there still isn't a save function for this game!

I mean really, still!

This along with a U.I. that is horrible & immensely frustrating to perform in game actions with, continues to make me glad I haven't spent anymore time or money on this game. It's a shame really because the card game is outstanding. This is just another sorry excuse for digital versions of card & boardgames that for the most part, fail miserably in recreating the spirit and functionality that made those games so much fun and easy to learn & play.

I wish I could completely delete this title, even though I spent $8 when it first was offered, as I'm done with this title. It's just not worth the time and aggravation!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197984256179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1633900790}
review:
So, let's start with the fact that I like the game

Best not to think you are buying the same LCG as the physical game. It is not the same. If you accept that and approach the experience without these preconceptions, then you should enjoy it as a Middle Earth fan

It is different in mechanics but very similar in theme and lore
The voice acting is good and the art is great
The turn-taking means a different approach is needed from the other version - there is not a summon - quest - encounter phase process - each turn you can play a card, attack, quest, use powers, etc
The deck building is different as you do not gain different colours of "mana" to summon cards; instead the heroes' spheres just determine which colour of cards can be in your deck
I can beat the game at Narrative difficulty fairly easily but it gets much harder after that

Value for money is good: two long campaigns so far plus two encounters. There is more to come as development continues BUT charging for DLC whilst it's still early access is not on
UPDATE - since leaving EA, existing owners got upgraded to the definitive edition, gaining the first 2 DLC - a good move!

In the end, not everyone will feel happy with the game - that's what the reviews indicate - If you're thinking of buying it then know it is a DIFFERENT game to the physical one. Do NOT expect the same product. However, the Tolkien feel and theme remain strong and that is what should draw you to the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198126712589', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1555051398}
review:
So I tried out The Lord of The Rings: Living Card Game digital version and i was very disapointed. I played the card game and this game even in its early state has nothing in common with the real card game in terms of gameplay. There is no clear line how the phases work (quest, travel,encounter,combat...). The game looks like Heartstone, the game feels like heartstone and it plays like heartstone more than the original LCG. If someone is making a digital version of a board game/card game at least try to make it as close to the original thing as possible. Even the deck building aspect is limited and some cards have their text changed....disappointment.

The only thing that i found great about the game was the voice acted story reading. 

Not worth the mony spend, sorry. 
I do not recomment at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992269298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1598028456}

Currently I nearly exclusively play it co-op with a friend and it's a great experience, a nice mix of quests and so far it's been fantastic and well worth the money!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006004091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1040, 'last_played': 1603491590}
review:
I love card games, paper and digital. And I certainly have a soft spot for LCG's from FFG. I love the model, and I can't eait till it kicks in on the digital version.

2 things that make me give this a thumbs up: First, the developers are very active. They are addressing key issues and are improving the game week after week. They are not afraid to change core gameplay mechanics, or their pricing model. Bugs get squashed, developers interact and the game gets new content. 

It's early access, and that's very visible here. But I've seen this game improve so much over the past half year or so. The following gameplay update will add even more ways to play, distancing away from hoe they handle score is a great thing for deck variety.

My second reason, thr game itself is great. It received a lot of sass for not being 100% digital, while I agree on some points, I think taht giving this system a fair shot was worth it. 


Imho, this game needs 2 things: Content, content, content. In the paper world, a new pack gets released every 3-4 weeks or so, this is an absolute MUST. iI don't feel like 10 bucks / pack is the way to go, but that's not up to me

And players / matchmaking. Not a lot of people play, that's a shame. Hopefuly with time and proper marketing once everything is polished, we can matchmake into games and build decks tailored go not playing solo.

I like it, and there's potential here to really love it. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030983876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1650824574}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013146169', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1596226867}
review: While the fact that its a terrible re-imagined implementation of the amazing Lord of the Rings The Living Card game can be overlooked, this game on its own merits lacks in pretty much every area barring the visual and setting appeal.  The tactical game is shallow, deck building extremely limited and the adventure packs extremely short, especially if you consider they are going to charge 10 Euro per pack (You guys are out of your damn mind!).  As a free to play game there might have been something worth fiddling about with but at this price cost this game does not carry its weight at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993651845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1550, 'last_played': 1581273746}
review:
I can sincerely recommend this game to any paper Lord of The Rings LCG lover. 
For newer players this game might be quite challenging to play (paper game IS very challenging too). They have new tutorial campaign in the works which should make acquaintance with game much more enjoyable. So one of possibilities to have positive experience - is to wait till they release it. Another thing: coop is reported as being significantly easy than solo, so campaign can be most probably won even having little to no experience relatively fast

So for those who did enjoy physical one: the game feels enough different to be fresh, while retains quite some similarities to have pull necessary strings. I found it deep enough even in the stage of early access. To name a few similarities and differences:
Some similarities:
1. from the start you have 3 heroes taken out of 4 different spheres
2. your hero spheres define what cards you can take
3. you have indirect form of quest phase
4. both are quite difficult (only playing on Challenging difficulty though)
5. sphere identity is more or less preserved
6. art is reused but that's a good thing. Also familiar pieces of art when in full screen mode (when narration happens there are static screens taken from physical card art) reveal shocking amount of details I missed while looked on cards

Some differences:
1. Resources and costs are not connected to spheres. So having 2 Lore 1 spirit hero you can cast 3 cost spirit card turn one
2. There are no separate encounter/quest/etc phases just alternating activations between you and Sauron 
3. Threat meter generates negative events upon reaching certain threat thresholds 
4. Fate meter generates positive events when consumed. It is generated by char willpower (this replaces questing)

While game is still in early access and has bugs I already had great fun. Developers seem to be quite community oriented. The react to bug reports as well to discussion post and strive to provide a meaningful info on what they are currently doing every week.

So to reiterate: for all who enjoy paper one - I can already recommend. For those new to the game - I would wait for tutorial or play coop for better experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988561930', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1611290422}
review:
The game loses connection with the server and then fails to reconnect, forcing you to exit the game, but there is no save functionality so if this happens in the middle of a quest, you will lose all progress.

After 6 hours of play and over 4 attempts at the first quest, I have been disconnected everytime I play, without being able to complete even one quest.  I reported the bug only to see this issue has been reported multiple times without response or correction by the developers.  The game looks promising but is unplayable in its current state.

Not recommended for EA

author: {'steamid': '76561198003048459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1577117008}
review: Not a complete game. For 16$ I was really expecting more content, not just a taste. In 7 hours you have completed the initial campaign and the rest of the time you spend in multiplayer, waiting for someone to show up and play with you the same quests as single player. When the game is out of early access I guess there will be more campaigns to buy (there is one already), but that just means that the full game will be kinda pricey. Not a bad game, if you dont mind paying a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984211717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 4273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2417, 'last_played': 1603371194}
review:
แม้จะมีชื่อเดียวกัน  แต่ “The Lord of the Rings: Living Card Game” ฉบับเกมกระดานกับดิจิตอลนั้นก็ไม่เหมือนกัน  โดยตัวดิจิตอลที่เรากำลังกล่าวถึงกันอยู่นี้มีความเรียบง่ายมากกว่าและใกล้เคียงกับการเป็น Hearthstone Clone มากกว่าที่จะเหมือนต้นฉบับของมัน  อีกทั้งเมื่อตอนที่ตัวเกมเพิ่งจะเปิด EA ใหม่ ๆ  มันก็มีปัญหามากมายเกินกว่าจะนับ  ดังนั้นผมจึงหายหน้าไปจากเกมหลายเดือนเพราะรู้สึกเพลียกับมันและเพิ่งจะกลับมาลองหยิบจับอีกครั้งตอนที่ตัวเกมออกภาคเสริม The Shadow’s Fall  (เป็นอิทธิพลจากฮีโร่ใหม่ที่มีให้เลือกใช้ในภาคเสริมอย่างกลอร์ฟินเดล)

ดูเหมือนว่า LotR LCG จะเป็นหนึ่งในไม่กี่เกมที่ใช้ช่วงเวลาการเป็น EA ได้อย่างคุ้มค่า  เพราะปัญหาทั้งหลายแหล่ที่ตัวผมเองเคยได้เผชิญในช่วงที่เกมเพิ่งจะเปิดให้ทดลองนั้นได้รับการแก้ไขเรียบร้อยเกือบจะทั้งหมด  และเมื่อมีการ์ดให้เลือกใช้เยอะขึ้น  ความเฉียบของ Gameplay จึงเริ่มที่จะเห็นได้ชัดขึ้น

LotR LCG ไม่ใช่เกมที่ผู้เล่นสองฝ่ายจะต้องมาแข่งกัน  แต่ผู้เล่นจะได้รับบทเป็นเหล่าฮีโร่ในจักรวาลของลุงโทลคีน (อารากอน กลอร์ฟินเดล ดาอิน ฯลฯ) เพื่อที่จะรับมือกับเซารอนและสมุน  ตัวเกมนั้นให้อารมณ์คล้ายกันกับการเล่น RPG แบบ Tabletop ที่คุณจะต้องใช้ความสามารถของการ์ดเพื่อเอาชนะศัตรูและแก้ไขสถานการณ์ต่าง ๆ

แม้ดูแค่เพียงผ่าน  ตัวเกมอาจจะแลดูคล้ายกับ Hearthstone (ซึ่งก็เหมือนจริง ๆ โดยเฉพาะในส่วนของ Combat)  แต่จุดที่ต่างก็คือชัยชนะของคุณไม่ได้มาจากการไล่ตีศัตรูอย่างบ้าคลั่งเพียงเท่านั้น  ฮีโร่และการ์ดที่คุณมีนั้นจะถูกแบ่งเป็น 4 สายและแต่ละสายนั้นก็จะมีจุดเด่นและเอกลักษณ์เฉพาะอันต่างกัน  คุณสามารถที่จะใช้การ์ดในสาย Lore เพื่อรักษาตัวเอง  สาย Leadership เพื่อป้องกัน  สาย Tactical เพื่อต่อสู้ และสาย Spirit เพื่อหยุดศัตรูและหลบเลี่ยงจากเซารอนและเหตุการณ์อันไม่พึงประสงค์  คุณจำเป็นที่จะต้องใช้การ์ดจาก 4 สายนี้มาผสมเข้าด้วยกันเป็น Deck และนำไปใช้เล่นกับ Campaign ของเกมที่มี GM คือ AI  (ไม่ต้องห่วงไปว่า AI จะโง่จนคุณสามารถจะเอาชนะได้ง่าย ๆ  ในความยากระดับสูง  พวกมันฉลาดพอที่จะทำให้ชีวิตของพวกเรายากลำบากได้ไม่น้อยแม้แต่สำหรับชาว Strategy โดยกำเนิดเช่นผม)

ในช่วงชั่วโมงแรก ๆ คุณอาจจะสัมผัสได้ว่าเกมมันช่างยากชะมัดและเกมก็เน้นไปที่ Combat ค่อนข้างหนัก  แต่เมื่อคุณเริ่มที่จะเรียนรู้ Trick เกี่ยวกับการเล่นกับ Guard, Terror, Restore และ Event เฉพาะในแต่ละพื้นที่ของ Campaign  คุณก็จะพบว่าเกมนั้นง่ายและมีความซับซ้อนมากกว่าที่เห็นมาก  ถ้าคุณเป็นคนชอบเกมแนว Strategy ที่ฮาร์ดคอร์อยู่พอตัว  เกมนี้ก็คงจะถูกใจคุณเป็นอย่างมาก  (กระนั้นผมก็ไม่คิดว่ามันจะเหมาะกับคนเล่นการ์ดสาย Casual โดยทั่วไปสักเท่าใดนัก)

และถึงแม้การจ่ายเงินจริงเพื่อซื้อ Expansions (ที่มาพร้อมกับการ์ดและ Campaign) ออกจะฟังดูไม่เข้าท่าสักเท่าใดนักสำหรับสายฟรี  แต่ส่วนตัวผมเองรู้สึกพอใจมากกับมัน  เพราะอย่างน้อยสิ่งที่คุณได้รับกลับมาก็คือของที่คุณต้องการจะได้จริง ๆ ไม่ต้องไปลุ้นสุ่มเอาแบบระบบกาชา  สรุปแล้วก็คือตัวเกมนั้นอาจจะไม่ถูกใจสายฟรี  แต่หลาย ๆ คนที่พอจะมีทุนอยู่บ้าง  สิ่งที่คุณจะได้รับนั้นก็จัดได้ว่าคุ้มกับเงินที่คุณจ่าย (การ์ดใน Expansions ช่วยเปิดตัวเลือกใหม่ ๆ ให้แก่คุณได้เยอะมากและ Campaign ก็เป็นสิ่งที่คุณสามารถที่จะเวียนกลับไปเล่นเพื่อ Valor Points และลอง Deck ใหม่ ๆ ได้หลายรอบมาก ๆ)

ณ ขณะที่เขียนบทวิจารณ์นี้  ตัวเกมอาจจะอยู่ในช่วง EA  แต่ส่วนตัวผมเองก็ออกจะพอใจในทิศทางที่เกมกำลังดำเนินไปมาก ๆ  และ (ในความเห็นของผม) คงจะดีกว่านี้มากถ้าตัวเกมเลือกที่จะเปลี่ยนไปใช้กรอบการ์ดแบบอื่นที่ไม่ใช่รูปไข่ (ผมว่ากรอบการ์ดแบบ MTG Arena ก็สวยดีนะ)

++ เกมการ์ดที่เน้นใช้กลยุทธ์มากกว่าการสุ่มและไล่ตีอย่างบ้าคลั่ง
+ คุณได้ในสิ่งที่คุณจ่าย  ไม่ใช่กาชา
+ ภาพของการ์ดแต่ละใบงามมาก ๆ และรายละเอียดในเกมนั้นก็อ้างอิงถึงหนังสือเป็นหลัก  ไม่ใช่จากภาพยนตร์ (ถ้าผมเข้าใจไม่ผิดจากชื่อ  มีการ์ดบางใบที่ถูกวาดโดยคนไทยด้วยละ)
-- กรอบการ์ดรูปไข่สุดอัปลักษณ์ที่ถูกมาใช้เพื่อเกาะกระแสการ์ดดิจิตอลกระแสหลักอย่าง Hearthstone
+/- ปัญหาทางเทคนิคบางประการ (ที่มักจะเจอหลังอัพเดท)  แต่ก็มักจะถูกแก้ไขโดยรวดเร็วโดยทีมพัฒนาเมื่อได้รับแจ้ง (ทีมพัฒนาขยันและใส่ใจในงานมาก  หรืออย่างน้อยก็ในช่วง EA นี้)

หมายเหตุ: ถ้าคุณชอบอ่านบทวิจารณ์นี้ คุณก็อาจจะชอบเพจนี้ >>

author: {'steamid': '76561197977498611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1612550998}
review:
I so wanted to love this game, but I absolutely hate it.  I love the original LotR LCG and despite it being rock hard in places it's a game where I usually feel that if I failed it's because I made a mistake. I also love deck-building games in general, both physical and digital and spend a huge amount of time playing them.  I'm also a professional game designer and when I'm playing games I can usually see why developers have chosen a particular path or why some things might look unbalanced at first glance.

Now having said all that, to me there is one particular core problem with this implementation of the LCG that underpins everything else.  A lot of people complain about the difficulty - and there is definitely an issue there - but again I think that also stems from the decision to take a game that is built around being able to play your entire turn in one go (allowing you to accomplish a number of things, synergise and leverage card powers, and leave your play area in a solid state for the enemy to try and break down) and turn it into a one-action-each game that plays like Hearthstone.

Now I really like the gameplay in Hearthstone (though I'm not a fan of how much you have to pay to stay competitive - but that's another story) but Hearthstone was built around that gameplay model from the ground up.  Its mechanics, its characters, their abilities, are all designed with that 'you go - I go' alternating action model in mind.  LotR LCG and its mechanics were never designed to work like that, and it feels very much like the developers have tried to keep enough of the original cards and their abilities to try and appease the card game players, but change what they had to in order to make it play like Hearthstone and appeal to those players - and what you're left with is a muddy mess of mechanics that is neither one thing nor the other.  When I compare the balance and mechanics in this game to something like, say, Slay the Spire, there's no comparison in terms of the depth of strategy between them.  Slay the Spire is an incredibly RNG-driven game, and you would expect it to be much harder to put together winning strategies or plan ahead to try and pull off a really cool combo, but in truth it's far more forgiving in terms of its strategic elements than this adaptation of LotR LCG.

I really can't see me ever going back to this game.  Playing it made me want to go back and play the card game again, and it made me want to play Hearthstone again, but this collision of two radically different game mechanics ideologies is just a bottomless pool of frustration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185139329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2027, 'last_played': 1595686984}

author: {'steamid': '76561198201263382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1585745904}
review:
[h1] A story-focused Digital Card Game with great potential [/h1]

UPDATE May 29th: 
The game received a huge overhaul and hence i have to revise my initial statement about the game. Many things of the game have improved immensly, including:
[*] a full-fledged tutorial that deserves its name; they also included a story with it and you get a new quest to play for free
[*] the reward system has greatly improved with higher replayability and versatility
[*] thanks to the new reward system, you acquire the ingame resource to buy cards way easier than before which reduces grinding for fellowship (previously called valor points)
[*] coop has now two difficulty modes, easy and hard
[*] cosmetics have been added to the game which can be acquired via play (fellowship) or is part of the new reward system
[*] each hero now has a (sort of hidden) quest, which when completed gives a themed card, increasing replayability
[*] deckbuilding has been improved and new pre-build decks have been added after completing the tutorial
[*] a save function has been implemented, which saves your game automatically after completing each location; due to the fact that a play session can take between 20-30 minutes and an hour this is a great addition if you have not much time
[*] and many other tweaks, including the delay of sauron mentioned in my initial review

It is evident, that the developers took the player feedback to heart and it is great to see a developer that listens to their community. Furthermore, they actually delivered exactly as announced unlike before (and are more careful now when giving out a release date), hence they seem to be learning from their mistakes.

FINAL VERDICT:
 This game is now very close to were it should be, hence i can  definitely recommend this game. The one thing that needs improvement is variety, variety of cards and quests to play. But this will take time and for a new game this is just a natural thing. I haven't encountered any major bugs or other issues, but I've been told that others have. So if you want to stay on the safe side, wait for full release, otherwise there is no excuse anymore. This game is a great experience for fans of Lord of the Rings and digital card games that offer a well told cooperative and solo experience.

TL;DR: After its last patch, a great many things have improved (including tutorial, deckbuilding, difficulty, coop experience and a save function among other things) and it is now a hidden gem among digital card games. Definitely recommended!

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
I thought hard about giving this game a recommendation or not. I decided not to, because of the current state of the game. First the good part:
[list] [*] The story is told well, the speakers are great.
        [*] The mechanics are more indepth than Hearthstone or any of their follow-ups.
        [*] The randomness of the mechanics is very low, great for strategic play.
        [*] No random card boster packs. Everything you earn or buy is set from the beginning. You know what you buy (or earn).
       [*] 3 difficulty level (easy, normal and hard) for each playstyle
       [*] AI behaves rather intelligent, makes fun to play against opponent
       [*] board graphics and graphics of the cards look beautiful
       [*] it's Lord of the Rings!
       [*] it is focused on single-player experience, which is rare for a DCG
       [*] cooperative mode
       [*] the developers are very transparent what they are working on and what's coming next to the game with a weekly wrap-up on steam and a twitch stream

 and now the cons:
       [*] the overall difficulty level is too high, the devs have acknowledged that and are working on it...
       [*] ...but the overall pace of development is far too slow. let me give you an example. the 2nd expansion should have been released in early january but got postponed to "a later week" and eventually got released on march 12th...
      [*] coop got released but only in one difficulty level
      [*] since a recent update, the AI takes longer than before to make its turn and sometimes hangs for a few seconds before it starts to make its move
      [*] for 8 bucks (lowest founder pack) the game is worth the price, but i think for approx. 19$ it is too expensive, especially given the current state of the game.
[/list]

Personally, i have stopped playing at the moment, because for me as a casual player even the lowest difficulty level is a bit too hard. In particular quest 4 of the first campaign. I will wait for a balance patch to deploy and see how the game fares giving time. I really wish the game all the best for the future and i hope it can overcome the obstacles currently present. I may give a "recommended" if things look better, but for now i can only recommend this game for players who enjoy a challenge.

TL;DR: If you are a hardcore player who enjoys a challenge and love The Lord of the Rings or digital card games focused on solo content, i recommend this game. If you are not, wait a little while until the game is more polished.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995790839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1552412448}
review:
I was so happy when I knew that the mythical Lord of The Rings LCG was coming to digital!
But this game is just a dumbed down version of the original. Where are the difficult decisions of the original game?

The designers lost their mind trying to mimic Hearthstone: what a wasted opportunity

author: {'steamid': '76561198028993803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2120, 'last_played': 1638504378}
review: Never reviewed a game before, but this one deserves some praise. The developers are very transparent with their changes and updates, which is refreshing in 2019. As for the game itself, it has a nice level of simplicity blended with depth. So far this game is in early access, but with the new expansion dropping on Tuesday, I highly recommend this game to anyone that is a fan of card games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109041832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1679021046}
review:
The game plays almost exactly like the actual card game. The graphs are great and it is a beta so you have a small tutorial that kinda shows you the ropes before setting you free. Now I consider myself a pretty good gamer. I'm no pro league but I've played about every computer card game out there and this one is tough, I mean really tough, The solo missions are a non stop wipe fest and the AI just pounds you with mobs, tosses your deck out, destroys your spells (events) cards constantly. I have replayed some quests dozens of times and each quest has like 5 parts so if you loose and you will alot, you get to start all over from the beginning.

I'm not saying the game isn't fun its just really hard and unforgiving. I have never played a card game where you have your butt handed too you so much. I like the challange, but one miss played card and it back to the drawing board. If you get frustrated easily I'd pass this one up otherwise jump on in the water is fine! Just very very wavy :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197982804269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1551118321}
review:
Here is my concern about this game that has a lot of things going for it (I love a lot of things about the art, sound etc..it "feels" great)
 Sauron is so favored that even if you painstakingly realize the best deck possible for a particular quest or whatever it's called, you will still lose 19 out of 20 times or worse. It's like dressing a up a poker game around the strategy that you must get a royal flush. Even then you could still lose it feels.

Now I have only been playing for a few days...but to be fair, there is nothing much to this game as far as content. Which is fine...It's in early release etc.....Fine with that sorta.......Not so much as well, but the point is iv'e played several CCG's.
I was 50 points shy of being a master level chess player when I stopped playing chess, so it's not like I am terrible at strategy games...I do not believe I am good at this game, certainly not yet, but I can see why it is hard. It is heavily slanted towards the PC. The game is not hard because it's AI is clever....It is hard because the cards Sauron has are just way better than you when you combine them with the meter on the right that brings brutal elements to Saron's favor.

Can you play it on easy? Yes.... How that means you will fair in multiplayer? Not good it seems. Making this feel like it's going to morph into a PAY TO WIN for the vast majority! Playing the same battles over and over again waiting for things to just work out just perfectly right sound like torture to me....Why would I pay for that? 

Having said all that I realize I may be missing something...I will also keep an interest in this game. But I suspect, or really fear, that this game is going to be like many strategy games I have wasted money on here on Steam because it made it's difficulty level just not fun to overcome.


Everything else about this game is wonderful. Too many times on Steam and on android or IOS games have wonderful qualities but are ruined by over the top cash grabs or artificial difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148387244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1574809257}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006756264', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 470, 'playtime_forever': 2710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1578322837}
review:
As an avid fan of an original tabletop LCG with hundreds of hours in it I was pretty sceptic after learning that it's not 100% accurate conversion. But it turns out it's even better than the original ! It's way more balanced and tactical now with all cheesy combos thrown out the window. UI is good, new rules work well and gameplay is still complex (maybe even more).
Good effin job !

author: {'steamid': '76561198015257044', 'num_games_owned': 1055, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1302, 'last_played': 1604867894}
review: I've heard that the physical version is better and this game sucks compared to it. I haven't played the physical version ever and I'm enjoying this one quite a lot. The COOP is definitely a nice addition. Can't wait for more content!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122634264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5252, 'last_played': 1574140815}
review:
Please note that most of the negative reviews of this game have been fixed, or they are uninformed and just plain wrong!  Please take the time to look into the game and find out how much it has to offer.

This is a great game already and has the potential to be even better.  The current pricing of the game is extremely fair and provides more hours worth of content for the money than many games, if you like trying all the heroes and deck building.  If all you want is to use the strongest deck possible that someone else made and just beat the game once and be done, then yes you will probably be disappointed.

The brilliance in the game currently is the scoring system and the reward (valor points) system used to purchase the additional cards.  The valor system rewards better play and using all the heroes, which gives motivation to play through the quests multiple times to get all the rewards for all of the heroes and learn more about the game and try new things.  It also allows you to earn a lot of valor quickly if you want to put in the work without giving away everything right away.  I think that a few more tweaks to the scoring could add even more and make it better as well.

It is difficult until you learn it, but what fun would it be if it wasn't somewhat challenging.  If you are struggling there is enough information in the steam community and on deckbuilding websites to get you over the hump.  I am not a card game expert i have casually played 2 other games like this one and I am figuring it out, my friend that i convinced to get the game is an expert at theses games has played almost all of them and has published decks that were the most popular and he likes the game and finds it fun and challenging.  It's starting to get a little easy for him but he is an expert.  Also, watch a video of someone playing, tempo, action economy and getting everything out of each round by using the buffs and special abilities properly is the key to this game.

As far as criticisms, the new multiplayer needs tuning.  It is brand new though and based on the past changes to the other parts of the game I am confident they will tune it.  The doubling of everything and the additional resources Sauron has makes it this long war of attrition that makes it take 4x as long as a single player game and makes you feel exhausted by the time you are done.  Multiplayer needs a way for it to be harder without being longer.   I still had fun but it needs tuning.

They already have new content coming out, and I can't wait.  I fully recommend this game it is fun and worth the money and its only in beta.

Val

author: {'steamid': '76561198422103188', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1633524598}
review:
Musím uznat,že prvně jsem si nemyslel,že by tato hra mohla být u mne oblíbená,ale po pár odehraných hodinách jsem změnil názor.Hra je podle mne na začátek dost obtížná,co se týká soubojů...orientace ve hře je suprová ( z mého pohledu ).. po pár odehraných hodinách musím říct,že začínáte hru prožívat,a tím se zlepšuje i vaše HERNÍ orientace,ve hře --) souboje vám přijdou i jednoduší ( chce to jen trošku věnování toho času )

Klady
+ tutorial ( herní návod) , dokonce si ho lze i opakovat.
+ dobrá orientace v herním menu a na soubojových polích.
+  celkem zajímavé charaktery a jejich ilustrace např. Tom Took,Bombadil atd.

Protiklady
- ve hře jsem zatím neobjevil žádný bug,drastický problém nebo herní nedostatek ( mám nahráno pár  hodin )

Můj názor 
- do hry bych časem přidal třeba více méně známých hrdinů např. Argeleb,Cirdan,Elendil a pod. ( možno ve hře jsou,těžko říct,zda ano tak se omlouvám)
- a nebo možnost rozšířit Deck ( balíček hraních karet ) ze 30 za 45.
Jen můj názor ale.
a hodnocení na závěř: hra je podle mého nezávislá,takže nebudete u toho sedět od rána do včera příkladem,tím pádem vás hra zabaví na více dní,týdnů a možno i měsíců.
za mne 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198156132748', 'num_games_owned': 1141, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1607796967}
review:
Für Causal-Gamer wie mich ungeeignet und ich besitze das Originalspiel samt etlicher Erweiterungen.

Kein vernünftiges Tutorial, bekloppte neue Spielmechaniken anstatt einfach das ordentliche LCG-Konzept vom Original zu übernehmen, zumal teilweise unlogisch, äußerst langwierig, unfair respektive ist kein einfacher Schwierigkeitsgrad einstellbar, für die über 40€, die ich hier investiert habe, habe ich Zugriff auf ca. 40 unterschiedliche Karten - lächerlich, keine Weiterentwicklung ersichtlich.

Alles in allem ein Scheiß-Spiel, da hätte ich mir für das Geld lieber echte Kartenpacks kaufen sollen und hätte gleichzeitig auch mehr Karten zur Verfügung (240 Karten/3 = 80 unterschiedliche) für eine gepflegte Solopartie.

Zumal ich mich sowieso frage, warum man nicht wirkliche Mehrspieler-LCGs digitalisiert hat.
Es bleibt ja nur noch Game of Thrones übrig.

Aber auch Arkham Horror böte sich für diese Plattform an, wenn man die Mechaniken denn beibehielte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198906524056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1622153143}
review: Adepte du JCE du même nom, je retrouve des sensations différentes mais tout aussi absorbantes. L'ambiance est superbe  et les défis à relever sont très bien équilibrés. C'est un véritable Deck Building avec un gain de temps de mise en place énorme. Les parties s'enchainent rapidement et les effets sont agréables. Et quel plaisir de retrouver les illustrations du jeu de carte initial. Bravo pour ce travail, vivement que le jeu sorte en version définitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004583352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 1582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1625025871}
review:
The developers REALLY care and love this game, because initially I baby raged about the game and as you can see, a developer responded to me, emailed me, and watched my stream on the game to show them how a complete newbie who isn't familiar with the real life card game saw it... and they made a beautiful tutorial. 

It's a great game. It always has been, and now that it let's people new to this learn how to play it's amazing. Buy this. Support the developers. It's great and the developers will listen to ALL your feedback.

Thank you devs for making this game. Well worth the price.

2/21/2021 update:

This game devs are amazing. 'they kept their promises and beyond. buy this game  to support   what every dev team should be like,'it's fun as heck too!!
developer_response:
Hello there,

We're sorry to hear that you feel this way, but this is actually the highest cost bundle (Mithril) that was previously available in the old multi-tiered monetization model that Lord of the Rings: Living Card Game used. There is now only a single tier payment of 15.99€ that provides you with access to the full core set of the game—you can learn more about what is included in this on the Steam Store page.

A swath of content is being added over time in the form of new cards and encounters, like the new cards announced here (https://steamcommunity.com/games/509580/announcements/detail/3535792899894096097) and the recent King of Carrion encounter. These will come at no extra charge to players. We will also be launching additional campaigns and other bonus DLC content which will be available for a small cost, like the Shadow's Fall campaign to be released soon.

In regards to the Dev team's passion and the tutorial, we have never wavered in our desire to make this the best Lord of the Rings game that we can and will continue to deliver quality content to the best of our ability! 

The tutorial is something that we are currently improving as well. We detailed our development roadmap in the below blog, so be sure to take a read if you want to know what is coming in the future!
https://steamcommunity.com/games/509580/announcements/detail/1689314410069762158

We hope that you'll give Lord of the Rings: Living Card Game another try and that you'll have fun enjoying all of the content that we are working to get into your hands!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027977874', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1549225875}
review: Having never played the physical card game I can only talk from my experience soley with the digital game. This game is a lot of fun, the initial learning spike wasn't too difficult and honestly losing/ learning how to overcome the difficult missions with different decks and playstyles is half the fun. I think at least as of now that the pricing model is also very reasonable buying only story campaigns and pre disclosed booster packs so you know exaclty what missions or cards you will recieve with each purchase. Your card collection can be further expanded with Valor Cards bought with in game currency earned for completeing missions and challanges. It is nice to play a CCG with out the annoyance of random chance 'lootcrates'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283630427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1604797766}

Sauron's treachery plays are too RNG, always leading to the worse scenario possible for the player. This is the most braindead cardgame I have ever played. And no, I'm not an inexperienced CCG player. I have almost 800hrs of game play in Duel Links and 100hrs of magic...

review:
Very nice game.
I bought one of the founder packs and had 1 adventure to play. Now i see i have another one by a new patch.
It does not give you a lot of play time. Because you can beat the adventure maybe in one day. But you can replay making a different deck, so maybe 2 or 3 replays per adventure.
But what it is is pretty fun and challenging enough.

I see that you can buy more packs to make new decks. So that adds replay value. Specially if you find the cards you have not enough to make the best deck.
