author: {'steamid': '76561197976729678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1597312045}
review:
After playing the campaign twice, once in normal and then in hard I have to admit that the game is ok, but has a lot of room for improvement. For now there are just a few cards, so not a lot of options for deckbuilding, and only one campaign with five missions that you have to repeat to get more valor points (in-game currency) to unlock more cards and in the future more missions. Let's see what more the game has to offer in the following weeks.

I don't like that you can play so little allies considering that most of the cards are allies (there is only room for 7 creatures, you start with 3 heroes and sometimes you get a special ally such as Smeagol or Bilbo, so only 3 or 4 allies can be in play at a time). Also the Sauron IA needs a rework as for now some decisions it takes are absurd (healing a creature already at full health or improving a creature low on health that is clearly going to die, for example).

I really love the LotR card game, but for now, this digital version is just ok. I hope it improves in the future and gets to be a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347650842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1604365967}
review:
Primeiramente, é preciso lembrar que estamos lidando com um jogo de acesso antecipado. Algo que deveria ser feito com todo jogo.

Na última semana, pude acompanhar uma melhora substancial do jogo em termos de correção de bugs e até da liberação da primeira campanha. O jogo, em si, é parecido com o jogo físico (que particularmente, gosto muito). Contudo, não é exatamente igual, mas isso não chega a ser um problema. Os bugs ainda existem, mas são mais raros, e agora, dia 07/09, houve uma melhoria muito necessária no custo de algumas cartas.

A minha única ressalva neste jogo é o grau de dificuldade das últimas missões; este é um jogo que fez fama por ser desafiador, mas em algumas missões, sinto um certo exagero. Nas últimas fases da primeira campanha, é extremamente difícil vencer na dificuldade normal com as cartas que nos são disponibilizadas. Para jogadores iniciantes, ou que não conhecem o jogo físico, isto pode ser bastante desencorajador.

Mesmo assim, as narrações entre missões são muito bem feitas, e as imagens de ilustração, bem escolhidas; isso consegue passar um clima e atmosfera bem interessante. A arte das cartas, no geral, é excelente.

De modo geral, se você é fã do jogo físico, de senhor dos anéis ou mesmo de RPG, recomendo este jogo, mesmo na situação atual em que se encontra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006830874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1559840346}

Because, we all know, the bugs may never be fixed and the game may never even launch.  I utterly regret putting any money into it at this phase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981010526', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1670068864}
review:
This game excited me at first because I'm currently in love with coop boardgames like Robinson Crusoe and the Arkham Horror lcg, both of which can be played solo.

(Keep in mind I never played the original lotr lcg.)

This game though is nothing like that, it feels more like Solo Heartstone. 
It's very much focused on fighting and feels very repetitive. 
The UI with the flashy animations makes the game potentially addictive though.

The valor system seems fine. You can grind it all out or pay smalls sums; I have to play more to figure out if the prices for cards and campaigns are correct or too high. 

It's good to kill a few hours, but I would not buy this again or spend more money to buy content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024928253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1833, 'last_played': 1585009776}
review:
This is almost definitely a better designed one-player game than the paper LCG was at its beginning.

The introductory card pool here is just about as tactically rich as it was in the paper LCG. You're still balancing health, quest progress, attack, defense, and resources as you attempt to survive a gauntlet of challenges and finish each scenario.

The only notable mechanic missing from the paper game is the Shadow cards dealt on enemy attacks; that, plus the fact that Sauron is now controlled by an AI, makes the challenges in each scenario feel less wild, more predictable. Depending on your taste, that's either a plus or a minus. I certainly have way fewer "bad beat" stories in this version of the game, for whatever that's worth.

On the other hand, there are welcome innovations in how the game tracks threat and handles excess questing power. 
In the paper game, threat controlled only whether certain enemies attacked. In this version, certain threat breakpoints unleash setbacks or new enemies that are more narratively driven. So you still feel good if you can "sneak" under those breakpoints by conserving threat, and the narrative bits help you feel more like you're playing through a story.
You are also allowed to "store" excess questing strength to use for mechanical bonuses later in the scenario; these also have little bits of narrative attached, and figuring out when and how to deploy the bonuses is now a large (and fun!) part of the game's strategy. 

These innovations also have the effect of helping to balance the different Hero factions, and where the paper LCG often felt like a series of puzzles that had to be solved by perfect hero and deck compositions, it feels like this game offers enough flexibility on Normal difficulty that most groups of heroes should be able to carefully pick their way through.

The presentation is certainly more streamlined than in the paper game, and that's something to be grateful for. No shuffling, no tokens, fewer fiddly rules interactions. And the economy is fine now that the first set of scenarios comes automatically unlocked -- I've had no problem getting my card pool to a point I feel comfortable with, even though I bought in at the lowest level.

Overall, this is a great game. I already feel like I've gotten my money's worth at 20 hours, and I suspect I'll hang in there for the long haul.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993594396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1680197119}
review: Despues de comprarlo y devolverlo por ver su precio abusivo, he vuelto a comprarlo debido a la decisión de liberar toda la primera campaña gratis, creo que es el camino correcto, recomendable para Tolkieneros aunque no le hace justicia al juego de cartas

author: {'steamid': '76561198106570126', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 5138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1856, 'last_played': 1662163199}
review:
El juego es una autentica maravilla
hay que decir que los comentarios negativos que estoy leyendo son por algun error en un early acces que ya han solucionado
otra cosa que vale la pena aclarar es que se puede avanzar tranquilamente en el juego sin hacer compras ya que distintos desafios diarios, fanalizar quest, batir tu record y que algun heroe lo complete al quest por primera vez te dan premio en una especie de dinero que luego te puedes gastar
la diversidad de heroes es muy grande y poco a poco le iras aprendiendo como usarlos a cada uno.Los enanos son muy fuertes y al equiparlos con armas aun mas, aragorn puede tener 2 acciones por mano, Arwen cura una vez por mano y asi cada uno tiene sus destrezas especiales
no se preocupen que hay pocas quest por el momento, las jugaran una y otra vez con el mismo mazo y luego apsaran a jugarla con otro mazo, son enviciantes
un 10/10 sin duda

author: {'steamid': '76561198002560969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1573, 'last_played': 1620821451}
review: I was a massive fan of the table top game and was hoping for a different experience with the online version, I'm glad FFI delivered this. The game has some similarities with the table top version but overall feels very different and unique. The fact this is online and has much simpler rules means that I will be able to get my mates into this where the physical nature and complexity of the tabletop version was a barrier for their entry. Totally happy with where the current micro transactions are at and I can safely say that while I have played through the starter campaign 4 times already and I am still thoroughly enjoying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076632409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1682105223}
review: I used to play the cards many years ago. Now I'm SO HAPPY that these guys decided to develop a computer version. I love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975929805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1644103028}
review: It's a bit early in the lifecycle of this one - we'll see how it evolves over time and what the eventual inclusion of Coop looks like, but for now it has a lot of promise.  As long as development continues on track this will shape up to be an excellent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986624324', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 2062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1658861157}
review:
Acompanhei o desenvolvimento deste jogo desde o início, assistindo todas as lives nas terças e quintas no twitch.
É basicamente o mesmo jogo físico card game que a Galápagos Jogos lançou no Brasil e fizeram o crime de descontinuar. Temos que deixar claro que esses bundles para compra são para quem quer ajudar a equipe de desenvolvimento neste acesso antecipado, mas o jogo será gratuito e como todo jogo gratuito tem que se manter de alguma forma. E com certeza eles vão vender aventuras e packs de cartas. Assim como acontece com o jogo físico atual.
Recomendo a todos que amam jogos de cartas e o melhor, quem ama jogos coop! O jogo vai ter essa modalidade no futuro bem próximo.
Coloco o The Lord of the Rings Living Card Game como o melhor jogo de cartas do steam ao lado do Pathfinder Adventure Card Game e o The Elder Scrolls Legends!

http://nerdone.blogspot.com/2019/12/the-lord-of-rings-adventure-card-game.html

author: {'steamid': '76561197993952481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3204, 'last_played': 1664633196}
review:
I have played the card game  and have four saga boxs and core set and really enjoy it and have been excited to try the steam version.

Of course it is a little different to the physical version as sauron plays using AI and the physical version you simply play what is written on the crads. If you want to play the physical game on a computer there are a few variants already to simply track your cards and tokens.

I have bought the shire bundle for around $6 and then added $10 to steam wallet to buy hero bundles etc and through play have most of the cards, which for $16 I think is good value.

I started off and really struggled to win any quests on easy using just the starter deck. But then I realised you can play guard on any hero or ally and that you can bank fate and play extra actions on the left of screen to do some good extras. Then the game really came into its own and really gives me the same buzz as the physical version and I have completed the entire campaign.

Having only one campaign has been quite useful though as I have been able to try several hero combinations and have learnt how they act differently. Also although there are not that many cards the deck size is only 30 so makes deck building easier.

Now I am really looking forward to some more quests to try the various decks on.

The devs really listen to the community and have sessions on tuesday and thursday and are very open.

If you are considering the game I would say a lot of the negative reviews were down to the game being not an exact copy of the physical game which although true needed to be to incorporate a AI and give a great PC experiance.

The other reason was the cost as apart from the first quest you had to pay for it and also earning valour reduced for a day, both of which were quickly changed by devs and now I believe are pretty good and allow peopple to earn useful amounts when playing.

So in summary the current state of the game is excellent and highly recommended and cannot wait for more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054201620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 21927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1938, 'last_played': 1578368627}
review:
In this review, I just want to encourage anyone looking over these to disregard any review done within days of the release.  Reviews that early clearly have not devoted the time it takes to make a complete analysis of this game.  Reviews coming later likely have the benefit of patch fixes as well as more play time.  Please review those in greater detail than earlier reviews.  Overall, this is still in early access!  Many features will be changed or fixed over time.

If you are looking for an exact model of the physical card game, please just go play that.  I don't know why you would ask for a complete mimic when you can just play the physical game or even play it on Table Top Simulator?  This version is its own game.  I doubt anyone wants an exact digital version of a game that had certain scenarios that could take up to 5 hours to play.

I have had a lot of fun with this.  You do not need anything more than the most basic pack to have fun.  Many of the good cards and heroes are in that.  Please play for yourself and I think you will be surprised.  Please also keep in mind that coop is coming soon!  I can only imagine this will make the game even more enjoyable.  Happy orc hunting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073556989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1589604506}
review: This game is great! While I've never played LOTR LCG before, I really enjoy both Arkhams Horror LCG and Warhammer Quest ACG.  This game is a great and easy way to enjoy a LCG.  I really hope Fantasy Flight also makes a Steam version for Akrham Horror! Highly recommended and seems to have excellent replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985766793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1580256299}
review:
As a long time fan of the physical LotR LCG, I was more than a little worried about the direction this digital version would go in. I'm pleased to report that, so far, all is well.
Sure, there are a lot of changes to core game mechanics which may not please purists of the physical game. But it does somehow "feel" as it should.......a digital reimagining of the physical game.

Considering that this game is still in EA, the level of polish on display is amazing. The graphic and sound design goes a long way towards conveying a "living" story.
Gameplay wise, it feels unique and is certainly NOT a Hearthstone clone (despite what screenshots might convey).

Probably the best aspect of the game, from my point of view, is the fact that it's NOT PVP.
I've seen a few uninformed reviewers complain about this fact, as if they've been hoodwinked by the developers, even though the physical LCG is single player/ co-op only, and FFI have been upfront about maintaining that focus.

A quick note on monitization and content: The developers have been open and honest right from the start about how this game will be monitized during EA, and that it is NOT the same as when the game finally launches.
On top of that, they've already listened to community feedback, and un-gated a lot more content at no extra cost when it became clear that they had initially been a little too frugal.

Overall, now that i've played the game, I'm far more optimistic about how it's shaping up. Sure it's still early days, and the developers will, not doubt, make many tweeks and changes along the way.
I'm sure not all those changes will be popular. But I'm not worried, as FFI have already shown their capacity to listen to community feedback, which is very welcome and not always commonplace in a FTP game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051514522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1598640301}
review: actually not so bad. very limited content so far but has massive potential with who is behind it. Really needs the content pipeline sped up. As in weekly updates. Limited cardpool and playable content so far but enjoyable and a taste for more. Someone needs to pull the finger out and open up more content and also multiplayer asap or they run the risk of this dying on its feet. Yes it is a hearthstone clone on first look, but it has enough nuances underneath to differentiate. If only FFG  pull the finger out quickly and make it more than an over priced demo, get on it asap

author: {'steamid': '76561198820856777', 'num_games_owned': 6, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1686496028}
review: This game is beyond my wildest imagination. FFI has done an incredible job with bringing Middle-Earth to the digital world. The cards and environments immerse the player in each quest and one does not simply build a great deck. Strategy is always at the forefront when dealing with Sauron and his tricksy minions. Dive into this excellent card game and enjoy the world of Tolkien coming to life before your eyes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004549521', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1576612094}
review:
Plutôt une bonne surprise. Je voulais prendre le jeu physique mais il y a tellement d'extensions maintenant que je suis découragé et donc je me suis naturellement porté vers cette version PC.

Le jeu est bien, le gameplay est assez classique pour ceux qui connaissent déjà d'autres jeux du même genre mais il existe tout de même quelques subtilités qui changent un peu et surtout LE + de ce jeu : il est prévu principalement pour le Solo.

J'ai personnellement hâte d'y jouer en français, ça devrait arriver prochainement et ça m'aidera encore + à apprécier. Je doute néanmoins que le doublage vocal soit en français également, il faudra probablement se contenter des textes, c'est toujours mieux que rien !

Si vous êtes fan de l'univers et que vous aimez ce style de jeu mais en avez marre des PvP contre des mecs qui sortent la CB pour gagner, ce jeu est fait pour vous !

author: {'steamid': '76561198013470134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1662297805}
review:
I think that that this game is really underrated. I played it for a while and I need to say that is really good solo card game. There is lot of more solo card games on steam with better rating, but there are no better....and this game is on Early Access still. Unfortunately lot of bad reviews comes from people who expecting standard hard-copy of "Lord of the Ring: The Card Game", which this game is not, but it not means it is a bad game.
Anyway, for me is the game really great. Has nice graphics, nice campaign with good story with nice audio speak. And it's challenging, you still have feel that you can make it better like last time, or is really easy to make a mistake where your hero or ally died but he had not to, if you did something else, etc...You need to think what to do each turn. 
As the game is on early access there is no much cards and so deckbuilding possibilities are really bounded. Also there are bugs. But is normal for early access, and I think when developers will continue in this way it can be really successful game.
And now the whole 1st. campaign is free!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123659905', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1587663805}
review: I also wanted to add that I'm disabled and I have to use a PC via dictation.  Many times developers create games that "takeover" an operating system, which means dictation no longer works.  This game doesn't do that, and I can do everything in the game pretty easily so kudos for that.  :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065682322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3704, 'last_played': 1708300090}
review:
Fantasy Flight, in 5 days, basically did:
- Answered +50 posts on Discussions
- Revamped their server system
- Streamed 3 times with Q&A rounds
- Gave quests for free for everyone
- Refunded currency spent ingame
- Buffed unbalanced key cards
- Fixed their daily system
- Released 3 patches
- Saved a stray cat.

It wasnt a perfect Early Access, but. If you like TCGs and LOTR, this is a safe bet :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198007788572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1603700631}

author: {'steamid': '76561198087349317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1559142456}
review: As a person in a country where physical copy is challenging and more times pricey to obtain, and the entry barrier is quite high considering all the cycles off the real LCG, this digital version is a welcoming and refreshing experience, deckbuilding is easy, the missions is immersive with terrific voiceacting.. this is an early access though, so dont expect to much at this very beginning, rather you should grow with the game, grow with the community and the developers

author: {'steamid': '76561198025459038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1658349486}
review:
[h1]Disclaimers:[/h1]
[olist]
[*] [b]Don't come here expecting a digital version of the tabletop LOTR: LCG [/b]... different games, the resemblances are:
   [list]
      [*] the card arts; 
      [*] card stats [i](cost, willpower, hp, atk)[/i] and spheres of influence
      [*] some names
      [*] the fact that both are PvE [i](questing games)[/i]  
      [*] threat meter [i](alternative loss condition)[/i]  
   [/list]
[*] Also, as of this review, the business model is a joke 
 [i](quest and card unlocks) - i'm sure that, given that most negative reviews touch this subject, it will be revised (well, it really should)[/i]
[/olist]

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Voice-Over
 [i](quest cutscenes and card sounds ; hoping that on release everything is fully VO)[/i]
[*] The Music / Soundtrack
 [i] (new / original for the game; very LOTRish) [/i]
[*] Card Arts and Visuals 
 [i] (some effects / visuals may still need some work, but overall pretty good) [/i]
[*] New Mechanics - Fate and Threat
 [i] (some new mechanics / stakes that improve replayability; actually enjoy the different gameplay quite a bit) [/i]
[*] New Quests / Plots 
[i](quite well written / immersive)[/i]
[*] CO-OP [i] (Early Access: waiting on that :P)[/i]
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*] [b]The Business Model [/b]
[*] Early Access: Some clumsy UI and missing Voice-Over / Sound-Effects
[*] Early Access: Some anoying bugs / crashes
[/list]


[h1] To the Publisher & Devs: [/h1]
[b] Turn this into an actual LCG [/b] 
[i](purchases to have all cards of expansions and/or complete quests)[/i] - don't expect people to spend €€€ on a random cards model, for a PvE game [i](really like the concept of the Palanthir, but it should be cosmetics, premiums upgrades (if any), and other non-gameplay elements only)[/i]
[i] (I bought the tabletop LCG Collector's Edition, i expected to have everything unlocked in this digital game... disapointed...) [/i]
Sincerely, a Card game Whale :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198028920651', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1619268097}
review: Fun Singleplayer card game with LOTR atmosphere and theme. Developers have responded quickly to feedback by removing timelocks for in-game rewards and  giving away first campaign for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011762444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1572401909}
review:
Really wanted to like this but it went from something that would have broad appeal to people who have played the REAL LCG as well as people who've never heard of the game to another micro-transaction laden cash grab.

Let's address the elephant in the room, this is in no way a recreation of the physical LCG. It shares some superficial characteristics like card names but that's as far as it goes. The mechanics have been completely changed, most cards have no abilities and the ones that do are extremely basic, there is simply nowhere near the level of depth in this game that you would expect considering it has been branded with the same name.

To cover another common point of discussion, yes, it looks VERY similar to Hearthstone and that is obviously be design. Unfortunately (if you don't like Hearthstone or wanted a game closer to the LCG) it also plays very similar to Hearthstone right down to the overpowered decks the AI gets to play with to make up for sub-par programming.

Speaking of overpowered, the developers recently did a 180 on their extremely poor monetization model by giving everyone access to the first campaign. Previously, you got ONE mission for free before having to spend real money to buy more. That equated to about 30 minutes of unique gameplay. Why they thought that was a good diea is beyond me, but by giving away the whole campaign they exposed another terrible decision. By the fourth mission, the difficulty spikes to the point where you have a very small chance of beating it without spending money on new cards. If you've played a free to play mobile game you know how this goes.

I would strongly suggest that anyone who is interested in this game wait until it is released and is free. Yes you will have to spend money to get more than a couple hours of gameplay but at least by then you will be able to make an informed decision about whether you want to spend money or not. Buying it now means your money is spent and judging by the reviews and Steam Charts ever declining player numbers, a lot of people have buyer's remorse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018495932', 'num_games_owned': 1073, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1644724077}
review:
I'm enjoying the game, but it is definitely Early Access.  If you aren't capable of coping with the baggage that comes with that, then just wait for the game to fully release as free to play.  I have had quite a few technical problems, some completely killing a hard fought quest right before completion.  The monetization is also still being tweaked and you will undoubtedly see reviews complaining about this.  You should also note though, that the developers have been quick to try to address issues and have already unlocked more of the game for 'free' (after the initial payment that gets you EA access) than initial released, as well as making some tweaks to try to improve this.  

If you can handle all of this, then I highly recommend the game.  There's not a huge amount of content at the moment, but what is there is incredibly fun when not bombed by a crash.  

It should also be mentioned (as many already have) that this is NOT the same game as the physical LOTR LCG.  In fact it probably has more differences than similarities, but the feelings of that game mostly remain.  The game is still a bit puzzly with deck building being the answer to the puzzles.  You still make choices as to whether you should focus on 'questing' or fighting at any given moment.  You still start with some heros, recruit allies, equip items, play events, struggle to keep your threat down, etc.  As for the changes, a lot of it is a simplification, but with added mechanisms on top to then throw complexity back in.  There are no longer different resources per sphere, Losing a hero no longer reduces your resources per turn.  Combat has been replaced with something a bit more hearthstoney.... etc.

There are some things I like better about the physical game and some things I like better about this game, but both are fun and probably shouldn't be compared 1 to 1... they are different experiences on different 'platforms'.

If you're a fan of the physical game, keep an open mind and give this a shot.  If you've never played the physical game, I'd recommend it over this at the current time, but possibly not after this becomes more polished and co-op is implemented.  If you hate the physical game, I'd base my recommendation on your opinion of games like hearthstone (if you like it, you might like this, if you hate it, then you'll probably hate this)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995839240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1574114795}
review:
I'm not a purist of the card game who believe that this game should be a 1:1 recreation of the card game. I was fine with changes made to make games go quicker and such. However, I have two big gripes about changes made to this iteration of the game. 

1- The threat meter is now just a timer. In the card game, strong enemies ignore you when you threat is low so taking weak heroes with low threat level and rushing the objective is a valid strategy. Since this doesn't apply here, just take the strongest hero 100% of the time.

2- Deckbuilding is made way shallower because the ressources are now generic. In the card game, ressources are tied to your heroes sphere. Meaning, if you have 3 tactics heroes, you get 3 tactics ressources per turn. Meaning you have to choose wether you want access to a big library of cards or if you want to be able to play costly cards in a sphere. Since ressources are generic, it is now better to pick heroes from 3 different spheres 100% of the time.

Right now the production value are low, the server is down half of the time and the microtransactions are ludicrously expensive. These elements can be improved however.

What has me extremely pessimistic toward the future of this game is that deckbuilding and gameplay are shallow and uninteresting and even with the game being in Early Access I don't believe it's going to change.
developer_response:
Hello Jolly hoop.

Thank you for the review and we appreciate all of the feedback and comments you've made here. Just to address some of the concerns that you're raised here:

1) Taking the strongest hero isn't always 100% applicable as you need to take into account both their abilities as well as their stats to build a team who can most effectively accomplish the objectives you face in each campaign. We can understand how this might be the impression that you get though and will take this feedback to heart.

We're sorry to hear that you're experiencing issues with the server. This is mostly because we are in Early Access and are making regular changes in order to improve the game. We are trying to ensure that there is a minimal impact on the player base as is possible.

Regarding the micro-transactions and costs, this is feedback we have taken to heart from the whole community and hope to be able to communicate something on this in the near future!

Regarding your last point, we are trying to continue to implement new cards, mechanics, heroes and campaigns that will enhance the experience further and make the deck building and gameplay even deeper. We hope that you'll continue to try out the game as we continue to make improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010955304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1332, 'last_played': 1694201122}
review: Very good for what it is: puzzly quests, variety in deck construction, good LotR atmosphere. The mechanics are very different from the physical game but it has the same feel and rewards experimentation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328540855', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1693755378}
review:
作为魔戒LCG的电子版，简化了部分游戏规则，更加适合在电脑和移动端进行操作。
游戏的画面和音乐水平都非常棒，看得出FFI第一次的作品还是下了很大功夫的。
网络方面，游戏服务器在美国，有些许延迟，但是裸连还是可以进行游戏的。
游戏中可以通过进行冒险和完成每日任务获得货币，进而购买游戏的PACK和合成卡牌。PACK中的卡牌是固定的，而其他卡牌只有通过抽取和合成获得。抽卡不会获得重复的卡，算是比较良心了。
目前的开发进度是修复BUG为主，9月份会有中文语言支持，明年初左右会有合作模式，非常期待！

author: {'steamid': '76561198008677596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1615143171}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034763916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 11072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3046, 'last_played': 1694271965}
review:
It's simple: if you like this type of game, which is a singleplayer deckbuilding card game with a bit of puzzles, there's nothing like it anywhere, I looked around.

The game is in early access, with about 1/3 of the content it'll have on release. In their first week, they demonstrated their effort to make this game as enjoyable as possible, listening to all the suggestions and complaints since day 1 (which you can read in other people's review). There still are bugs and issues, it is an early stage of early access. But if you like the concept of the game and you'd like to support it, this game is worth buying and it's already a lot of fun. It's going to be co-op and free to play on release, so it might be good to keep an eye on it for updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047282495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1642611508}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083699009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1667512025}
review:
Okay, can we get off of the Early Access BS? Even in EA the game should work. I paid to play a game, MAKE IT PLAYABLE. Can't connect to the server 60-70% of the time... why is this an issue? Why does it even need to connect to the server? It is a single-player, stand-alone game. This is sadly ridiculous.

I make an action and it takes 20-30+ seconds for the game to perform the action. Why?

I would love to talk about the gameplay, but the game is so frickin' slow and I can't finish a quest without server issues, so I really don't know how the game plays. I will say that even on "easy" mode, the game seems pretty hard. 

It may be a good game in the long-term, but for now, stay away from this mess until they fix the server issues.

[EDIT] So, I finally stayed connected long enough to play a quest. Are they serious on the difficulty for "easy" mode? I mean, not even coming close to beating the quest on easy. Wow... if that is "easy", I can't imagine how hard "normal" or "hard" mode must be. Too bad I've played too long to get a refund. For crying out loud, dial down the difficulty on "easy" mode for us rookies so I can actually feel like I have a chance. If they were hoping to appeal to the "casual" player... forget about it because of the diffcutly. [/end rant]

author: {'steamid': '76561198068783609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2139, 'last_played': 1572908030}
review:
First let's get two things out of the way:

1. Is the game too expensive to play right now for what it offers? It definitely is, but it's nowhere near Hearthstone levels, as some have suggested. To enjoy the game, you will probably have to spend some money, which in itself is fine (personally I'm tired of grindy f2p CCGs), it's just that right now you don't get as much value as you should for your money (to get all content the game has to offer right now, without grinding, will set you back around 70 USD). Note that expanding your collection is not based on random card packs like many other games, but rather on collecting Valor Points (a currency like gold in HS), which can in turn be spent on buying preset packs or singular cards. There are some tricks to get most value out of the current economy model (like buying all cheapest/low-rarity cards with Valor, so that you can get the most expensive cards from Palantir views), so keep that in mind. 

2. Does the game have enough content right now? Definitely not. There's currently one campaign available (takes around 2-2.5h to beat) and that's it. New campaigns are coming in the future, but I generally think the campaigns should be twice as long. The card pool is currently also quite small and even with full collection you are forced to take cards you don't really want to complete the deck.

With these two points out of the way, the game is really fun and I love it so far! The gameplay mechanics are satisfying and reward correct planning. The quests can be approached in several ways and the objectives can often also be resolved in different ways. I haven't played the physical version of this game (I only played other FFG LCGs - Android, Game of Thrones and Warhammer 40k: Conquest), so I can't say how it compares.
Some strategies are way more effective than others and some balancing will be needed for sure. Once you get a hold of the gameplay mechanics, the game is quite easy even on hard difficulty. It's also quite easy to exploit the AI, so this needs some work as well.

The game is pleasant to look at, it's not the prettiest card game around, but it's also by far not the ugliest. On the other hand, sound, voice-acting and music are really good. There are some connection issues that need to be resolved, but overall, the game is very polished for an early-access title.

Overall I recommend to try this game out. If you think the game is too expensive in its current state, wait some time and see how the economy gets adjusted. It looks like this will be addressed (and I hope it will, this is a niche game and I don't think they can afford to be greedy if they want it to survive in the long run). Most negative reviews here focus on the game a) not being the same as the original and b) being too expensive/not true LCG model, which are both valid points. I simply don't think the game should be discarded just because of that. There's a lot of potential here and with more content, balancing, stable connections and impoved AI this can prove to be the best PvE digital card game around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031534901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1535897973}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030496069', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1857, 'last_played': 1693234998}
review:
For Early Access, it's quite solid.

I bought the Steward of Gondor pack, and even back when the missions needed to be purchased with Valor, that was PLENTY to buy all the missoins, then beating said missions with each hero gave more valor and palantir views.  Using the valor for the hero packs, beating missions withy those heroes, gaining more valor, etc.  By the time I was done beating with each hero, I have all but 9 rare and 4 lenendary cards (this counts cards I am missing duplicates of) with 5 palantirs saved for the legendaries.

But people complained about the moentization (which I didn't think was that bad, honestly)

And they are making it MORE user friendly by giving all the missions in first campaign for free, and increasing the valor for running missions.

The dves are actively listening and replying.  Sure it has it's bugs, but it's a very solid game with active, responsive devs.  Easy to support IMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118573206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1633187692}
review: Réellement une bonne surprise. La rejouabilité est bonne et atteindre le meilleur score est un vrai challenge avec certains héros. J'ai pris le pack Istar à 27€ et je n'ai pas toutes les cartes mais c'est largement suffisant pour bien s'amuser, sachant que compte tenu du pool de cartes actuel, les communes et unco sont les cartes les plus puissantes du jeu. Ce n'est pas un jeu free to play, d'où le quiproquo dans les évaluations qui reprochent le modèle économique du jeu. Les développeurs sont en partie responsables : avec le ticket d'entrée minimum, vous avez simplement accès à une démo du jeu (avec un deck tout à fait correct). Il n'y a pas de grind possible excepté faire et refaire toujours la même quête avec le même deck : aucun intérêt d'où le degoût des joueurs qui ont acquis seulement le package de base.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030756698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2128, 'last_played': 1604993818}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966735121', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1605445040}
review:
Bon commençons par ce qui peut facher : 

- les règles simplifiées par rapport au support d'origine.
- le prix des articles en argent réel ou en argent in game, qui semble peut être un peu trop élevé. EDIT EN BAS DE PAGE

Pour le premier point, en effet certaines mécaniques sont simplifiées (par exemple les ressources par héros ont disparu), mais on retrouve tout de même les sensations du jeu de cartes. Une course contre la montre, des évenements aléatoires, des quêtes à remplir, la mécanique de jeu qui change en fonction de la quête... 

Pour le second, rien n'est figé semble t il. A surveiller donc, afin d'éviter de farmer comme des dingues les quêtes... 


Pour ce qui est du positif : 

- les sensations du jeu de plateau (avec des règles simplifiées certes). 
- pas d'installation de 20min avant de jouer. 
- intégralement traduit
- le mode coop qui va arriver!!



Je mets cette évaluation en positive, si je pouvais mettre une note, je dirai un 15/20 (EDIT : traduction est disponible, je monte ma note à 16/20).


Il mérite largement de s'y attarder. 


Allez, ça me redonne envie de ressortir le cycle 1!



EDIT : Beaucoup de choses ont changé. 
Le modèle économique déjà : le jeu devient un jeu payant. Terminé le F2P, le jeu sera payant. 
Ensuite les campagnes supplémentaires : le jeu propose gratuitement des nouvelles campagnes. Elles sont au nombre de deux actuellement. Enfin une campagne payante (composée de packs de cartes qui vont avec) est également proposée (10€). Alors oui, c'est couteux. 

MAIS! Ils ont modifié le système économique ingame. Le prix des cartes a été harmonisé. Ainsi les cartes ne sont plus "communes, peu communes, inhabituelles, rares, légendaires", mais uniquement "pas légendaires ou légendaires".
Enfin, le gain de points a également été revu : on gagnera des points en fonction de l'avancée dans la campagne même si celle ci n'a pas été accomplie jusqu'au bout, des défis de quêtes seront disponibles afin d'augmenter le nombre de points perçus, et finir une quête avec un héros pour la première fois apportera également des points (incitant les joueurs à faire la quête plusieurs fois mais avec des personnages différents). De quoi pouvoir récupérer des cartes bien plus facilement. 


Je me suis remis au jeu, je le trouve bien mieux qu'à la sortie, qui était quelque peu chaotique (on ne savait pas vraiment où l'on allait). Mais là ils semblent avoir une ligne directrice qui peut les mener à un très bon jeu. 

Je vous le conseille toujours, plus encore qu'il y a six mois.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994011141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1569687345}
review:
This isn't really LotR LCG. At least not the one I played in its paper form. Sure, it shares some of mechanics with the tabletop variant, but at the same time it misses or extensively modifies a number of fundamental gameplay elements. Questing, engagement, combat - all are either very different or missing completely. The level of randomness seems higher too, with enemy attacks not following any predictable pattern.

This doesn't necessarily make the digital version worse, but it certainly makes it different enough to the point where calling it LotR LCG stretches the reality of the situation a little too much for my taste.

I encountered few obvious bugs in the few hours I managed to play, although some effect interactions seemed a little hazy.

The lack of borderless fullscreen is a little annoying.

No opinion on the monetization model - far to early to judge the value of points you're given, or the overall price of the whole experience compared to the paper variant.

As of the 2nd of September, the backened of the game is in shambles. There's really no other way to put it. Of the nearly 13 hours with the game, I've spent maybe half of it actually playing, and the rest repeatedly hitting the play button only to be greeted with the same connection error notification.

This has some potential to be a decent product filling a unique niche on the market, even if it's not the game I expected it to be. I'd advise to wait at least until the backend is fixed before buying in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006652326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 3333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1684545178}
review:
A very enjoyable adventure card game. I'm glad to see the overall positive rating percent climb higher every day since release (I've been monitoring it to decide on buying in). After watching how positively the developers have handled the first days after release, I was impressed enough to jump in and support a game I have been eagerly awaiting. The voice acting and campaign story are outstanding so far...keep it up FFI.
I am really looking forward to the addition of co-op so I can play with my wife and son (hopefully there will be a pass-and-play style we can use with our steam link).
One suggestion for the early going would be to add a bit of randomness to the starting creatures/events for each section of the chapters to keep things more interesting for multiple playthroughs.

Thanks devs

author: {'steamid': '76561197977556624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1702434006}
review: As a fan of the tabletop game, I'm very happy to see that this isn't a straight adaptation of that version. Instead, it takes elements of the TT game and aspects of other digital card games and creates something unique. As expected from an early access game, there are bugs and balancing issues, but nothing detrimental. The presenation is great, with a clean UI and great graphics/audio, although I wish some of the game information and rules were presented in a more natural way. I am excited to see where the game goes from here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960293236', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1551143432}
review:
Un juego de cartas diferente.

El LCG de El Señor de los Anillos es, en su versión física, uno de los pocos juegos de cartas coleccionables cooperativos que existen. En esta conversión se han simplificado muchas cosas y otras directamente se han cambiado, pero seguimos teniendo un juego con mecánicas diferentes y un gran respeto por el tema en el que está inspirado. El arte (que por desgracia no se puede apreciar del todo por los marcos estilo Heartstone) es excelente y la presentación de esta versión digital es muy buena a nivel audiovisual.

Tiene ciertos problemas de conexión y unos cuantos fallos en la interfaz (las cartas vinculadas a veces no se visualizan correctamente) pero es de asumir que esto mejorará a lo largo del early access. La base jugable es muy buena y considero que el juego merece, tras los cambios en la limitación de valor y por el hecho de desbloquear la campaña entera, una valoración mejor de la que tiene ahora en esta página. Muchas críticas negativas tenían sin duda bastante razón al criticar el modelo de pago pero los cambios que se han introducido en los últimos días son en la dirección correcta y, como amante del juego original, creo que esta versión digital merece una oportunidad. 

Si te gusta el Señor de los Anillos y los juegos de cartas, deberías por lo menos probarlo. Si no ahora, cuando salga como free to play. A mí ya me ha dado unas cuantas horas de diversión.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992200939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1474, 'last_played': 1562523681}
review:
I'm a huge fan of the physical card game and Tolkein lore in general so I've been anticipating the digital version since it's announcement. I purchased the Mithril Founder's pack so I could get the most out of the Early Access.

[Edit] Connection issues have been fixed.

The gameplay feels great. It's pretty much exactly what I expected and wanted from a digital adaptation. Its not the same as the physical game, but it kind of scratches the itch when I dont want to set up a table to play the physical game. But I definitely recommend this game to someone who hasn't ever played the physical version.

Most people are complaining about the microtransactions. This isn't a problem if you bought the full mithril edition. There is clearly a problem with the current free-to-play model. The easiest solution is to just scale back the grind for free to play users, but in my opinion the devs should simply have a set price for the core set + first campaignt + some valor and palantir views to get started. The game wont be free to play but for like $20-$30 it would still be worthwhile. 

Slay the Spire for example, is kind of a similar style game and seems to be quite successful without free-to-play. You buy the game upfront and unlock stuff as you play, both by leveling up the different characters and expanding their "card pool", and during each run you can also gain special items to synergize with your deck. 

If LOTR did this, the Valor system can stay in place for players to play and earn future cards and campaigns. No need to rebalance valor, just put a higher pricetag on the game with some good perks to start and no one will be disappointed by a free game that isnt really that free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030601119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2448, 'last_played': 1621016297}
review:
Early Accesben már értékeltem egyszer a játékot, ugyanakkor az early alatt több nagyobb lélegzetvételű változás is történt, amely indokolttá teszi az újraértékelést. Emlékeztetőül a játék célja, hogy 3 választott hősünk köré épült paklival győzzük le Sauron gép által irányított erőit egyedül vagy egy társ oldalán. Ezután lássuk a főbb változásokat.
1.	Megváltozott a játék címe: A játék a  Fantasy Fligth Games tengerentúlon igencsak népszerű The Lord of the Rings kártyajátékát vette alapul, ugyanakkor  a fejlesztők célja  nem a fizikai kiadás 100%-os lemásolása volt, ezt jelzi hogy a játék címe is megváltozott az idők folyamán . (Adventure Game) Fontos megjegyezni, hogy a korai negatív kritikák egy része a már említett kártyajátékkal való összehasonlítgatásból származik/származott, noha a fejlesztők kezdettől fogva jelezték, hogy nem puszta adaptáció a céljuk,
2.	Modell váltás: A játék free to playból egy hibrid megoldásra váltott. Az alapjáték tartalmát (12 hős, alap kártyakészlet, játék során unlockolható lapok, training és 1. kampány) megvásárolható kampányokkal lehet bővíteni, amely újabb küldetéssorozatot és újabb hősöket tartalmaz( jelenleg 1 ilyen elérhető). A dlc-k mellett azonban ingyenes tartalmak is találhatóak, amelyek száma folyamatosan bővül majd. Új unlockolható kártyák, illetve speciális, pakliépítő képességet megpróbáló úgynevezett encounter küldetések. Mindezen túl az újabb dlc kampányok első küldetései minden alapjáték birtokló számára elérhető.
3.	Multiplayer: A játék az egyszemélyes játékon túl coopetative módban is játszható. Korábban hiányoztak azok a lehetőségek, amelyekkel „kommunikálni” lehet a másik játékossal, megnehezítve az együttműködést. Mostanra ez pótlásra került. Ugyancsak üdítő változás a mentési rendszer bevezetése mivel egy-egy meccs igencsak eltud húzódni, de különösen hasznos akkor is ha a szerver úgy dönt, hogy a küldetés megnyerése előtt 1 másodperccel ledob :D (Eddig ritkán fordult elő)  Pozitív dolog, hogy multiplayerben kipróbálhatod azokat a kampányokat  is amelyekkel nem rendelkezel, amennyiben olyannal játszol akinek az már megvan.

Összességében úgy gondolom, hogy a fejlesztők kihasználták a korai hozzáférésben rejlő lehetőségeket és hallgatva a játékos visszajelzésekre egy érdekes kártyajátékot dobtak össze, amely a divatos áramlatokkal szemben nem az ellenség legyőzésére, hanem az együttműködésre fókuszál. Mindezt megfejelni a  The Lord of the Rings világának hangulata, amelyben öröm elveszni.  Egyedül talán a free to play modell elvetésével nem értek teljesen egyet, mivel nagyobb tömegeket ismertethettek meg volna egy remek koncepcióval. A hibrid módban is megvan a lehetőség, ugyanakkor jelenleg talán kicsit túl van árazva a produktum. Az alapjáték megéri a maga 20 euróját a bővülő ingyenes tartalmak miatt, (kicsit azért ez is lehetne olcsóbb) ugyanakkor a dlc-k 10 eurós árát picit lehetne csökkenteni, hogy jobban motiválják a játékosokat a maradásra/esetleg visszatérésre
Számomra a játék egy üdítő színfolt a mai kártyajátékok tengerében a kihívást jelentő pakliépítés (rengeteg lehetőséggel) és az együttműködésre épülő multi miatt. Ennek tetejében unalmas óráimban egyedül is jót tudok szórakozni rajta. 8/10

When the game was in EA I already wrote a review, but since then the game underwent some bigger changes that warrant a new review. Just a reminder about the game’s goal: you have to defeat Sauron’s forces (controlled by AI) with your deck that is built around 3 chosen heroes. We can do it alone or with the help of a friend. Let’s see the noteworthy changes:

1.	The game’s title was changed: the game is based on the famous The Lord of the Rings cardgame by Fantasy Flight Games, but the developers goal wasn’t a 100% copy – the title’s change is supposed to reflect on that (Adventure Game). It’s important to notice that the majority of early negative criticism was based on the comparison of the two games, although the developers stated early on that their aim is not a 1:1 adaption.
2.	Change in the monetization model: the game went from f2p to a hybrid solution. The base game’s content (12 heroes, basic set of cards, unlockable cards, training and the first campaign) can be extended through buyable campaigns (currently 1 available), which unlock new quests and heroes. Beside DLC the game is updated with free content too: unlockable cards and special encounters which test your deckbuilding ability. Every new campaign-dlc’s first quests are available to everyone.
3.	Multiplayer: the game can be played in co-op too. Earlier you couldn’t communicate with your partner, which made the cooperation harder. Now you can. Another positive change was the implementation of a save-mechanism, because a match can be really long, and it’s useful when the server decides to drop you a second before the win:D (it happened only a few times). In multiplayer you can play dlc quests too, if your partner has bought them but you didn’t.
To summarize: I think the developers used the purpose of EA and polished the game according to the players feedback and made a good game not about defeating your enemy, but about cooperation. It's a joy to journey in the world and atmosphere of The Lord of the Rings. I just think that the game should have stayed f2p, so that more people can try it. The hybrid model has it’s potential, but the game is currently overpriced. The base game is worth 20 euros thanks to the free updates (although it could be somewhat cheaper), but the dlc’s 10 euro price tag should be lower, players would be more motivated to stay or to come back.
For me the game is a nice change in today’s card game scene because of it’s challenging deck building with vast options and the multiplayer that is based on cooperation. Beside all that I enjoy the game playing alone too. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198181721170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1603127426}
review: It obviously is an Early Access product with the bugs and unpolishedness that brings along, but I already do enjoy its current state quite a lot. And after a couple of days (and also in the months before EA) the developers have proven to be very responsive and listen to community feedback, which is awesome and exactly how Early Access should be. Certainly a lot of potential and I am quite optimistic that we will have a fantastic game after EA, but I can already recommend it in its current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021528129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1982, 'last_played': 1572036028}
review: Je trouve la plupart des évaluation trés dure avec le jeu. Le concept est intéressant , pour un jeu de carte online on est très loin d'un jeu casual et contrairement à ce qu'on lit dans beaucoup d'évaluation en dehors de l'aspect graphique le jeu n'a rien à voir avec hearthstone. Pour ce qui est des microtransactions je trouve aussi qu'il est étrange de payer pour les missions ET les cartes mais il est finalement assez simple de farmer la monnaie du jeu ( bien plus simple que dans tout les TCG online que j'ai testé d'ici là ). Un reproche qu'on pourrait faire actuellement serait le cardpool trop retreint et le faible nombre de mission mais il s'agit d'un early access donc c'est pardonnable

author: {'steamid': '76561198040584954', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1606971868}
review: Early access opened with a few hiccups, but I believe the developers are actively listening to feedback and making the right changes to the games monetization system. I have to believe a lot of the negative reviews are due purely to the previous iteration of the game’s micro transaction system (which has been changed), because other than that this game has incredible potential and I’m addicted to the core gameplay! I recommend anyone to try it out for themselves. You can buy in for only $8 right now, which isn’t bad at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046487463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1648312442}
review:
Purchased the cheapest founders pack (Shire back when it launched) to try the game out early, and then eventually upgraded to Mithral Bundle (when was still available) to get more ingame currency to spend later on.

Devs have been giving plenty of content, including free content since the launch, and the the game has been progressing in the look and feel aspect greatly while in the early access. More expansions have been announced and another free content pack is on the way, so I feel there's now enough space to experiment with different decks builds and heroes.

The game went through two overhauls related to game economy and all the way from F2P to an expansion based one. For some of the players the decisions were unwelcome but I found the way devs compensated for changes to be quite nice and appropriate.

Didn't have much time to play lately, so difficult to say more on gameplay and multiplayer, but what I felt was that focus has shifted significantly from grinding at initial launch to more thoughtful deck construction these days.

My hat off to developers for communication and hard work to make the game better and more enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993324684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1557317707}
review:
Early access review so will be back to change points on full release..
bought the early access shire  lowest option. $7ish
3 days in 3 quest in 3 decks in,


My Opinion comments :

1 I like it.. its similar enough to the TT 
2 there is no shuffling or record keeping or deck changing that slowed the TT down .. you swiftly go between scenarios and quests and even quick tweek your own deck..
 3 i never feel i played the TT correctly as its easy to skip over look powers and rules ...the computer keeps me covered here.
4 in the TT game i often played on easy mode.. hard card taken out and extra starting resources.. ive not check whats different in easy and normal on here.. but have only completed the digital versions on easy and normal so far.. 
5 it take a few goes to get used to the tutorial is not covering everything right now.. early access but you pick it up and find out with trail an error no big loss .. failing to guard out the gate is a big no once you have that system down your good to go..
6 only 3 quests in voice acting.. nice but skip past once heard once.. and often have my own soundtrack on.. didnt feel the ingame one was as stiring as Howard Shore score from the films ..or  Bruhnville on youtube... i guess if it was missing entirely its would be a negative.. 
7. they started with you only get the quest valor once a day.. they have since reviewed and removed this.. 
8. the start package only gave you 1 quest .. asking you to they pay to unlock more they have currently reviewed this and anyone you paid money to unlock quest will get a 4000 valour refund..sometime between now and next week maybe...
9 already netdecking  if you struggle like me you can se other people deck ideas on facebook and forums. playing them does not guarantee a win you need to know how to pilot the deck and game too 
10. co-op is to come.

It would be great on a tablet not sure on time scale here.. 

over all enjoyed it hope its successfully and see many more quests

author: {'steamid': '76561197986409593', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3471, 'last_played': 1646379309}
review:
Firstly, do not come into this game expecting a copy of the board game with the same name, this game is very different.
That said, I enjoy this game a lot. It is quite casual where each session is 20-40 minutes of solid card play, though it is solo only ATM but CO-OP is planed. 
The look is very similar to Hearthstone, but there is where the similarities end. This game is an action based game, each player alternate taking one action each, this makes the game more reactive and IMO interesting. Card and mana gain is also different, you get a set amount of cards and mana each round. 
The monetization has been criticised quite a lot, and the price is a bit steep, 2$ for each mission and per new hero with some cards. This adds up quite fast. That said, I don't have a huge problem with it, it is possible to earn in-game credit to buy all the stuff.
I hope this continues to be developed in a good direction, and I am sure it will turn out great at the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038935837', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2557, 'last_played': 1588074672}
